reviewText: I can only express "Meh" for the taste and consistency.  Dole or Del Monte canned fruit cocktails (tropical or regular) are better for a special event.  Good for everyday serving to family, because it's an organic product.

Black mustard seeds can be found in only in specialized and ethnic stores. India stores always have it. An indispensable ingredient in Asian cooking, Indian cuisine uses it in various ways. It is sautéed in hot oil until it pops and then other ingredients like vegetables are added. It is a pungent, heating, and somewhat bitter herb. Its black color adds to the look and appeal of curries, and it is anti-vata, according to Ayurveda. In the hot Indian pickles, the powder or whole seeds are added for taste and as a preservative. Available in stores for a much lower price.
love the flavor, will buy again in the future.

I've purchased this product for years.  Due to some physical limitations, there are days when I just can't mess with meal preparation.  The reduced fat product is still tasty- and I actually like the flavor better, as it's not greasy. The protein content is very important, and with 21 grams per serving, this makes for the base of a decent meal.  A side vegetable, and I'm good to go, and don't end up with a lot of pain from repetitive motion.  If you like canned hash, this is a good bet !!

These cookies are great and easily transportable since they come in packages of three cookies each.  We use them as school snacks and my daughters' friends also enjoy them, never knowing they are gluten free.

In a word: FABULOUS! I meant to make a graham cracker crust out of these, but wound up eating the whole box (in more than one sitting, mind you LOL). They are simply fantastic with a little Pilsbury Creamy Supreme Cream Cheese Frosting on them (also gluten-free). Yum. Can't wait to get more so I can try the crust, smores....if I can refrain from eating them all again! You won't be disappointed! Feels a bit like cheating if you're a celiac, IMHO. And for those of you with dairy allergies, it says right on the box dairy free, casein free. Yay!
This is one of the better K cups flavors.  It makes a "good" cup of coffee as many of my guests tell me and some go back for a "few cups" more.  Very satisfying when others agree with your choice.

These cookies are alright, except that once you are finished you may notice an aftertaste and I think this is due to the cookies containing too much allspice.  The cookies also contain cinnamon, which does not leave an aftertaste.

Like a lot of similar bars, a heavy taste, very solid and natural.  I prefer granola bars but this was a decent change of pace.  And I'm partial to cashews.  A better-than-most entree in the organic snack/energy bar field.

*****These apple chips are tart, very crispy, and yummy! They don't have the processed or chemically taste that some dried apples have. They also are not soggy at all--I like my apple chips very crispy! They are 100% certified organic, baked with no added sugar, no preservatives or chemicals, no pesticides or herbicides, gluten free, and made from Washington State apples with five apples in every bag. These are a truly healthy and delicious snack.These particular chips are only just barely sweet, mostly tart. If you want sweet apple chips, you can buy Fuji apple chips from the same company that are just as crisp and good. I like to mix both together for a sweet-tart combo.I would also recommend buying these chips in smaller bags (the 2.6 ounce size) unless quite a few people are going to be eating these rather quickly. The reason is that exposure to moisture can render these crispy chips too soft. I like buying them in the smaller bags and then repackaging them in a resealable plastic bag to get rid of all of the extra air. Then I take out only what I plan to eat and quickly reseal the bag. My chips are always crispy this way.Highly recommended.*****
summary: Delicious Tart and Crispy Chips, A Wholesome Snack

reviewText: I love WOW cookies and feel they are better than their 'wheat' counterparts by far. I have really never been a fan of oatmeal cookies until I tried these...all I can say is they are better than any I have ever made or eaten and that includes my mom's which are really good. One of the reasons I've never really liked oatmeal cookies is because most have raisins in them, which I do not like, but these have soft cranberries instead. The taste and texture is fantastic and you would NEVER know they were not made with wheat flour. Another soft and delicious cookie from WOW! Gotta love the name which stands for With Out Wheat.
summary: Best oatmeal cookies I've ever eaten!

reviewText: I have used this product but I do not think it is true Kefir. Kefir is propagated by Kefir grains, a mix of live bacteria and yeast that form grains. I found Kefir grains and have been using them lately. I like the grains much better.
I am not sure if these really are a sweetner or not. they do not ruin the the taste of anything either. I tried with my coffee and did not improve the flavor or change-it in any way.

This hearty full flavored tea is soul satisfying and will almost make you sigh with its depth of flavor and its subtle kiss of lemon. This Higgins & Burke tea is soothing to wrap yourself around and snuggle up to or to get you up and out and going.It's a perfect tea to share with friends for a comfort talk or a deep discussion.It's a perfect companion as you ponder the fate of the planet.If more people drank this tea there would be no more war or crime or divorce.It's that good.

Haven't had 'hot' chocolate bar before this, so nothing to compare to. However, the dark chocolate is very good (rich but not overly sweet) and the 'hot' flavor kicks in a few seconds later. Noticeably hot but I didn't find it too hot to overpower the chocolate.The one comparison I can make is to a local store's hand-dipped chocolate datil pepper. The chocolate is sweet with little taste and the datil is extremely hot. They do not go well together.

I've been using Raw Meal for about 10 weeks.I always wondered why so many complained about the taste.I never had a problem with the taste... Until yesterday.Yesterday I discovered there's a HUGE (flavor+texture) difference between 1 scoop & 2 scoops.I've been only adding 1 scoop to my morning drink.I did this mostly to save $ and make the product last longer.Upon adding the 2nd scoop, my usually tasty shake became this thick, nasty, almost chewy, hard to swallow-- nightmare.Needless to say...I'm back to adding only 1 scoop Raw Meal with 8 oz. almond milk+ 1/2 banana & a handful of assorted berries (fresh or frozen)+ 1-2 ice cubes. BlendedThe above recipe works for meI feel betterhave more energy throughout my daylost about 8 lbs.This is one case where, If I had followed directions (recommended serving)-- I'd be writing a negative product review right now.

I like my coffee with a fuller flavor and Community Dark Roast fits the bill. It brews up with a slightly nutty taste and is fuller bodied than name brands. Priced well and makes a satisfying addition to the cupboard.
I love these bars. Great snack. Will have one when I get hungry in the middle of the day or late afternoon it keeps me from eating too much junk food.

The bag came and it was huge but I a guessing it was because it was shipped it had a bunch of broken pieces in it. The crackers themselves tasted just like any other rice crackers but I really didnt like the crumbs

I admit I was ready to not like this little meal.  The description made it seem like tasteless rabbit food but what a wonderful surprise, it was delicious!  The sunflower seed butter was the real surprise for me, it was like what peanut butter is supposed to taste like.  And lo and behold, was full even before I got to the cookie!  I'm going too buy a bunch of these and keep them in my office.  I can't wait to try the other ones!

Jerky doesn't always get inbetween my teeth but every bite of this does.  The consistency is just right i the goldylocks zone.  Too soft and it sinks into the teeth and breaks when you try to pull it out with finger or tongue and too solid to chew light enough to keep the pressure off.In addition to each one being a mandatory floss- they make only good dog treats (though probably not healthy at all) but flavor is uneventful for human.
summary: Hard on teeth and greesy flavor

reviewText: I asked my spouse if he wanted me to buy any graham crackers.  He said no.  I bought these.  Guess who eats them!  I have to hide some for me.  Not only are these healthy, but they are delicious.
summary: Great Snack for the Whole Family

reviewText: This is a healthier option to eating on the run, or just a quick pick-me-up between meals.  My toddler loves this kind.  It's easy to open, has BPA free packaging, and the kids can hold it and suck it straight from the package.  Love these little "smoothie pouches" as we call them.

It just tastes like salt.  I didn't taste a cilantro flavor.  It would be better to pick up some fresh cilantro at the grocery store or use something likeSimply Organic Cilantro Certified Organic, 0.78-Ounce Container.The main ingredients listed on the Knorr Minicubes box are salt and monosodium glutamate (MSG).There is a lot to dislike about MSG.  SeeThe Truth About Aspartame, MSG and Excitotoxins. Here is a short segment from the book:Mike Adams: I'm here with Dr. Russell Blaylock, and I'd like to explore some of the more advanced aspects of some of the things you are working on. Dr. Blaylock, I think readers know the basics of both MSG and aspartame, but can you review what you've already written about excitotoxins?Dr. Russell Blaylock: I have three books. The first one is the exeitotoxin book, "Exeitotoxins:The Taste That Kills," and the latest one is and updated paperback reprint of "Health and Nutrition Secrets That Can Save Your Life." The third one is "Natural Strategies for Cancer Patients," which is directed at nutritional treatments for cancer. It contains some material about aspartame and MSG.  Excitotoxins have been found to dramatically promote cancer growth and metastasis. In fact, one excitotoxin researcher noticed that, when cancer cells were exposed to glutamate, they became more mobile, and you see the same effect with MSG. It also causes a cancer cell to become more mobile, and that enhances metastasis, or spread. These MSG-exposed cancer cells developed all of these pseudopodia and started moving through tissues, which is one of the earlier observations from cancer.
summary: Just tastes like salt.  Also includes MSG, which is something you should avoid

reviewText: Boyfriend was really disappointed that there were only red fish, two hundred and forty red fish. I like the red ones so I was pleased. Tasted exactly how I remembered them tasting - yummy. Like that they are individually wrapped. Easy to take with you  or give to friends and it keeps you from eating too many in one sitting.
summary: Was expecting a variety of colors

reviewText: It is difficult to find high quality, pure cranberry juice, but this is it. It tastes very bitter, but that's one of the ways you know you've got the real thing. It's kind of expensive, but if you can chug this bitter drink down I don't know what to tell you. For most people this will last a long time. If you're looking for taste, look elsewhere, but if you're looking for the health benefits of real unadulterated cranberry juice, this is what you want.

These candies are the BEST THING ON EARTH!!! They're even better after a few days when they've settled at a little above room temp- the caramel just glides onto your tongue once you break the shell. There's nothing else like these chocolates, and I have a hard time sharing them, lol.
summary: Definately order these during cold weather!!

reviewText: I have tried so may vegan protein powders on the market - Isagenix Berry (their only vegan flavor), Vega, Plant Fusion, and Perfect Fit just to name a few that stood out from the rest. I like Raw Meal for the nutritional profile, the fact that it contains no animal products, the taste of the Vanilla Spiced Chai, and that it keeps me satisfied for about 4 hours. I use one scoop, 7-ish ice cubes, 1/2-ish cup coconut milk, and water in my Vitamix. To that mixture, I sometimes add 1/3 cup pumpkin puree and some cinnamon for a pumpkin chai latte smoothie. Even without the pumpkin, I think the flavor is a more subtle chai, probably because I use more liquid than it calls for.The texture can be a little chalky, which could use some improving. In order to avoid my whole mouth feeling like that, I use a smoothie straw. The addition of the coconut milk seemed to help improve the texture as well. If Garden of Life could improve the texture, it would be a 5-star product.
summary: Great flavor, but a little chalky

reviewText: These were pretty good. Not great, but pretty good. The texture was good, as far as soft cookies go. They were soft, but still held together in the package and when you removed them from the package. The flavor was stronger and more chocolatey than the "megafudge"  version of this cookie, which I also sampled. They were not gooey, in spite of the name of the cookie, but I see that as a benefit.The cookies come in the resealable package, which works very well and I like.I probably would not buy these cookies in the store, but did like them well enough to eat several for dessert on the day I opened up the package.

reviewerName: Peggy Bowes "Author of The Rosary Workout"
reviewText: When I received my sample packet as an Amazon Vine reviewer, my kids (13 year-old boy and 12 year-old girl) instantly ripped it open and dived in.  I was barely able to get 2 pieces to sample myself before they disappeared.  We all really enjoyed this little snack.  My daughter liked the fact that they were healthy but really delicious.  She thought they would be a good snack for kids who are picky eaters.  My son appreciated the fact that Sharkies were soft and didn't interfere with his braces.  He added that they "tasted natural and not fake."  I liked the sugary coating on the chews as well as the soft texture, unlike so many of the fruit chew snacks that you have to literally gnaw on to eat.  They also don't have a chemical aftertaste as other brands sometimes do.  At 140 calories, these should probably be limited to one package, although it would be easy to eat 2 or even 3.  They do contain 100% recommended Vitamin C and are made with organic ingredients.  Both my children begged me to buy these at the store for snacks and school lunches.  Definitely a hit in our family!

I expected a popcorn topper, and didn't realize that the main use of this product is as a popcorn popping flavored oil. It's probably because the product title indicates "shakers." This is definitely not a shaker because it's oil! Kernel Season's Movie Theater Butter can also be used as a topping, but I didn't care for it as such. It tasted more oily/greasy than buttery, and quite a bit was required to coat a bowl of popcorn - at least four tablespoons, which come at a very high calorie price! If it tasted like actual movie theater butter it would be a price I'd be willing to pay once in a blue moon, but it's just not that tasty. I only use microwave popcorn, so I have a limited use for this product. I plan to follow some of the product suggestions listed here so that I can give the oil a fair tryout. I received two bottles but one was unsealed and leaking - thank heaven Amazon's packaging was excellent and each bottle was wrapped in a protective heavy plastic zipper bag!
Good price for 3 bottles of excellent rice vinegar for making sushi rice.Will most likely be buying some again fairly soon.

I was looking for a more economical option to the Silver Palate Oatmeal brand, which is great oatmeal but ridiculously expensive. As far as I'm concerned, this product is every bit as good, and much more reasonably priced. It keeps it's consistency after cooking (as opposed to the tendency of standard grocer store brands to get mushy) as long as you don't overcook it. (I simply microwave this with enough water to barely cover the oatmeal for 1.5 minutes.) I often thrown in a small handful of pecans or other nuts, frozen or fresh blueberries and/or other fruit. Voila! A delicious hot, nutritious and filling breakfast.

I think this product is absolutely great. I just gulped down 16 ounces of water flavored with one of these Lipton Tea&Honey; packets and I really loved it!But, then again, mango is one of my favorite flavors. Pineapple is in there, too, but I think the mango stands out. Either way, it tastes delicious.You just empty one of the long, narrow packets into 16.9-ounces of water -- either a bottle (and shake well) or a glass (and stir well). I used a glass of water, but will try it in a bottle of water on my next long, hot walk.Packets are scored, so they're easy to open -- a real plus -- and easy to pour into either a bottle or a glass.Sweetened with honey, made from real tea leaves and real fruit flavors. Ingredients: honey granules (sugar, honey), citric acid, green tea powder, sucralose, maltodextrin, hibiscus extract, natural flavor, beta carotene (for color). (NO aspartame.)Calories 5. Zero Fat. Zero Sodium. Sugars 1g. Vitamin A 10%. 10mg caffeine per 8 fl oz serving (2 servings/packet).Lipton, you've got a winner here! Great product!UPDATE: The day after writing this review, I filled up a 33.8 ounce bottle with water, poured in ONE packet of "To Go Stix" and took it on a 6-hour road trip. Flavor and sweetness held up well in twice the amount of recommended liquid and the drive didn't seem nearly as long as usual.
I can't say enough good stuff about this product.  It is so cute and comes in a nice little bamboo box/chest.  The blooming tea is a cool product and it tastes good too!
summary: Wonderful gift for a tea drinker!

reviewText: Let me preface this review by saying that I never used coffee primarily as a CNS stimulant. I always favored caffeinated coffee because it tastes better. I also always liked my coffee creamed, sweetened, and preferably flavored as mocha, french vanilla, hazelnut, etc. The one exception for me was Guatemalan coffee, which I preferred unflavored with cream and sweetener.That being said, I have tried Ayurvedic, Teeccino (Maya and Mocha), and Roastaroma as coffee substitutes. I had no desire to try Pero or Cafix, since they are designed to mimic straight coffee, which I do not prefer anyway.For a straight coffee substitute, I think Ayurvedic is the best: smooth, dark, and healthful. But a little pricier than the others.Teeccino is very good, but tends to brew with a lot of sediment in the cup and makes for a messy cleanup after brewing.I have settled on Roastaroma because it is cheap, tastes better than any of the others in my opinion, and is mindlessly easy to make.Two bags in a 15 oz. mug and hot water. Steep, throw away the bags, and cream and sweeten to taste. Voilá! It has a very smooth, cinnamon nutty cocoa taste. Really fine!I don't miss coffee one tiny bit!Thanks, Celestial Seasonings!'Tis da bomb!
summary: If you can't drink coffee, drink roastaroma!

reviewText: I pour this oil on my cooked pasta; I fry my eggs in it.  I use it for everything that calls for butter or margarine.It's superb olive oil.

This is great syrup. Best price and taste. After trying a couple other brands I find I keep coming back to this one. I'll be just ordering this one from now on as long as it's available. I just came here to order some, and it seems it's unavailable due to someones issues. I do hope they get it back soon. I will hold out as long as I can.

I much prefer the taste of plain water or maybe water with a little lemon in it to this product at least in the sweet tea flavor.  To me just a little bit of the liquid made the water taste flat and odd while adding more made it sickeningly sweet.  It does come in a cute little container and I appreciate that it doesn't need to be refrigerated and is perhaps less messy than powdered drinks.  But otherwise I am unimpressed.
summary: What's Wrong With Just Drinking Water?

reviewText: I like the original pop chips, and I love tortilla chips, so when I saw this product I thought it would be a slam dunk.  But no.  These chips taste very....off.  They taste like no other tortilla chip I've ever tasted.  Nor do they taste like the original pop chips.  They have an odd cardboard texture with a weird aftertaste.  I would avoid this stuff.
Love the Smoked salmon Trio,  Great flavor, perfect sizes to snack on!  Go well with Crackers or just on its own!

Overall, this product is a great idea. Portable, doesn't need to be refrigerated, low calorie, gluten free. However...this is the worst tasting hummus I have ever had in my entire life. The chocolate was crushed and resembled taffy. The trail mix is good, as are the crackers, especially considering they're gluten free. I purchased this six pack for around $18. At the current price ($29), I don't think I would purchase these at around $5 a piece - just get together some gluten free snacks and put them together in your own lunch kit.
summary: A good portable gluten free lunch option

reviewText: See's is the best!!!!!!!!!! This was a gift for my daughter and her friend, who live in Florida. No see's store there, so they really appreciate it!!!!!!
This is my husband's favorite decaf coffee.  We like ordering so as not to run out of it during midweek.

The first thing you notice when you pour a bowl of this cereal is how many berries that there are. There had to be at least 2 berries for every spoonful. For someone who has been disappointed in the past with the scarce amount of fruit in cereals that advertise fruit, it came as a pleasant surprise. The cereal flakes themselves are anything but wimpy. They provide a hard crunch and must be chewed as milk does not soften them much. Some will love this, others may be put off by it. All in all a very flavorful cereal. They have a winner with this one.

UPDATE: somewhere near the bottom of the first can, single and only stone. not everyone's teeth are expecting it.wishing the same company made the equivalent in black olives. these gren ones are simply that tasty.on the minus side, why the need for BPA lined cans? sorry, your product is healthy and delicious, but don't expect me to buy again.
summary: delicious. salty but not oily. bpa and random stone, means no re-order

reviewText: Perfect seasoning for sauces, gravies, sups, stir-fry, too.  Organic, with no added chemicals like you suspect those bouillon cubes have, no bad aftertaste.  Really adds depth to home cooking.
summary: Organic, non-chemical, no bad or bitter aftertaste like bouillon cubes

reviewText: Personally I don't drink coffee because all the orange prana in it is too strong for my digestive system, if you catch my drift.  For me those intense orange pranas are best used in a salt bath to help detoxify my entire energy body of dirty prana.Works like a charm!!  Highly recommended!

reviewerName: Bartok Kinski "A casual stroll through the lu...
reviewText: I met Huy Fong Spiracha in Thailand where he works as a short order cook at the Thaksin Shinawatra restaurant. He introduced me to his Hot Chili Sauce. It's Hotter than Hot Hot Hot Hot but adds a nice taste to most rotten boiled eggs, cow brain, dead fish, or raw yak meat.Gives plenty of fire to dead squid too! Yum!

These K-cups arrived in a timely fashion but when I've tried using them at all 3 size settings none of them are strong enough. It seems there is not enough coffee in them. I wrote a complaint to Van Houtte and they did not respond...So I've got nearly 50 cups that when brewed smell like chocolate raspberry but taste like water. Not happy.

Its a perfect bar nutritionally. nuts, some dried fruit, agave syrup, and nothing else. Fat contents (70 out of 190 calories are from fat) are a bit higher than I desire because of cashew nuts. Taste of dates is more predominating than cherries. Personally, I would prefer to eat the nuts and dried fruits by themselves...no need for turning them into bar, fancy packaging and environmental impact caused by the process.
summary: Healthful ingredients in their raw form

reviewText: I received a normal sized box of this cereal in the mail and within 2 daysIt was gone! My 2 children devoured it. I'll be goin to get more because theyLike it so well.

I have been trying to eat better and am switching from some of the foods I used to eat to healthier choices.  While fresh fruits and vegetables are wonderful, sometimes I really just need that sweet treat.  I also have a teenage daughter who packs her lunch or dinner on long marching band days and I wanted a healthier alternative for her.These peanut butter cookies are GREAT!  They are very similar to the girl scout cookies that I grew up on (and continue to adore).  Wonderful flavor, all-natural ingredients, and very filling.  I can eat 2 or 3 of these as a dessert and feel like I got my "fix".Well worth the money ---

When using a drip coffee maker, I often slipped in an extra spoonful of grounds to make my morning coffee extra strong so that the milk would not dilute it too much.  After recently having bought a Keurig, I was a bit disappointed at the somewhat watered-down light-bodied taste of most of the K-Cups which came as a sample with it.So my first inclination was to browse the Amazon reviews of several varieties of K-Cup coffee and take advantage of what others who like a nice strong bold cup of coffee had learnt by trial and error - and that was a good move!  I took you all at your word, ordered a 50-pack of this coffee on Monday, had my first cup of it this morning, and decided it was worth submitting my first ever review of any Amazon product ever, both to give it a 5-star rating myself and to thank those of you who take the time & trouble to give honest reviews for the benefit of people like me.So for the record, on a price and quality scale this is my new favourite K-Cup coffee.  Until now, my favourite on a pure quality scale wasStarbucks Caffè Verona, Dark Roast, 27-Count K-Cups for Keurig Brewers(excellent but very pricey!) and for a bold-yet-affordable cup wasGreen Mountain Coffee Double Black Diamond, K-Cup Portion Pack for Keurig Brewers 24-Count(also excellent, and less pricey, but IMO not quite as nice in flavour as Emeril's "Big Easy Bold").For anyone looking for a nice strong full-bodied and flavourful K-Cup coffee which won't break the bank, do try this one. If you're like me you won't be disappointed.
summary: My new favourite for a nice bold morning brew

reviewText: I had a recipe for Pad Thai noodles with shrimp, and it called for Tamarind paste.  None of our local grocery stores sells it, so I was glad to have the opportunity to buy it on line.  I have nothing to compare it to (compared to other brands) as this is the first time I've used it, but it worked well and the recipe turned out very tasty.
summary: Used it in Pad Thai noodles

reviewText: I'm old school when it comes to Kool-Aid flavors --- lemonade, orange, lemon-lime, cherry, grape -- but I tried this peach-mango flavor with an open mind.  The only way I knew it was Kool-Aid was because the packaging said it was.  I don't particularly like fruity tasting beverages, and this seemed extremely sweet for my tastes as well.  I drink lemonade and iced tea powdered mixers sugared or with sugar substitutes, and they are all just fine (not Kool-Aid brand), so it could just be me.  This is not a flavor I think kids would like either.  In fact, I've offered the remainder of this container to kids up through their teens and so far, no one has touched it.

I was surprised how much seasoning came out of the first container I tried. I try to limit salt intake so I took the lid off the other shakers & poked smaller holes into the protective cardboard piece. That solved my problem.Just like all the other dry popcorn flavorings I've used, the seasoning doesn't stick to the popcorn. This can be remedied by spraying oil onto the popped corn, then seasoning it. It doesn't completely solve the problem, but gosh, I always have salt at the bottom of my popcorn bowl...so this is no different.Nacho Cheddar, & White Cheddar are my favorites.  These seasonings can be used on potatoes, veggies & meat too. I even tried the Caramel on ice cream...it was okay, but not a favorite.I really, really like home popped popcorn, but as much as I love it,  I get tired of the same ol' flavor. So sometimes I pop it in coconut oil which can make a tasty difference...other times I like to use these seasonings.
summary: Nice variety...too much seasoning comes out for me, so I poked smaller holes in the protective cardboard seal

reviewText: I had bought these yesterday at Ralph's, about $3.99, pretty average for a box of Kashi bars. I was looking really forward to having them as a snack today. I had read the reviews about how hard they are, yes, they're hard, but about the same hardness as a Nature's Valley bar. The taste is great, pumpkin pie does come to mind, but these remind me of ginger snaps more. In each individually wrapped package are two thin (but not too thin) pieces. Pretty enjoyable, and most importantly, the nutritional value is good if trying to maintain weight. Better than a Quaker Oat granola bar. Totally recommend.
I bought a pack of each flavor.  My husband loves the different choices; they are good for him to eat

I grew up on the old cinnamon & brown sugar oatmeal packets and still eat them today. Compared to the Real Medleys versions, those are more work and seem old fashioned in style and presentation. This is a simple system - you add water to the line on the cup, microwave it and eat. No boiling water separately - it's sort of like the Cup of Noodles things. There are real pieces of apples and nuts in the cup and it has a good flavor - I would buy this again to serve guests or something. It seems a tad pricey for every day or feeding a passle of kids before school every morning.
summary: Fussy for oatmeal, but tastes good & super easy

reviewText: It's OK but not as "buttery" as I would like.
very moist,chewy and tasty- I like them a great deal and will buy them again - was worth taking the chance here - woot!!
Ideal size for rewards in my classes.I like them too!They fit in snack bags or in my case,my purse. Yum
Organic,healthy, and tastes great. This product is easy to carry in my purse or car for when I'm unable to get home in time to eat.
Quick and easy to make. Plus you can always add stuff to this to make it taste better! Bacon always works,... And broccoli too. Perfect for lunch and dinner.

I grew up on the east coast,and it just isn't Thanksgiving without Bell's. I use it all the time with chicken, fish & turkey. It is not available locally ( the midwest) so I am happy that I can get it through Amazon.This way I don't have to bother my family back east with sending it.I love it! Give it a try.
I use Manuka honey as a natural antibiotic. I use it whenever I feel any kind of illness come on to short-circuit progress. I also reserve a jar for our bugout bag.
If you love gummi bears, this is a large bag so be prepared to share.  I put them in candy jars with lids to keep them fresh and they make a great snack for kids and adults.
I buy these quite frequently; good quality, good taste - as are all Dare cookies I have tried, thus far.

I like to have tuna salad for lunch usually at least once a week. I have been using the same ingredients to make this salad for many years. I decided that the time had come to make a change so I looked up some recipes and chose one that used tahini. To my surprise I could not find tahini in any of the grocery stores within about ten miles. So, as usual when I can't find something locally, I turned to Amazon and bought this 16 oz jar.I whipped up a batch of the tuna salad and threw in some tahini. That turned out to be a very good decision because the tahini provided the much needed taste variety and produced a healthy lunch. Good product. Good taste. All good.

Compared to other stevia packets from other competing manufacturers, this doesn't taste all that different.  The only question I have is that one of their ingredients is silica.  Curious as to what that is doing in there.  I see it in my whey as well.  Supposedly silica is a component of our bones and is available in foods like celery, which can strengthen bones.  But not sure why they would add it here.  As a filler agent?The packet dissolves pretty well.  Even a bit better than another stevia packet that I have from another company.
summary: pretty much what you'd expect it to do

reviewText: This is my favorite oat bran, and I've tried many many brands. I like that this is a slightly larger bran flake, so it doesn't get so mushy when you cook it. I've had some brands where the bran is practically powder, so when you cook it, it turns to wallpaper paste. This is not that kind! It really holds its own, and I eat it every day: in the morning, mixed with Scottish oats, and I also use it to make my own granola. Love it!

I really like this tea! I love the combination of apple and cinnimon, and that the cinnimon is not extremely strong. The nutritional facts are a definite plus, by the way, and the ease to find this locally if I am too impatient to wait for an online order is an added pleasure.
I did care for the flavoring taste.  Wouldn't purchase it again.  Prefer the Nantucket or Columbia flavor with a Hazelnut creamer added.

Just Chill Tropical drink is a pleasantly refreshing citrus-flavored carbonated drink. I found it to be a delight too drink but can not attest too its claim too help one relax. Though it does hydrate. Besides the taste I like that the drink contains some B vitamins, C and A, and Magnesium and zinc. I would drink this again and only wish it cost less.

Obviously this is marked up for what you are getting, but the individual packets are worth it for the convenience.  (Bottle of citric acid and lime/lemon oil will do the same exact thing but such a hassle for daily use.)Tastes exactly like lime and very refreshing.  Also can be added to cooking if you are worried about using 500.
summary: Expensive for what you are getting but tastes very good and convenient

reviewText: Delicious rice pasta! Same cheese sauce as the original! So glad we can still eat Annie's Mac after going gluten free!

If you are a dieter, you will love these!  They are easy to open (pop top cans) you can take in your lunch.  Perfect size to eat even as a snack, and you're only going to be eating 90 calories, so that's wonderful.  Sometimes I eat it right out of the can.  Highly recommended!
summary: Perfect cans of spinach - great for dieters

reviewText: This Stevia has less of an aftertaste than the original Stevia.  It is very sweet but it does contains other ingredients.  Instead of repeating I recommend you read K. Franklin's review on ingredients.  It is also a little pricey.  Wholesome Sweeteners Organic Stevia, 35-Count Package (Pack of 6) for 32.52.  That is 5.42 for a box of 35.  Even though it is organic I though that was  a little high.  All of that said it does sweeten very well so it just depends on how much you want to pay for organic and how you feel about the addition ingredients.
summary: Works OK Price is a Little High

reviewText: Dove's silky smooth milk chocolate promises are really delicious and pack a great message.  On the inside of each individual wrapper is a fun and useful inspirational message to motivate and encourage you.  Compared to other milk chocolate products, these Dove Promises are slightly more expensive, however I feel they do have a better quality to justify the slight mark up in price.  Great for a little 'escape' from everyday life and well worth trying.
summary: Milk Chocolate With Great Taste And A Good Message...

reviewText: Izze All Natural Sparkling Pomegranate Juice is a nice alternative to the normal breeds of soda such as Coca-Cola, Pepsi, and Dr. Pepper.  It doesn't compare, however, to sodas that it will probably have more direct competition from such as Sunkist, the numerous Fanta flavors and others.  Why?  Because when most folks want a soda, they want a sugar-laden treat that'll give them a little spark.  This is soda for folks who care a bit more about their health than the average joe.  It's also a good choice for people who may not be able to drink sugar-shockers like Cherry Coke.I'm not saying that Izze Sparkling Juice is bad.  In fact, it tastes pretty good.  It contains seventy percent fruit juice (and most of that is white grape and apple) and thirty percent sparkling water.  The sugars that are contained in this drink are all natural.  It's also got a few vitamins in there, which are a plus.The pomegranate juice has a bit of a tart bite to it, and in my opinion the lemon juice that's also contained in this drink stands out a bit.  The can is 8.4 ounces, so you won't be getting the usual twelve ounces from the average can of soda.  Be sure to drink it very cold, because much like Miller Lite, it's pretty rank when it's warm or just a tad cool.In closing, Izze's got a good thing going with their sparkling juices.  This item will probably fit best in the health niche market, and I don't see it hurting the sales of Sunkist any time soon.  Give it a shot if you are looking for a Coca-cola subsitute.

reviewerName: E. Bernardino "Addicted to the Gold Box"
reviewText: You know those days when you are simply too tired to cook, but are looking for something fast, yet wholesome? Annie's to the rescue! The ingredients in this ravioli are pure and tasty; things you can feel good about eating and serving to your entire family. I add a little dash of salt, a sprinkle of Italian herbs and some shredded cheese for a little extra flavor and texture, and I am good to go!I purchased my first can at a health food store and was hooked...Amazon's price for the pack of 12 is the best I've found, and I am saving an extra 15% on "Subscribe and Save"; couple that with the home delivery and it's a "win-win".Many of us have been "addicted" to the artificial flavors we've been consuming within processed foods for years. With this in mind, natural food companies that pride themselves on manufacturing products with wholesome ingredients (sans the chemicals and artificial flavors), might take a little getting used to for some, but knowing that you are eating something that's healthy for you should compel you to move forward. You'll feel better about what you're eating and feel better; period!If you should take but one thing away from this review: be an informed shopper and read the nutritional panel and ingredient label to insure that you are getting a quality product.By the way; not one of my cans arrived dented, as the shipper box was packed with an air pillow wrap, that cushioned the cans...If you should ever receive dented cans, be sure to call Amazon and they will provide you with immediate credit against your purchase, as they have done for me in the past.
summary: Great product; have added to my "Subscribe and Save" items as a monthly staple!

reviewText: I'm very, VERY pleased to have the opportunity to help bring this product to the attention of American consumers because I've been enjoying it for the past two years (a friend brings it from South Africa when he goes home between semesters). My review will try to supply some background on both rooibos and the product itself, after which I'll provide what I hope are some helpful tips for enjoying and appreciating red espresso.Rooibos (literally "red bush" in Afrikaans, pronounced more or less "ROY'-bawss") is a shrub that grows in South Africa which tea-deprived Afrikaaners discovered made a not-too-shabby substitute for tea when dried and oxidized. It turned out to have been a fortuitous discovery because research seems to support claims indicating that rooibos contains lots of healthful elements and provides a high level of antioxidants without caffeine. It  has a pleasant, sweetish taste (nothing to which I can compare it--sorry) and though most folks prefer it sweetened (a spot of agave nectar is the perfect complement), with or without a splash of milk, it's quite nice straight up as well. It also blends beautifully with spices and makes a fabulous chai (check out Rishi--they have excellent rooibos-based chai blends).Interestingly enough, red espresso also came into being as the result of desperation. It seems the founder of the company was jonesing for an espresso and, finding the cupboard bare, it occurred to him that perhaps substituting the rooibos he DID have on hand would provide a temporary fix. Lo and behold, his espresso maker produced a deep brew that actually had a crema! Seeds sewn, he began to experiment with different grades of rooibos and then with different cuts in an attempt to develop the best-tasting, most robust rooibos possible--one that would hold up to espresso brewing. Red espresso was born!Red espresso is a much heavier brew than other rooibosses I've tried, even when prepared by drip method (you can use a Chemex or other some such for this). You can also, I imagine, use a French press. However, the best way to prepare it is in a stovetop espresso maker such as a Bialetti Brikka. The last time I checked, red espresso wasn't completely approved for espresso makers but that might have changed by now--it's been two years since I read that. Simply use the same routine used for coffee: fill the tray with red espresso, fill the pot to the correct water level, and heat until you hear the "pop." You're now ready to have fun with your red espresso shot (I've read on coffee sites that the two-cup stovetop makers produce better results than the four-cup models that are most often available here in the States--shop around).The company's Web site has some wonderful recipes and suggestions for red espresso; have a look: [...] (hit the link for "red drinks"). It's delicious  (and beautiful) in shakes and smoothies, and there's a really nice recipe that floats red espresso on apple juice, although it tastes better with a natural, "cloudy" apple juice than with a clear one. Get creative!I e-mailed the red espresso team two years ago after first trying it (I'd stumbled onto the Web site and asked my friend to bring me some) and they actually called me to chat! When they e-mailed me a few months ago to announce that Amazon would be carrying it, I replied that I suspected it would turn up in Vine, in which case I'd be able to review it and they wrote back that it was indeed slated for Vine and that they were eager for my review. I've been holding my breath ever since, especially since it didn't show up last month. I've been hoping ever since that not only would red espresso take off in a big way internationally (it's apparently very popular in South Africa), but that I'd have easier access to it. With any luck and Amazon's help, fulfillment on both counts is looking good!  :)If you have any interest in brewed beverages and want to experience something that's healthful, delicious, and novel (stovetop espresso makers are fun to use), by all means, give red espresso a "shot," especially if you already have an espresso maker of some sort that doesn't involve pods (feh). You can always try it with the drip method to see if you want to make the small investment required for a stovetop pot.
I buy these for making pizza. It is perfect and is very reasonably priced. I highly reccomend for anyone who wants ultra thin pizza crust.
I feel more Stevia Flavor then the fruit i feel its more like sure water.
summary: Taste like sugar water not fruit

reviewText: Of all the flavors, I love this one the most.  It is not too spicy ( in fact, I'd like them hotter) but even my tender-tongued hubby finds these tasty!
Good balance of nutrition with flavor.  Not too much sugar, yet very flavorful.  The kids love them and does the hubby.  Great price on Amazon, love that it comes without thinking about it.

These are very tiny shrimp, with not much flavor, more useful as a garnish than anything else. I wouldn't buy it again. Also, very expensive when you compare it to fresher shrimp from a grocery store. (Based on weight and taste).

I eat a lot of this Bob's Red Mill Organic corn meal using the recipe on the bag. 1 cup corn meal, a little baking soda and baking powder, oil, boiling water, then pour into hot pan and make corn cakes. You might not think it sounds good, and my family snubs it, too. But the cake comes out a golden orange with a crispy sandpaper texture. Top with your favorite syrup. I prefer real maple syrup because it tastes the best to me, and it's extremely high in riboflavin. You might also think corn meal is low in nutrients, but that is not true at all. Corn is a very unjustly maligned grain. See below the USDA nutrients of whole grind corn meal, 100 grams, DRY.Desc Cornmeal, whole-grain, yellowProtein 14%Fiber, total dietary 19%Folate, food 6%Niacin 30%Vitamin B-12 0%Vitamin B-6 22%Riboflavin 18%Thiamin 39%Vitamin C 0%Vitamin A, RAE 2%Vitamin D 0%Vitamin K 0%Vitamin E 4%Calcium, Ca 1%Iron, Fe 58%Phosphorus, P 42%Magnesium, Mg 36%Copper, Cu 28%Selenium, Se 34%Choline, total 4%Pantothenic acid 9%Potassium, K 6%Zinc, Zn 19%Sodium, Na 2%Calories 18%Total lipid (fat) 6%

It doesn't taste like a mojito but it tastes REALLY GOOD. It tastes more like limeade, with a hint of mint. Doesn't that sound good? I really liked it a lot. I'll love it in the summer.FYI - when I saw the packaging, I first thought it was those "to-go" packets of Crystal Light. But actually each packet makes a full 2 quarts. They just changed the packaging from little tubs to packets.

So as other reviews have noted, the nutritional values are pretty good for these bars. Only 120 calories, very low sodium (90mg), 9g of fiber and so on. Also, no artificial sweeteners which I like, since I dislike the aftertaste of those very much. The bar is a reasonable size (35g) and is clearly intended as a snack bar.  The chocolate and raspberry flavors are mild, but good. I thought these bars were quite tasty by comparison to many others I have tried.  The fair comparison is to other snack bars, I think. None of these bars are super great and most are very much in the "just OK" category.  However, I felt these were a bit tastier than most and I would definitely buy them now and then as a healthy snack alternative.Yes, if they had true dark chocolate and raspberry fruit bits they would be much better, but I'm sure those calories would go up as well. As it is, I found them satisfying with just enough raspberry flavor to get my approval.Currently they are not available and there is no price, but at around 50 cents per bar or so, I think they would be a good purchase.

Handling tiny vanilla extract bottles has become more difficult as my fingers succumb to the indignities of arthritis, so I decided to try a bulk bottle.I am over the moon satisfied with this purchase. Most importantly, the flavor excels all others I've used over 60 years and it is delightfully smooth. I'm especially sensitive to the taste of alcohol in extracts, yet don't notice it at all in this vanilla. It truly delivers an authentic taste of vanilla.I've used it in baking, cake and bread and cookies and am pleased to tell you that the flavor enhances the good old standard family recipes in which I've used it. As a lark, I whipped up a batch of Grandma's boiled frosting for some gluten-free chocolate cake and the frosting tasted so fine I could have eaten it by the bowl. Rich, smooth, and vanilla-y. I've only had it for a month but have purposely cooked recipes that call for vanilla so I could make a fair evaluation.As for the huge bottle and arthritis - I divided the contents into several small pop-cap sealing bottles for storage in my pantry. That way the vanilla remains full flavored fresh right down to the last bottle. With this type of cap there is no drying mess at the top of the bottle. It is sealed from the air and can even be stored lying on its side. With the boriolli bottles I can easily manage the cap, even with arthritis. I'm not a fan of storing liquid foods in plastic bottles anyway, so I rebottled right after receiving the shipment. Then, to use in an 8oz. bottle I have yet to spill, over a month of regular use. However, I do plan to buy a small bottle with the same sort of spout that I use for oils, to eliminate possible spillage from a regular sized mouth. This has become my new standard for vanilla.
summary: Full Robust Vanilla Taste -- couldn't be happier with this

reviewText: Easy to make.  Extra noodles, mmmmm.The kids really love it and so do I.  Yummy!

This was well packaged, no cooties and a great pantry item. I like making a tuna/veggie mac-n-cheese with some frozen mixed veggies and a can of tuna and a shot of soy sauce, a little anchovy paste and a squirt of brown mustard. YUM YUM
It's amazing how concentrated this product is!  I don't normally measure ingredients when I'm cooking, but I've learned to be careful with this one as a little goes a long way.
summary: good, but be careful as it's concentrated!

reviewText: Picked this tea up at Target today. It is a blend of chamomile, lavender, and lemon balm, all of which are known for their relaxing & stress relieving qualities. I used one tea bag, not 2 as the directions state, and it was plenty strong. It has a very strong lavender scent & is very relaxing & soothing without putting me to sleep. I am very happy with the effects and about to brew another cup :)
summary: This tea really helps me unwind

reviewText: more than we expected the flavor is great just the right amount of spicy and heat together and a fantastic price too! very easy to open. will buy again and again and again. you won't be sorry buying these.
summary: JACK LINK'S BEEF STICK,HOT & SPICY WOW!!!!!!!

reviewText: So why did I only give it four stars? Because I'd have loved a wee bit more pasta in the mix. The taste is superb--definitely low in salt, so all the veggie flavors come through, and they're wonderful. The rotini pasta isn't overcooked, and I love the kidney beans in this. I'll be taking this to work; there are few other options at my office for something this delicious AND low in calories in sodium.

Like the corn version, which I prefer over this, the dry ingredients don't seem to mix with the hot water very well. Once it's done, though, it's quite tasty. A bit blander than the corn, so I usually add some black pepper to it. A nice option to keep around since it's quick to make and doesn't need refrigeration.
summary: I like this, but don't love it

reviewText: Bob's Red Mill is a fav around here.  Haven't found one yet that we didn't love.  This is no diff.  I've only eaten it cold in milk twice, though.  It's a dry meal in a coffee cup with me, add a pinch of salt, and a tablespoon of flax seed meal and I'm good to go til lunch.  I've also found that drizzling on a tablespoon of olive oil per two cups (approx), mixing it well, and then toasting it in the oven til it's crunchy is great, too.  Add some coarse sea salt or pretzel salt, some chocolate chips or butterscotch morsels, more raisins or cranberries....you can carry a bag of that and hike all day long.  Makes a great start to a pan of homemade granola bars, too!

I have had other syrup flavor coffee's and enjoyed them, so I decided to try Timothy's version, since I usually enjoy Timothy's coffees.  I enjoyed this one very much, great balanced flavor and lovely maple aroma, but unfortunately it did not have much of a maple taste.  I did use sugar to sweeten, and that did not bring out the flavor either.  Not sure if I will order this flavor again, but I will order Timothy's coffee again.
summary: Good flavor, but not maple flavor

reviewText: This is a great tasting coffee, when chilled, it is great! Cans are 6.8 ounces, and a pure burst of goodness!
Can't beat Jello brand Jello. This was used in a strawberry pretzel dessert. Follow the directions and Jello turns out great every time. It comes out good and tastes great, what more can you ask for.

Yes, it's expensive, but it's really the best Sumatran k-cup.BTW, so you know where my preferences lay, the k-cups I prefer are the Starbucks Verona, Sumatra, and Pikes Place, along with Van Houtte's Mexican Dark Roast, and Tomothy's Columbian LaVareda (NOT the Dorado).
There may be better, but I haven't had it and I have had a few. Also non gmo and PEANUT FREE!

These cookies surprised my husband and me.  They are light and delicately crunchy.  We have problems with eating hard crisp cookies and were very delighted to find these so delicate and yummy with that hidden touch of peanut butter cups.
I'm a Barista Italian Roast drinker.  Compared to that coffee, this Brown Gold just tastes nasty.  I gave it a star, though, because it a bold nasty which is better than a weak nasty.

I was thinking these were dehydrated wedges or something like that, but instead the slices seemed to be made horizontally and thick.  The slices are not completely dried which makes a rubbery piece of apple.  Another thing I noticed is that they are not packed with flavor.  Normally when drying fruit, the flavor gets super concentrated and that's what I thought I'd taste, but it seems the manufacturer starts with a not so juicy flavorful apple.  The idea is really good and handy but the flavor and texture does not deliver.

I have tried several of these Barilla Italian Entrees, and I think they are the best "pasta presto" meals going.They share the unusual characteristics of: not requiring refrigeration or freezing; one-minute preparation time using a microwave; and tasty sauces with al dente pasta.The last trick is made possible by the use of a little detachable sauce tray in the left corner of the microwave plate.  To heat the entree, you fold back the cover to expose the sauce tray, nuke for one minute, remove the cover, remove the sauce tray and pour the sauce over the pasta.The package claims the meal is 100% natural with no preservatives, and indeed I see no strange chemicals in the list of ingredients.I have deducted one star just because I thought the meat sauce was rather undistinguished (although still far superior to what's in a Chef Boyardee can and better than most frozen pasta entrees I've tasted).  I liked the other two Barilla entrees I tried some months back better -- I think one of them featured a marinara sauce.Still, for a one-minute meal you can keep on hand in a kitchen cupboard or office drawer, this Barilla Gemelli with Meat Sauce hits the spot.UPDATE: I just heard that Barilla's president made some statement about not wanting gay families to appear in his company's ads.  Nuts to him.  I won't be indulging in any more of Barilla's products until he rescinds his remarks, and you may wish to vote with your pocketbook as well.

I've tried several flavors of Lipton's Tea and Honey To Go Packets (watch Amazon's Warehouse Deals for fire sales) but the new Dragonfruit Peach flavor is my favorite. While other instant tea makers insist on making their products cloyingly sweet, Lipton dials down the artificial sweeteners and lets the flavor characteristics of the dragonfruit and peach come through. The result is an excellent, refreshing tea drink that is neither too sweet nor too dry. That might not seem like such a big deal, but it's tea, not Kool-Ade, and you want it to actually taste like the primary ingredients. This is good stuff!
I love these things. Too much. But at least for those of us with a sweet tooth, hard candies help keep the calorie count down
perfect amount of choco and oat mix!  give these a try!you wont regret it!  also, its a pretty good calorie count for theamount of food!
Not very sweet, which I prefer. I was hoping the product was made with Splenda but it is not.Packaged well and came on time.

I like crunchy snacks.  I'm eating low carb because my doctor advises it, and this helps fill the "popcorn spot" in my life.There are a lot of things to like about this product.  It's economical.  They cook up fresh whenever you want them, and they taste fresher than the ones you buy pre-popped in a bag.  They don't have MSG like the Lawry's brand, and they don't come with a lot of extra packaging.If you are a low carber looking for pork rinds to cook with, these aren't heavily seasoned, so they won't influence your recipe's flavor.  I like their clean flavor, but it's not hard to add seasoning if you want to experiment or you like more variety.  A little bit of oil or butter will serve as the "glue" to hold your Parmesan cheese, seasoned salt, etc.There is a bit of a learning curve involved in terms of discovering how long they take in your microwave, but by now I know by feel what size handful to grab and how long to nuke them. It's worth the effort to get to know these.  Highly recommended!

My son loves this cereal, especially with chocolate soymilk. This company also makes Koala Crisp Cereal, if we have that, my kids will mix the Panda Puffs with the Koala Crisp (which has a chocolate flavor) as they think it tastes like a Reese Cup. I like that there are only 7g of sugar per serving (much less than many kids cereals) and all the ingredients are organic. Once in milk this cereal will also stay crispy a little longer than Rice Crispies, but not much. If you have to make Rice Crispy treats for the school bake sale - use these cereals instead for an extra yummy treat.

I was hoping for great taste when I ordered TH Hot chocolate.  Because we LOVE Tim Horton's coffee, I assumed I would love their hot chocolate.  I personally didn't think it was anything to write home about!.
No really best PB ever and it doesn't have all that CRAP in all the others!Just peanuts and salt!Can not beat the price either!  $16 for a 3 pack on subscribe and save!BUY THIS!!
Thes are always good to have on hand.  Kids love them, and I like them too.  Easy to fix, and long shelf life.

When I read the ingredients on the can, I was very disappointed.  There are many ingredients (all of which I finds unnecessary) besudes the chocolate.  The taste is not great either.  I now make my own cocoa with Toll House baking chocolate and sugar.  It tastes like the real thing and it is easy and cheap to make.  I use one part chocolate to 2 or 3 parts sugar.
My family likes these gluten-free cornmeal muffins better than the  non-gluten free.  A successful product!  Kudos, Gluten Free Pantry.

I bought this on Amazon a few years ago for my mother who doesn't eat wheat after reading its glowing reviews.  After hearing her rave about it, and getting tired of never seeming to find a fast-cooking, healthy meal, we tried it.  Fabulous!  I'd never know it wasn't regular pasta, and my husband, who is generally wary of my insistence on brown rice over white, was just as impressed.

I love this tea!  It is one of my favorite Chai!!  I didn't even know there is no coconut in it even though it is called coconut chai???  I realized that after reading the reviews....  That's kind of strange, but i still like it.  I'm almost done with my second bag, and am thinking about getting their fireside kind which is supposed to be spicy!
summary: Love this tea but no coconut??

reviewText: These are crunchy, so tasty, and great to have on hand to offer guests when serving coffee or (hot) tea. Of the different flavors offered, I have to say that the Cioccolati biscotti is my personal favorite, but these are all very good and very well-received by others upon getting a biscotti with their beverage.I'm a coffee drinker, so I love to have this once in a while with a cup of coffee. They hold up well with "dunking" and make a coffee break truly feel like a break. My friends who drink hot tea (as well as coffee) always light up when I offer a Nonni's Biscotti with their tea. I recommend Nonni's Biscotti (Traditional Assortment 25 Count). Yummy!
summary: A Nice "Treat" To Serve With Coffee or Tea

reviewText: This Europa Blanc et Noir blend was quite nice.  I definitely describe it as a dark roast, though it is listed as a dark/light blend.  It has a very smooth taste and no bitterness or after taste at all even with do cream or sweetener.  It is a great blend for 'black' coffee drinkers like me.As I stated for other Melitta K-Cup varieties my only minor complaint is that there seems to be a bit of wasteful packaging. These Melitta "k-cups" come inside a container that has to be tossed, then the coffee in a filter basket with a plastic covering is used in the K cup brewer.I'd recommend it for those that light a strong medium to dark roast that has a smooth finish.
summary: A nice strong roast with unnecessary extra packaging

reviewText: It's been double digit years since I've tried beef jerky, but this is just great.  I'm a sissy about pepper, so it did made my nose run, and I wouldn't recommend you eat it without a cold drink.  However, the beef and pepper flavor was terrific, and it was not too much for my 61-year-old teeth to handle.  If these things matter to you, from the package:1.  The product is made in Brazil;2.  There is a high sodium content, 550 mg, rated at 23%;3.  It's 96% fat free, but it's still rated for cholesterol at 35 mg, or 23%; and4.  You're not going to get any vitamins, but it will provide 4% of the daily iron requirement.I like the fact that the expiration date is out two years, and there is a freshness packet in the bag, because this isn't something I should eat every day.  Nonetheless, this was a delicious, unusual, and satisfying way to have an 80-calorie snack.  I'm taking off one point because for me, there was borderline too much pepper.

Use a number of the Simply Organic brand spices and they deliver decent flavor across the line - including these onion bits.  I gather that organic stuff is good for me so I'll assume that this stuff is good for me.  And as I wrote, it smells good and tastes right.
summary: Like most of their product line - good stuff

reviewText: I am vegan and use this in many recipes, great source of b12.  The bulk purchase is fabulous.  I put three in the freezer and keep one in the fridge.  Great for udon dishes, soups, black beans, etc. Also works to make vegan french toast! The price is great. Locally it's $8 each package so this saves a few bucks getting it in bulk.
The Caza Trail coffee is a great value and it tastes good. We use it in an office setting and no complaints so far ! The price is reasonable and the delivery to our door is  awesome.

I cannot give this a glowing review. The tea opens up into what appears to be a ugly weed floating upside down in the top of the cute little glass pot. Other than that the tea is OK, does not taste any differently than a store bought tea bag. The pot is cute the box is cute but really not anything I would give as a gift. Sure the flower opens up and that might be interesting to some people, but seeing as it has no significant beauty when it does I am not that impressed and feel it was mostly a waste of money. I would not recommend purchasing it to anyone.
summary: IT'S ONLY OK IN MY OPINION

reviewText: Good flavor but it has a bit of an after taste. I love coconut so wish it were more of a true coconut taste.

To keep it simple, the chocolate is not bad - yet the mixture of chocolate and soybeans does not exactly thrill the tastebuds.  This is good if you are disciplining yourself and eating for health moreso that eating for pleasure.
summary: Not bad for a quick snack

reviewerName: L.A. Garrison "American Daughter - The Sam Hu...
reviewText: I've had this soup, not bought here, bought it in a grocery store. I wanted to say it's a good enough quick snack, I actually liked the shrimp/lime taste. It's kind of tangy, an interesting taste compared to some of the dried noodle quick soups. I'd have it again.
summary: Typical of its kind, really not bad

reviewText: First off, I'll warn everybody, do NOT use the cooking instructions on the bag!  I have a 1200 watt microwave, and it took 1 minute 45 seconds to cook this popcorn to perfection.  The instructions on the bag said to cook it from 2 to 2 1/2 minutes.  Even at the lesser time, that would have burnt my popcorn.  The 1 minute 45 seconds cook time popped the corn to a fluffy perfection, and completely filled the bag/bowl.Opening the bag was tricky.  I eventually gave up tearing it open (according to the directions), and I cut the plastic off the top.  Be careful when you do this, because the steam inside the bag is HOT!The aroma that met my nose was buttery, and the taste didn't disappoint.  Visually, the popcorn was big and fluffy...  Bigger than any other microwave popcorn I've ever tried.  I felt there was just the right amount of salt to butter ratio.My next test was to empty the bag into a bowl, so I could count the old maids.  It didn't look like very many, but when I counted them, there were 45 old maids.  It still didn't look like that much, so I measured the old maids.  There were 1.5 teaspoons, which is what I would expect for any brand of microwave popcorn.All-in-all, this is a hit at my house.  The delicious flavor and the size of the popped corn makes up for the inconvenience of having to remember to cook it for 15 seconds less than the minimum time and having to cut the bag open (as opposed to tearing it open).  I'll buy this again.Edit: The ingredients are much simpler than any other microwave popcorn I've ever tried.  They are: Whole Grain Popping Corn, Palm Oil, Sea Salt, Butter, Mixed Tocopherols (for freshness), Natural Flavor.  There is a warning that this contains milk (I assume that's the butter).  This makes it healthier than any other microwave popcorn I've ever tried.
summary: Tasty, but hard to open bag/bowl.

reviewText: Honey Maid graham crackers are a staple in my home. We've tried other brands, but none can match the grahamy flavor Honey Maid. While I was initially a bit disappointed the crackers do not come doubled up like the standard graham crackers, it soon becomes clear why. Keeping the crackers smaller and more tightly packaged, preserves the crisp quality of the crackers making them exceedingly fresh.Graham crackers have been around a long time. They first were produced as a brand in 1829 by a Presbyterian minister as a way of curbing... Unwanted `carnal' desire.  I didn't realize that, but while researching for this review I found that amusing- While I can't say that graham crackers work that way for me, they certainly do make a great snack.To further the taste-test on these crackers I offered some to my sister and mother and they were both quite pleased with the fresh crisp quality of these cookies.

Of the three Knorr Rice Sides I recently sampled (Creole Garlic Butter, Creamy Chipotle, and Thai Curry), I liked the Creole Garlic Butter the least.  The taste was mostly buttery, very little hint of a creole or a garlicky kick.All of the Knorr Rice Sides I sampled are good for 2.5 servings per packet / container, and all include as ingredients disodium guanylate and disodium inosinate, which some customers may prefer to avoid.The sodium contents are as follow: the Creamy Chipotle has the lowest amount at 580 mg, the Thai Curry has 650 mg, and the Creole Garlic Butter has the highest at 700 mg.Both the Creamy Chipotle and Creole Garlic Butter also have MSG (autolyzed yeast extract), while the Thai Curry doesn't. So if you're allergic to MSG, the Creole Garlic Butter may not be for you.All of them were easy to cook.  Although optional according to the cooking instructions, I did use "I Can't Believe It's Not Butter" spread. I added different kinds of meats (beef, pork, chicken) to each serving to make a full meal, and the results all tasted just fine.My rating for the Creole Garlic Butter is 3 stars.
summary: Mostly buttery taste, has MSG and relatively high sodium content

reviewText: Vegan. Organic. Great for dried fruit lovers. Cherry goodness. Not overly sweet or tart. Convenient "carry-with" or lunchable snack packets. Watch out for an occasional pit piece. This review is out there for those for whom this makes a difference. See all of my reviews for more great choices. Check out "Vegan Grocery Favorites" and "Vegan Grocery Top Ten" in Listmania. Your "helpful" votes count and will be greatly appreciated to benefit the search of others. Thank you.

This was a birthday present for my son, so the recommendation is from a Starbucks lover. This was a partial gift with the coffee tubs that come from the Starbucks company. This syrup with the coffee made his mornings when he has his coffee with his ingredients.This is the same syrup he buys from Starbucks so good deal.
A quality product with great taste, although have had better but at a much higher price.  Would recommend to allkipper snack lovers.

This product is both well tolerated and well liked by my granddaughter.It mixes well, warms well, and does not cause stomach upset for my granddaughter.Probably most importantly of all my daughter in law approved of the ingredients.  Since both her and my son have lactose intolerance they have limited the amount of dairy the baby as been exposed to.  The concern was would she also have upset with soy products.  So far this product has been well tolerated.

Nabisco has always been one of my favorite brands, and these Honey Grahams are one of my favorite cookie/crackers. These still have the same fresh, crispy, and wonderful flavor, but the size and packaging is different.I like that these are packaged in 2"x4" individual packs. They are great for lunchboxes, office desk, or just a quick snack. I like them at work with a cup of hot tea, and sometimes when I don't have time for a real lunch, they are great with peanut butter or Nutella - just excellent!There are 6 "fresh stacks" per box, and each one is considered 2 servings, so that is the only thing one needs to be careful of. It is too easy to open and eat one entire snack pack, which is 250 calories, so be careful to watch how any you eat at once or just share a pack!

These pork rinds fry in their own fat rather than having to be deep fried which is a lifesaver if you like pork rinds. I'm not the biggest fan, but sometimes I'm kind of hungry and these pack way more protein than the average fatty snack. The only problem is the type of fat it's fried in--melted pig fat from the skin itself! Not particularly healthy, but it's much healthier than the mexican bagged varieties.Since we don't have a microwave (oh my god, how do we get by without one?!), we toast them in a toaster oven on a baking tray for about 10-15 minutes at 375F-400F. They come out great. If you lean closer to 10 minutes, you get a crunchy-porky tasting snack, while if you go past 15, you'll get the typically super-puffed pork rind you'd expect from Cardenas. I can't comment on how well they crisp in the microwave, but I expect it should yield the same results.
summary: A considerably healthier alternative to deep fried pork rinds

reviewText: The manufacturer compares this product to clouds, because the water is distilled into a vapor, which supposedly makes it better than purified tap water or spring water. Of course, distilled water does not taste like much and takes minerals out of things, So adding some minerals to the water makes it taste better. Electrolytes, they call them; really it's just salts. And they do make it taste good. But I don't think it is good enough for you and good enough tasting to merit charging twice what other bottled waters do.On the plus side, it can be a easy way to get your magnesium and calcium without taking a supplement pill. I found it helpful to counteract the effects of drinking carbonated beverages.  It neutralized the acid. The bottle is pretty cool.as well, It is tall, slender, sturdy and just the right size when you are thirsty. Its made of 30% plant-based plastic, which is 100% recyclable. Chalk one up for environmental friendliness. It is stronger than other bottled-water bottles--strong enough to reuse if you want to. However, the plastic is a 1, which can allow the growth of bacteria if used too often without washing. It also has the potential of leaching chemicals into the water over time.Overall, this water is a pretty good drink for anyone now and then.
One of the best cups of coffee that I have every consumed at home. If you are a person that enjoys a rich and robust cup of coffee this is the one that you may enjoy.
Most hot cocoa is so sweet we cannot drink it. Found this one to be a good blend. Liked the flavor and it was sweet without being too sweet.
Oh my, these are almost as good as a bag of popcorn. Yummy. I want to try other flavors too
This gem of strong, bold flavor is right up my husbands alley. He and some of our friends prefer the darker side!
Kind products always taste good, because they are natural and all, but I always feel hungry not too long afterwards. Maybe you're supposed to eat a salmon filet with it or something?

These kettle chips are crispy yet nice and spicy too and with good flavor not overly hot either but enough that you taste the heat and if your buying Jalopeno chips you expect some heat. Only negative way too addicting/

This is the classic red pepper sauce. It is in 2500-5000 range of Scoville units. I use with salads (baby kale, cucumber, tomato, sprouted beans, craisins). Sprinkle few drops and you are in heaven.Scoville units are a standardized way of measuring the heat of peppers. A "Scoville Unit" is actually a measure of capsaicin (the chemical in hot peppers that is responsible for their heat)

Come on Kashi give us a break shrink the bars but do not raise price! One or the other!  I bought over a hundred dollars worth of bars and got only half as much as I expected to get in edible food because Kashi shrunk the bars and raised the prices.!

Keurig machines are mostly valuable to me because of their speed!!!  I was given one as a gift but I like strong coffee and found that even with ex-bold blends and 7oz brews, the result was too weak for my taste and the cost was too high to produce an adequate AMERICAN SIZE cup of coffee (10-12oz) by running the 7oz cycle twice (~$1.20/cup at home) so I came to Amazon to find a better solution.  This was a success with the cost of a double 7oz cup costing ~$0.35 utilizing my favorite Viet Namese dark brew.Keurig machines use a pump to force hot water through a small portion of ground coffee in a filter container which is perhaps the best way to brew.  The filter device must not leak and allow the water to bypass flowing through the coffee.  Remember this if you have any problems in use of these caps and the process should be much easier to understand.Save all those K-cups you use when you first get the machine or the times when you are still just too sleepy to do ANYTHING beyond absolute basics without that 1st cup of wake up.  The original pods have an inner synthetic mesh bag for a filter that MUST be preserved intact. The instructions are very simple and done quickly with a routine.  The cups are best removed from the machine immediately and cleaned while still warm and damp since the process is much quicker at this point.The instructions below are lengthy to communicate all the detail I have found necessary but they are not complex and should not be intmidating.  REMEMBER, GENTLY!!!!!!!1) With the used cup, use your fingers (a knife may help those with arthritis make a starting tear) to gently tear the foil lid from the top in a spiral motion to ensure complete removal from the rim of the cup.  You will quickly get a feel as to what will keep the lid from sealing properly-- small amounts of adhesive on the rim will not hurt but lookout for globs of it or large bumps.2) Rap the inverted K-cup smartly in a saucer (as flat to the surface as possible) once or twice to remove most of the grounds.  The remaining small amount may be washed down the drain safely if you have a septic tank.3) Using the sprayer or faucet and your finger, GENTLY rub the residual grounds from the filter bag.  If you do this roughly, you may puncture the bag or seperate it from the container.  If this happens, the cup is no longer useful.  The bag will now be brown so don't attempt to overclean it.4) Seal your lips around the bottom of the inverted clean cup and puff air through the hole into the base to evert the filter bag similar to the way a muffin rises above the pan.  This forces excess water from the mesh and will help it to dry better and more quickly - if it will not inflate, it is most likely detached or has a hole in it which makes it no longer functional.  Set the cup down on its base in an appropriate out of the way place to dry.  I use a saucer in the cabinet which takes up little space and easily holds all 5 of the daily K-cups.*************5) Taking a dry cup from a previous brew, GENTLY push the bag back into normal shape in the cup with your finger and fill it with the appropriate amount of fresh grounds. You may need to experiment with this a little to get what your taste demands.  If you are just trying to duplicate the K-cup taste, fill it with pre-ground drip grind coffee to about 1/8" below the rim of the cup.  DO NOT FILL THE CUP TO THE RIM AND DO NOT TAMP!!!!  The coffee soaks up water and needs to expand slightly -- this is the most probable reason for a misbrew, especially when the grounds run out the top of the K-cup.To get a stronger brew, MY PROCESS is (experiment with grinding the beans more finely than drip grind but not ultra fine espresso grind) scoop the coffee from the container with the cup itself then scrape the grounds level with the rim using perhaps the back of a knife.  THEN, tap the base of the cup on the counter to level and slightly settle the coffee to counter the static holding the fine ground apart-- it will wind up about 1/8" below the rim as stated above.  Do not tamp the coffee in the cup, there are limits to what the small pump in this machine can handle. Remember, this is NOT a $3,000 espresso machine and clogged filters will pass very little brew or force the water out of the lid to a resulting mess.The finer grind allows the coffee to be more compact but still have a greater suface area to increase the solubility of the essential oils.  If you grind the beans too fine or pack them too tightly, they will clog the filter, resulting in a misbrew.6) When the cup is properly filled, wipe the rim clean of all grounds and install the lid.7) HOLDING THE LID ON, turn the cup over to locate the existing hole and rotate the cup so the hole will match the machine pin location (as you face the machine, it is away from you, towards the machine) when inserted.  Turn the cup back upright and GENTLY insert the cup into the machine rotating it until the pin aligns with the hole and the cup drops down flush with the holder.  My first attempts made a second hole but it makes a superior brew with just the one.8) You are ready to brew!9) Remember, it is easier but not mandatory to clean the cups while still warm and damp-- this takes only a few seconds at this time with an established routine.My 94yo Mother lives with us, and every morning I fill 5 cups for a double 7oz brew apiece for us and a single 10oz brew for my Mother (she likes her coffee weak??).  I walk in the kitchen, turn the keurig on and fill the K-cups.  The 5 cups are prepared in the very short time it takes the pre-heat to cycle and within 3 or 3-1/2 minutes total, I have my 14oz morning wakeup for about $0.30 or 20-30% of what it costs to buy 2 K-cups.
