AND, it is MY FAVORITE BRAND brewed strong enough to be palatable!The cups will wear out after a while (holes in bag or adhesive failure) so this method depends on continued occasional use of factory K-cups to replenish your supply unless you know others who would save them for you.  I have purchased one of the K-cup replacement modules with metal screen filters but I am still experimenting with that since they are much more expensive and efficiency (in my case) depends on having multiple sets to fill all 5 cups at once and they are too pricey to have 5 just for an experiment.  The metal screens seem to be less fine than the bag filters and will require a different grind to be best.  Those modules seem to be slightly larger than the K-cups so the additional coffee would seem to promise richer brews.  Also, the metal will not absorb the oils as paper and synthetic filters seem to and after all, coffee is an extraction of those oils from the bean-- a major reason Mr Coffee can't produce a really rich cuppa mud.

This stuff is just lovely. While it's not the same as my Robert Harris Italian Roast, it's pretty good stuff. I don't have to use as much as with Starbucks, and I get a good "bite" without bitterness. Every shipment is welcomed happily
summary: I have this on regular shipments.

reviewText: These are super easy to use and add flavor and simplicity to any dish. I used this with chicken breast and beef. It was good with both. Just cook your chicken or beef then add the packaged sauce and bring to a boil then let stand for a few minutes. Very easy to use. Made some white rice along for the dish. Sauce taste great on the rice too. Has a hint of sweetness. Everyone who tried it like it even though it had mushrooms.

Good product, decent value and not low quality. The only reason I did  not give it five stars is that I dont eat alot of this rice so I want to be fair about my review. I cant' say its the best out there but I can tell you I've definetly had worse. It was a enjoyable accent to the meal I made.

These crunchy little treats were really tasty and different.  I am not a fan of dark chocolate, but the chocolate was not bitter tasting at all.  These could easily become a substitute for a traditional candy bar for less than half the calories.  They are worth the money.
liquid goes right into making bbq smelling and tasting like great smoke hit it. i use gas grill and this aids in flavoring of the bbq. like good old days of smoking it.

I'm a fan of coconut so I was happy to see this as a flavor.  The coffee and coconut flavor are both mild and I usually prefer a bolder coffee (jet fuel is one of my favorites) but I like the smell and hint of coconut.  It's a little trip to the tropics every morning.
I'm not sure if this is more or less expensive than buying them in a store, but it sure is a lot more convenient.

I was anxious to get this cereal as it sounded really tasty.  When you pour the milk, the fruit is soft right away (nice taste, too) but the flakes are very thick and hard.  Now I don't really like mushy flakes - I like light crispy flakes that don't soften up right way BUT I don't like rock hard flakes.  I tried to wait until the flakes got a little softer but got busy and forgot about the cereal so of course it got soggy -- ate it any way.  I didn't see any preservatives listed so maybe that is why my box said it expires in Feb. 2009 when it just arrived late in December 2008.  Most cereals have 6 months to 1 year shelf life. I would hope if someone ordered the 6 box pack they would have a longer shelf life. It IS called "Summer Blend" so maybe it was manufactured in the Summer.3/06/09 -  I tried a 5 to 15 minute wait back in early January but the cereal wasn't any better.  I threw it out without finishing the box.  I was sent only one box to review for Amazon -- I would have returned the whole case to Amazon if I had purchased it.
THIS IS SO TASTY BUT HAS WAY TOO MUCH SODIUM FOR ME.  NOT GOOD FOR PEOPLE ON LOW SODIUM DIET.

Scharffen Berger's Made-In-America lightweight bar - 3 very flat ounces - delivers a highly edible payload with its 62% cacao. The wrapping alone accounts for a fair amount of the total weight. The flavor is as dense as an Arizona dust storm without being as harsh, although my Hershey-bred palate pleads for a smidgen more sugar.  The paraffin-free texture is not exactly creamy; while it does not readily melt on the tongue, neither is it gritty like some other bars.  It grates quite nicely with a microplane grater and also shaves fairly well, but doing so is made awkward by the bar's wispiness.  While I do find this is suitable for eating as is,  I think this bar would perform best as a special embellishment, such as a drizzle over warm banana bread or shaved as a topper for pots de creme.
summary: Made in America and made to please the Continental palate

reviewText: With a 3and half year old son and a baby daughter, I've seen my fair share of baby food.  Some of them have been barely palatable--bland but watery.  Some of them have been decently sweet and tasty.  Some have been simply dreadful to the point that I have had to apologize to my child for trying to make them eat any of it.  I had never before tried the pouched foods like Baby Gourmet, however, so this was a new experience in our household.Ever since the truly dreadful baby food incident, I make a point of tasting all new brands and flavors of baby food that come into our house.  Anything I can't stand doesn't get served to the kids.  So, when I opened the first pouch of Baby Gourmet Organic Simple Purees: Juicy Pear and Garden Greens I tried it out first.  Wasn't quite convinced that pear and garden greens would be a nice meld . . . and the green color didn't quite convince me.  However the taste was  sweet without being overwhelming.  It's obvious there's greenery in the puree, but the bitterness of the greens doesn't come through.  The puree itself is creamy without the kind of textures that bothered my picky eater son when he was a baby.  When I served this up to my daughter, she wolfed it down in no time, quickly eating an entire pouch and wanting more.  Now, my daughter will admittedly eat a wide range of things, but this food is clearly a favorite and she recognizes the pouches now when I get them out.For parents wanting quality store-bought baby food, this is a great option.  If you can't make your own food because of time constraints etc.  This one hundred percent organic babyfood has no added sugar or salt.  It's also gluten free and nut free, which makes it a good match for children with food allergies.  The pouch packaging is BPA free, which adds to the appeal.  These foods can be served hot or cold, and the screw top opening can be reapplied to close the pouch and use it later. If serving it warm, either heat the pouch up in a bowl of warm water, or remove the food from pouch before microwaving.  I do admit the pouches can be a little frustrating to empty: like squeezing out a toothpaste tube really: squeezing the last of the food out can be a bit tricky.  However, these containers pack easily and store well.  If you're not an arts and crafts inspired parent who can find endless uses for baby food containers, these might be easier to dispose of and are excellent for food on the go.  The variety is also fantastic.  I've only tried the one food, but looking over what Amazon has to offer, there are plenty of other flavors to explore.My only real complaint is that this baby food is not inexpensive.  It's well worth the price if you can afford it, but for the regular grocery budget, it's just not viable in our household to buy this as more than an occasional treat or travel option.  If you've the money to splurge and want to find a tasty organic baby food for your little one, I'd definitely recommend this!Happy Eating ^_^ Shanshad
summary: Tasty Product, Good Quality (My daughter agrees)

reviewText: I love this dressing- I double the amount of vinegar and subtract from the oil for a healthier and zestier taste- I also love to sprinkle over my chicken or marinade my chicken in it. Made some pasta salad with tomatoes, red peppers and it was totally delicious- A great all purpose Italian dressing!

I usually try to eat a fairly clean diet but once in a while I get a major craving for chocolate chip cookies. Usually I go for the "soft" cookies like Chewy Chips Ahoy or Keebler Soft Batch but honestly I would be afraid to read the ingredient list to see whats in them that keeps the cookie soft. So these say there's just the basic ingredients I thought Id give them a try and see how they tasted.I will say that from what I got to eat they did taste good, in my opinion they were better than the Chips Ahoy I usually get. When I say "from what I got to eat" I'm referring to the fact that when I opened the package there wasn't a single intact cookie in there! I had to eat what chunks of cookie I could find but the majority of the contents were broken down so much I would of had to eat them with a spoon! So out of the entire package I don't know how much I was able to salvage but Id guess it was about half. I don't know if this is a common problem shipping this product or not.They do taste good though, I am putting some in my cart now and will hope this new batch survive the trip!UPDATE-- Ordered 2 more packages and both came shipped intact.A few broken pieces but not destroyed into powder like the first one. They also shipped in a smaller box, not sure if that made the difference.

Such a good deal! Lasts a while, and the flakes are just the right size for toasting. Love that they're unsweetened too. I toast 1 cup on low heat (3-4) and then sprinkle with 1/4 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp cinnamon. Got this recipe from the book Well Fed, and its to die for!

I confess it, I love these things.  I don't care much for the other flavors but this stuff?  Man I enjoy the heck out of it.  Yeah I have low tastes, it's true, but for a fast, cheap, warming meal, you can't beat ramen.  And I also break up the raw noodles and sprinkle a bit of the seasoning on them for a dry snack.

The 5 pounder is the best deal to get as much gummies you want.  Each gummy looks like the cherries you get from the casino slot. They are much bigger than the classic bear shaped (probably 3 to 4 times). Just like their gummy bear counterpart, it is not too sticky that it glues your teeth. Not too sweet neither. Just the right combination of flavors to taste. It may be a bit too rubbery to some; but I like it that way.From Haribo, the biggest gummy bear manufacturer in the world (based in Germany).
This coffee is a milder blend of a morning coffee.  If you like a milder coffee in the morning buy this coffee

reviewerName: Louie the Italian Jew "Lou da Joo"
reviewText: I've bought every candy possible. I've tried every one of the top 50 candies Amazon sells. Haribo Fizzy Colas are the best IMO. Fizzy Cola andZotz Fizz Power Candy, Cherry, Apple, and Watermelon Flavors (Pack of 48)are my 2 favorites. I've tested these out with at least 20 people and everyone agrees that Fizzy Colas are awesome. They have a very distinct cola taste. The usual reaction is "Mmmm, these are good, do you have more?" Great for making friends with co-workers.
summary: Fizzy Cola tastes like Coca Cola

reviewText: Sorry, this just doesn't have much flavor. It can't compare to Maruchan's own, other flavors such as four cheese, spicy chicken, spicy vegetable, and... well, just about anything. But it is edible.
hawaiian is the best to me but my daughter likes the naturel with no berries or nut.something foe everyone.

Does this stuff taste bad? No. Does it taste good, wellllllllll.... not really. It has both stevia plus cane juice, and I question the need for both. Stevia is very distinct, and my taste-buds definitely recognize it in there. Is it bad? -- No -- but I wouldn't describe it as yummy either. And clearly the taste of straight aloe must not be that great if they felt the need to mask it with 2 powerful sweeteners. Even so, this drink is very bland. I'd never reach for a bottle of this as a thirst quencher, nor do I ever see myself craving the crisp taste of aloe. I believe it's good for you, but so are lots of other things that taste delicious, which is a word this drink does not bring to mind. I suppose the only reason to drink this is if you have a specific desire to drink aloe itself. Maybe it has properties in it someone would find meaningful. But there are better alternatives, that certainly taste better and cost less. Overall, it's just very expensive meh; solidly mediocre at a premium price. Would I get it again...? -- huh?? -- Sorry, I already forgot what we were talking about.
summary: Ho Hum - Tastes Like Sweetened Water, Minus The Flavor

reviewText: I switched to Zevia sodas, not so much for the soda, but to use them to sweeten my tea, and to water down my wines and flavor my beers.  I tend to drink tea all day, and wine or beer in the evening, and adding Zevia to them adds water to my daily liquid intake, and there's no calories,  I like dark beers without that strong hop flavor, and the flavor of this ginger root beer is perfect for sweetening up a hoppy beer.  I drink it about half root beer and half beer .... a nice light buzz and tastes great ...  and it's great for the weekend when you want to start drinking in the afternoon -- you don't get drunk, you don't get as many calories, and you can hang in with the group drinking, and keep your head, and get some fun in too ... Really, all good, and no additional calories, and it sure makes a funky or sharp beer taste a lot better.  Easy decision!!!
summary: Women - check this -- it's Great in beer!

reviewText: As someone who doesn't care for ranch, I should have known better! It's kinda ranch-y, kinda sour-cream-y, kinda mayo-y - all flavors I detest. The jalapeno flavor isn't that strong and I kinda wish it was. This is not a sauce I would put on tacos, but maybe chips or even a salad.I actually prefer Taco Bell's non-creamy sauces, which is what I'll stick with from here out! I love hot and spicy sauces, but this one, um, no.
summary: If you don't like ranch, you won't like this

reviewText: Great nuts, wil buy again, arrived very fast and have been fresh and enjoyable. Definitely will order again from this company. Good price as well and no need to battle the traffic or carry a load.

So, yes, this is a smart way to keep foods hot without using gas, electricity, or wood etc. so we are all saving the planet a tiny bit at a time. However, the advertising makes it seem like this keeps food hot enough to really cook over a long period of time - kind of like a slow cooker or crock pot,  - but this product is NOT for that.I have tried several recipes now. First, I found that I did not cook something at the beginning long enough so that when I opened the bag four hours later, it was not done and I had to still cook it some more. However, it did shorten the cook time by about 40 minutes.Second, if all your pans have handles on them, the Wonderbag will have a hard time providing a snug fit, and the heat escapes into the surrounding areas of the bag when it is not really tight up to the pot. So if you don't have a pot without a long handle on it, invest in one or more.Next, this Wonderbag is really more useful to cook and transport food and keep it really hot until you arrive at your destination. It is a great way to keep things covered and hot and protected so that you don't burn yourself during the transport.When you are not using this, you will need to find a place to store it. Once you open it up and fluff it out, it is large and takes up a lot of space. I keep mine in the top of a pantry closet. However, I can see that in some countries or some 1st world communities, people would use this every day - I don't. I use it about once a week to make a stew or soup.
summary: Better as a transporter of hot items

reviewText: The 4-pack arrived with the expiration date more than a year out from when it was arrived. They're apple jacks and haven't changed much since I was a kid. It does taste like they pulled back on the sugar coating because the cereal milk that's left over isn't pure sugar anymore.

I use these each morning, cooking them for 20 minutes together with my steel-cut oats and (dried) Turkish apricots. I love the flavor, and the texture, and, I suppose, the fact that they're good for me (or so my wife and the media tells me). I like the resealable package, and the 16oz package is convenient to store in an already cramped pantry. Nativas products have been consistently at or beyond my expectations.It's probably worth mentioning, I'd recommended these to a friend that hadn't tried Goji berries before, he ate them raw, said he hated them. I told him how I cooked with them, he tried it himself and is now a believer. Recommended.

I'm used to Cheez-its, so these were a bit spicy at first, but after a couple of tries I found I like them. Better than the regular cheese one, in fact. They're certainly more expensive than other crackers, but they're healthier and they taste like a good snack, not like cardboard. I would rather they came in a box sized to the amount (or an amount sized to the box), but I plan to buy more in the future.

Incredible price. The freshness date into 2012. Good quality packaging to keep them fresh. I've been snacking on these and they are not too sweet and they have just a light taste of apple in them. The cereal is light and crispy and easy to chew on. Not too bad!!! They are actually fun to eat.

I am a big fan of Old Bay seasoning and a huge fan of snacking on sunflower seeds. These do not disappoint. They have mild Old Bay flavor, not as intense as the seasoning. It is not too salty so it is easy to eat without having to use chapstick! As always, Bigs lives up to its name with large seeds compared to other brands like Davids. A great gift for the snacker at heart.

I go through a case of this stuff a week - it's that good! I wouldn't recommend it for people who are only used to black tea. This has a distinct green tea flavor and that can be an acquired taste. If you already like green tea you need to try this!
The peppercorns are great for my fancy grinder.  They tend to have almost a nutmeg aroma to them but are very peppery and strong tasting.
I love the sweetness and nuttiness of this oatmeal. I eat it all the time, even my kids like it. I have a subscription to this product and it's so convenient.

Funny to read the reviews of this with some reviewers saying it's not spicy enough, others saying too spicy. I'm sort of in the middle--it seems fine to me but it does have enough of a bite to make it interesting. I think most people will use this as a taco sauce (and I have to tell you, I'm not a Taco Bell restaurant fan, blehhh), but when it arrived I happened to be slicing up tomatoes for a salad, so I just plunked some on and used it as a dressing--and I loved it. Has a very different flavor and the next night I found myself craving it again. So, all week it's been tomatoes, cukes and jalapeno sauce. Not bad.My one complaint about *all* dressings like this is that the jar is too small. C'mon, it can't cost more than a few pennies to make this stuff--all the cost comes from packaging and shipping--so why not make it at least 12-ounces or even more. Again, that goes for all sauces like this, and all salad dressings.By the way, if you have a lactose intolerance (as I do), read the label: this contains whey from milk and other dairy products. I wish that lactose was listed on all labels.Live long and prosper.
summary: I'm using it as a salad dressing--it's great

reviewText: My husband likes his coffee a little stronger than I do but this coffee satisfied us both!  The K-cups are handy for a quick cup any time.

The value of this product is significant in cost per ounce, we tend to struggle to find fish that is good tasting that we can make fish cakes with and this chub mackerel was perfect for what we needed.  The taste was better than expected and was full of chunks not small parts or finds.Does what you would want and expect...
summary: Perfect for many recipes and was higher quality than I expected

reviewText: It is what it is. It's not a "chocolate bar" as the average American might think of. It is not a brownie. It is not a granola bar. It is a chewy bar composed of finely chopped almonds, dates, Dutch cocoa (which you can taste), Chia seeds, Fiber and sweetened with Agave Nectar.At 190 calories a bar, 8 grams of total fat, 25 grams of carbs, and 7 grams of protein, it makes for a healthful snack (or even breakfast). The fats are good ones, though.Our family was mixed in their reviews. My husband said he has tasted better bars at Sam's Club, I thought it was decent (though I wouldn't eat them regularly), my seven-year-old son loved them and was excited he would be eating the remaining ten bars, and my two-year-old daughter liked the bar as well.They are vegan (though we are not), and gluten-free. My son has a gluten sensitivity, so it is nice to have a snack he loves that would not aggrevate his body.Apparently these were founded by a lady who has a six-year-old vegetarian.Overall, they were good, but I don't know that they answer the claim on the box which reads, "Your chocolate prayers have been answered."

Just love it ! nothing more nothing less ... but for making this tea  I use different way , after the first second I stop my tassimo, wait a minute or 2 and then pushing the button again to get much deeper taste, it should brewing little bit slower , tea need time ... but that is the machine and not this product . I will buy again for sure ...
The beans are like typical canned beans. The 5 stars are for the cans - BPA free cans are hard to find.
I used to drink only Newmans organic Bold but this Black Tiger has become my new favorite not bitter at all very smooth and it packs that 1-2 punch in the morning that I really like.

I love dark chocolate and always have. The darker and stronger the better. That's why I love these Ghirardelli 86% cacao squares. There's just the faintest hint of sweetness, but that sweetness is nearly overpowered by the beautifully bitter taste of nearly pure chocolate. Moreover, these Ghirardelli squares are smooth and silky. There's nothing grainy about them, unlike some dark chocolate that's on the market. I enjoy eating a square with a glass of stout. The rich chocolate taste brings out the chocolate overtones in the stout.
good solid vinegar, the right price for a basic 6% acidity vinegar that we use mostly on salads.  Would buy again>

These are really good. We eat lots of these, and they are delicious. I stew them in water, and you don't even have to cook them. Just cover with water and allow to sit until softened. Usually over night is all that is necessary.

This illy issimo Caffe Coffee Drink has a strong coffee flavor that would normally be a plus since I like "bold" coffee, but the very bitter aftertaste is too much to make this enjoyable. Just to be sure it wasn't me, my coffee loving daughter also tried it and while she liked it more than I did, she said it is not a drink she would seek out again.This just misses the mark for us.CFH

I keep the big bag in the refrigerator inside another zip lock bag even though I consume this frequently and need to purchase another bag every month. Prunes are dry plums but amazingly California changed the name to DRY PLUMS in 2008 for marketing reasons. It is amazing what marketing does since here is a product called prunes which has twice the amount of antioxidants as blueberries but it does not get the recognition since it does not cost ten times more, or because it is not exotic enough or probably since it does not come from Amazon. Regardless I consume 5 to 10 of these every single day since not only these are excellent tasting fruit, it has no additives except preservatives but no added sugar. Just like any fruit the natural sugar is high, since five dried plums comes with 15gr of sugars. Tastes great with hot tea but more importantly this is a natural medicine since what a help it is when I get up every morning. The best thing you can offer your digestion system, not organic but at Costco priced for $6.29 it is a steal... Bravo.

My husband and I are confirmed flavored coffee drinkers.  Shoot, we just love coffee period and go through a 14-cup pot every day.  I have tried many French Vanilla coffees but keep coming back to this one and have been drinking it for the past three years.  It truly is a medium roast with no acid problem, which is important because we drink so much coffee.  The flavor is subtle but noticeable and not the least bit artificial.  The price is reasonable besides, currently at about $7.76 a pound.  If I were really smart, I would subscribe and save even more.

This is a tasty chai tea...it's a nice balance of taste and calories. I've had the creamy, sugary chai teas and the tea only with no sweetener or milk/cream. This product is a bit in the middle...it is somewhat sweet and milky so it feels like a treat while keeping it light.  Each packet is only 40 calories and has 7g of sugar. The spice portion is stronger (possibly less varied spices) than some I've had, so I like to add more water. This product works well as a warm drink and also as a cold (iced) version. For the days I need a little more pep, this is a great morning treat!

I buy Coconut Water for as my hydration drink because of its Potassium contents (nutrient good for the muscles) after workout. But I found a different brand that has more Potassium. This brand has less Potassium content per serving.
summary: Has less Potassium content than another brand I know

reviewText: I found Peacock's Brown Rice Vermicelli to be a fun alternative to rice in stir frys (it's rice but in noodle form).I only have two complaints:1) The directions for preparing them are poor. The bag says that the noodles only need to be soaked in water for 1 to 2 minutes, but I found that they needed at least 5 in order to be soft enough to combine with whatever else I was cooking.2) The noodles come in two large clumps. If you don't want to cook with an entire clump, you need to break it appart -- especially problematic when you only want to cook with a third or a quarter of a clump. It would be more useful if they came in many small clumps.Besides those qualms, I'd still recommend them.
love this coffee it has a taste. If you like chocolate and and macroon I reccommend to buy it. I enjoy flavored coffee will buy again,

Give me all the Kettle Popcorners you have! I've tried the butter flavor in the past, and I enjoyed it, but the Kettle flavor is by far my favorite. There's just something about salty, sweet and crunchy that does it for me. I don't find the Kettle flavor too salty, and the portion size is perfect. Otherwise, I'd end up eating a huge bag all by myself. Not that I've ever done that before...I swear! The weight of the bag is so light (1.1 ounce) so I don't even notice it when I throw it in my bag.

I travel often and usually like to have tea in the mornings.  I also prefer orange blossom honey as a sweetener but find it bothersome and messy to carry around a bottle of honey with me.  These prefilled sticks are ideal for travel, and are every bit as good as other honey I use.  They are a little pricey though, or I would rate them 5 stars.

These are not for me. I wasn't looking for something sweet necessarily, but something more flavorful that this. When more is added than called for, it seems to only increase the carbonated water taste (I enjoy drinking carbonated water plain but this made it almost too bitter) and when too little is used, I can't taste it at all. I think if it was very gently sweetened, I would enjoy it more only because then I could actually TASTE a difference.I'm tempted to try the other flavors (should have gotten the variety pack instead of this one but I almost always love a berry flavor over anything else so I thought it was a safe bet) because this really is very much the type of thing I normally like. I'm disappointed I don't!If you're looking for something sweet or strongly flavored, this is definitely not the flavoring for you.
summary: Extremely subtle flavor. A bit too subtle for me.

reviewText: Shelled pepitas at this price are a real find.  I usually laboriously shell my own.  I use this in salads, stir fry, and just for snacking.  Really good for the price.

Love, love, love Starbucks k-cups.  Pike Place, morning blend etc.  Starbucks k-cups have great flavor. A little expensive but I figure I'm worth it.  Would order more often if a little less expensive.  Amazon could you check into possibly lowering price?

I usually just pan fry my pork and it always comes out a little dry and flavor lacking.  I tried these, you just cover the pork with the seasonings and put them in the oven. Hardly any work or cleanup and the pork is nice and moist and flavorful...great product.

This flavor was too strong and I found myself needing to add plain coffee to it because it was too over whelming. I love pumpkin flavors in a lot of things, so thought sure I'd love it. That's why I ordered such a large quanity. I'm learning.
summary: Didn't like this one so much.

reviewText: Package is tightly sealed. These are very fresh, don't taste stale.  Price is pretty good for the amount you get.

I've tried a number of coffee pods (Green Mountain, Starbucks, Gevalia, etc.) for Keurig, but Donut Shop Blend from Martinson is one of the best.  It is a medium roast that is rich in flavor with a smooth finish.  One thing prospective drinkers should know is that the coffee is pretty finely ground, and there is a bit of residue at the end of the cup.  I don't mind it as it is similar to when I brew coffee in a flat bottom reusable filter in a regular coffee pot.  If the residue doesn't bother you, I think you will enjoy the flavor from this coffee.  The price per pod is competitive with other brands.  Really, it's hard to beat.

I took a cooking class when I visited Rome last year, and one of the things we made was fresh pasta.  The chef/instructor explained that in Italy flour is classified as either as type 1, 0, or 00. This scale refers to how finely ground the flour is and how much of the bran and germ have been removed.  The scale has nothing to do with the protein content - that is dependent on the type of wheat. Doppio Zero is the most highly refined - it resembles talcum powder - and is the choice of Italians for making both pizza and pasta.After learning how easy it is to make pasta, I bought a pasta maker the minute got home, and have spent the past year perfecting my skills at making it - it's so fun and easy once you get the knack.  I've been using all-purpose and semolina flours (or a blend of both) to make fresh pasta, and have been very happy with the results, but I decided to splurge on the authentic stuff.  The first batch I made with the 00 flour took me back to that cooking class in Rome and the amazing silken pasta we made that day - the texture is noticeably different.  I've also used the double-zero flour to make pizza dough, and the resulting crust was simply over the top.All-purpose flour is a perfectly acceptable substitute for authentic Italian 00 flour, and it certainly costs a lot less, but if you're ready to take your pizza and pasta making skills to the next level, you owe it to yourself to give it a try.
If you like your drink not so smooth and a bit "tangy"...this should work for you ....but... alas! ... not for  me..

This tea is the most pleasant tea you will ever drink as far as mint is concerned.  Frome the time you tear it open, to the time you add the water, you can smell the mint, and its soothing qualities begin to work their magic...I cannot live without this fine tea, perfectly perfect '
summary: The best Tea ever Plantation Mint Yummm

reviewText: I discovered this product a couple of years ago and really liked the taste in coffee , tea and on fruit and oatmeal.  It was a lot less expensive in the packets then, but I've switched to the large 12 oz. container and the price is very good. I don't use sugar and this helps me have the "sweet" and not the increased blood sugar-YEAH!!

I've been a tea drinker for about 30 years... I love tea. And although I have been a professional tea blender, and I know my Darjeeling from my Assam, I'm not one of those hoity-toity tea purists who just won't touch it if it tippy golden flowery orange pekoe, or worse, mixed with flavorings (you heathens!). No, I am more the kind of tea lover who thrives on Earl Grey and Orange Spice, and will drink Red Rose if that's what's around, because it's better than no tea at all.This chai is delightful. It has just the right balance of tea-ness and spice-ness, with just a hint of bite. I can taste cinnamon, cardamom, and I think black pepper, and it goes so perfectly with sugar and milk that I'm restraining myself from a third cup because I don't want to set off my arrhythmia. I could drink  this all day. It definitely goes on my list of "yes" teas.

HFCS - High Fructose Corn Syrup - is processed differently by your body than sugar and is considerably worse. Do not trust the propaganda of the subsidized Big Ag in America for your truthful info on food.You can get an organic version from Annie's.
summary: High Fructose Corn Syrup - NOT THE ORIGINAL

reviewText: Fabulous taste.  Who would want sugar in this.  Rich Green tea taste!It gives you alot of energy.  I enjoy it warm too.  I leave it on the porch or in the trunk of the car.I am sure it taste best in the refrigerator but I like luke warm drinks too.
summary: I bought a bottle at my local store and ran to amazon to buy a case

reviewText: I used to love this stuff when I lived in NY & couldn't believe it when I saw it for sale on Amazon. I was very excited when my package arrived & tore into it immediately.So that was the fun part but I was very disappointed once I got my first box open. The lovely dark chocolate had various degrees of white discoloration - in short - the product was old. I wound up throwing at least half of it away, only salvaging the few good cookies from each box. Teribbly disappointing. Considering how expensive Mallomars are, I will not be buying them again.

reviewerName: Juanita A. Floyd "Life is too short to read b...
reviewText: I've been seeing these in the stores and was curious to try some. There is nothing "cookie" like about these. They are pure honey with some nuts floating around in them. The only way they were palatable was smeared with some natural peanut butter to cut the sweetness. ICK!

I was surprised when I saw that oat flour was on the list of ingredients for this pasta.  I can't recall ever having had pasta that contained oats before, so I wasn't sure what to expect.  I'm not sure I could actually taste it, but the pasta did seem to have a somewhat richer flavor than I'm accustomed to.  I liked it quite a bit.Other than that, this is pretty standard whole grain pasta (28g whole grains per serving).  I'd certainly buy it again.

I love cereal. In fact I love it so much I like keeping anywhere from 10-20 boxes of different kinds in the house. When I find a good deal I stock up. For me regular Cheerios is just OK - it's not one of my favorites. To me it's kind of boring and doesn't have much taste to it. It's also not that sweet and I like my cereal a little sweet. The Honey Nut variety of cheerios is better.

This coffee is full of soothing vanilla flavor along with the bold taste of the great coffees Starbucks makes.The package directions are for very strong coffee so I am able to use half the coffee for the amount of water.  This creates a rich (but not overly strong) soothing vanilla flavored coffee.  It is a cup that I love having on a rainy afternoon (or evening) with a fire going in the fireplace and a good book.  My cats and I curl up in a mound of blankets and pillows and read, enjoy the warmth of the fire and the great taste of Starbucks coffee.

SAHALE SNACKS - DRY ROASTED CALIFORNIA ALMONDS W SEA SALT: These were just right and would even satisfy Goldilocks, as they were delicious, with just the right amount of salt and just the right amount of nuts in the bag for those times when you are on the go and need to soothe the hungry beast within. I often go hiking or kayaking here in Hawaii and like an easy-to-carry snack that provides energy without processed sugar - so these nuts fit the bill.As advertised, the nuts came in a very easy-to-open package which could probably could be opened with your teeth in those times when both hands are not available.Namaste,Becca Chopra, author of Chakra Secrets

Different strokes...I generally like Ragu sauces, but I almost always spice them up with additional garlic, onion, sweet basil, oregano, peppers, etc. as they are not as flavorful as I like by themselves.  This one has a nice thickness to it, but still needs IMHO lots of additional spices--if you like it robust.  If you're like my friend Larry (we used to call him Mr. Bland--he liked Tastycake Vanilla CreamiesTastyKake Variety Packa lot vs. their chocolate cupcakes for example), you might just like this sauce as is.  However, I liked it better than the similarly packagedBertolli Premium Pasta Sauce, Summer Crushed Tomato & Basil, 13.5-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 6).  As for the packaging, I can see some advantages under specific circumstances, but mostly the amount is too small and one still needs to cook the pasta (actually I use rice to avoid the gluten).  If you are stir frying your ingredients (i.e. fresh onion, garlic, etc.) like I do, the microwave packaging here doesn't help at all.  If you are cooking for one person, the amount may be sufficient for you.  You can put the leftover package right into the fridge for the next day--use one of the plastic clips for potato chip packages to close the cut off edge--or just pour it into a plastic or glass container etc.  Still, if you'd used a jar, you'd just put the lid back on...So, innovative idea, but not all that valuable IMHO.

I mix this soy flour with buckwheat flour and all-purpose, gluten free flour to make a great pancake batter. I love the fact that this soy flour is organic and is high in both protein and fiber. That really makes a delicious and healthy pancake mix. I add organic soy milk, olive oil and baking powder to the mix and create delicious vegan and gluten free pancakes!
summary: A great flour to mix with other kinds

reviewText: I enjoy Redi Burger. It comes in a loaf; so, you have to open both ends of the can, loosen the edges with a knife and push it out. It has a softer texture than it did some years ago. You have to slice it and then pan fry it in some oil. It is very delicious and tastes a little like spam to me. It also has the absolutely delicious smell of Morningstar Farms vegetarian bacon - but you have to really think about it to detect it. It's great on burgers or sliced and topped with gravy. I grew up on meat analogues and enjoy most of Worthington's products.
summary: Redi Burger is like vegetarian Spam

reviewText: Very good product, but I gave it 4 stars because I found "Made in Nature" brand which comes in 3 48oz packages and is a plumper raisin.

Following the great reviews for this coffee, I went ahead and ordered it for the office.Out of 15 people, nobody liked it. We tried making it with less and less grounds a few times and it always came very thick and with a extremely strong chicory (like burned wood) flavor which is obviously and aquired taste, so if you havent tried chicory coffee priorly and you are not sure if you will like it or not, and you see the great reviews from people that aboviously had already tried it and liked it, do not take a chance with this since you will get 3 cans, maybe buy one at the store to try it first.We ended up with extra cans to give away. It is really an aquired taste.
A great deal and the best way for me to order it. I will be ordering it regularly from now on.

I have been eating a lot of honey (it is one of nature's best foods).It is somewhat differentiate the taste of different honeys. To me, there are two prime ways of differentiating honey taste. One is the level of sweetness. All honeys are sweet and some are sweeter than others. What I have found, however, is that sweetness of the honey tends to overwhelm all other flavors. The second is the floral aroma, which gives honey that very subtle flavor.This honey is not too sweet (still very sweet) by honey standards. That moderate level of sweetness allows its rich floral aroma to pass through. Its texture is also very smooth without bombarding your teeth or tongue with overwhelming sense of sweetness.This honey is absolutely delicious on crackers (preferably ones without too much salt).Pros:1)Moderately sweet in comparison to other types of honey.2)Rich floral taste.Cons:1)The name "Doctor Bio" is somewhat misleading. This isn't a medication nor even a herbal remedy.2)More expensive than other types of honey.

This is a great cup of coffee. It is not bitter and smells fantastic when u open the bag. I like that it is environmentally friendly. I had no problem with it working in my Kuerig. They send a container to hold one package too. It's also the most economical that I have found.

I love Kit Kat bars.  Always have!  They taste delicious and they have, as another poster wrote, just the right amount of crunch!  Yum yum!These little bars are addictive, as I can attest.  :-)I just had my second Kit Kat bar.......so that's two, inside of 4 minutes!  LOL!And they go so well with a nice, cold glass of milk!

I've been really happy with this.  We bought it as a 'return to simple' to help with some of our dietary needs.  This sugar isn't white sugar, and it may take a *little* bit of adaption in your tastes, but not much.  After the first day, this sugar tastes better to me than white in my coffee, and in baking I personally can't tell a difference.

I live is a rural area in Florida, we have frequent thunderstorms and we often lose out power, and as we also have a well, when we lose power we lose our water as well. After going through a hurricane that took our power for over three weeks I decided I would get prepared. This product will cook well, even in a fireplace in a cast iron pot.Throw in some of the dehydrated legumes and it will give your family protein with no fuss. no muss. Very good product.

There's nothing wrong with the flavor of NEWTONS FRUIT CRISPS Apple Cinnamon snacks.  If you've eaten any sort of artificially-flavored apple cinnamon snack (Nutra-Grain bars, etc.), the taste will be familiar.No, the problem with the NEWTONS FRUIT CRISPS is the texture.  It's completely unappealing.  Crunchy-shell-with-soft-center is nothing new, but these are ... weird.  Instead of being cookie-like, the outer coating has the texture of a water cracker--thin and crunchy.  The fruit-flavored inside isn't soft, but chewy, like some sort of dried fruit bar or a Fruit Roll-Up.  The combination of cracker-crispy and tough-chewy make me think for all the world that I was eating something stale.  They *weren't* stale, but that's the best way I can describe the texture.  It's like biting into a Fig Newton that's been left out too long.I don't think I'll be buying these regularly.

SpecialK and BzzAgent teamed up to send me a couple samples of the SpecialK Vanilla Cappuccino and Chocolate Mocha Breakfast Shakes. The shakes are high in Fiber and other needed nutrients. A+ for that. The taste is another thing. I just thought it really obvious I was drinking a protein shake not a lovely breakfast cappuccino when I had the Vanilla flavored sample. The mocha blew me away and I drank it first, so I expected that Special K put that same care and attention into the flavor of the Vanilla too. Overall it was good and convenient but the flavor was too plain for me. I want something I can personally enjoy as a breakfast substitute so I don't miss waffles so much.
summary: Special K can do better and has

reviewText: This is a great treat. Not as many cashews as I thought, but lots of peanuts, granola, sweet butterscotch like coating on one side, and enough cashews to get 1 in every bite. I would wait for it to go on sale though ;-) Thanks for reading; I hope this helps.

Considering the ingredients list on the Slim Jim they are not the healthiest of snacks. My husband likes them tho. He is a golfer and finds they are handy to toss in his bag for a day on the course. These sticks are longer than the norm and 140 calories each. They have a chewy, texture that gives you more to chomp on than say the quick swallow of candy. Overall, considering what is in them they are not for me.

This oil is very light and doesn't have a distinct flavor, so, you can pretty much use it to fry/sauté/bake/etc. anything. It's a great oil for cake-mixes because of the no-flavor factor. For stir-frys, this is also excellent because it has a decent smoke-point and the same goes for making excellent old-fashioned popcorn on the stove-top.This oil is also delicious mixed with oil in salad dressings for a bit 'lighter' flavor.Oh, and yes, this oil is very good for you [which is always a bonus].

We have tried nearly every Kernel Season's flavor and really have not found a single one we don't like.  This assortment is the sweet stuff and they are all really good.  Thanks to the Kernel Season's product line, we have really come up with a great system for making great popcorn.  We start with theKernel Season's Movie Theatre Butter for Popping & Topping Popcornfor a popping oil (we never use this for a topping, too oily).  2 or 3 tablespoons with about 1/3 a cup of popcorn gives the popcorn an excellent subtle buttery tasting base for the seasonings to stick to.  We pop all our popcorn in the greatest popcorn device ever, theWabash Valley Farms Whirley-Pop Stovetop Popcorn Popper.  We also likeAmish Country Popcorn Mushroom Popcornwhich pops up big and fluffy.  After the popcorn is popped and cools for a few seconds we dump it into a clean plastic grocery bag and shake in about 3 or 4 teaspoons of our favorite dry seasoning (more or less to taste) and shake it up well.  Believe me, this is a great bowl of popcorn.  The seasonings don't work too well with hot air poppers because they need something to stick to.This selection of dry seasoning is the sweet pack.  The Kettle Corn, used in the right measure (not too much! Subtlety is the key!) is almost indistinguishable from the real thing.  The Caramel flavoring is understated, but really good.  Unlike the Kettle Corn, the Caramel flavoring doesn't taste too much like actual caramel corn but getting real caramel corn is a completely different process than most people want to partake in when preparing a simple bowl of popcorn.  This gives you a nicely sweetened popcorn with a taste of Caramel that is not too overbearing, different than normal caramel corn but still good.The Chocolate Caramel flavor we put off to the last because we really enjoyed the other flavors and this one just didn't seem that appealing. Chocolate? I am happy to say that when we actually tried it we were very pleased to find out that it was our favorite of the three.  Again, don't go crazy, just go for a subtle taste and I believe you will really enjoy the awesome taste of all these flavors, especially the Chocolate Caramel.It has been a couple of months since we have started using the Kernel Season's Seasonings and I can't imagine making a bowl of popcorn where I am not experimenting with one of them.  I believe the trick is not to go too heavy with the flavoring; don't overwhelm the popcorn and have an good buttery tasting popping oil base.  Experiment a little with how much you use, make sure you mix the flavorings in well and I think you will be pleased with the result.

Although they keep about a year we use them fast enough that we use the Amazon Subscribe and Save feature to buy them.  Their blueberries are gone through the most rapidly here, but we also enjoy a lot of their cranberries and cherries.  For gifts we have some boxes sent a couple of times to relatives who love them, too.  Their fruits especially go over with a niece's 6 year old son.
summary: We so love the Traverse Bay dried fruits

reviewText: I like this candy.  The only problem I had with it was it was quite hard. I read the reviews so ordered it.  The name White Rabbit Creamy Candy gave me the indication that the product was soft.  I will not order it again because it is difficult for me to chew.  The flavor is good.

If you're looking for a nice mild flavor in your Cheez-Its, you'll like this flavor.  I liked the smell when I opened the package and liked the taste - these crackers have a nice smooth taste with no weird aftertaste. I don't find the taste to be bland - it's just a very mild and light flavor (which makes it very easy to eat a lot of them in one sitting). I can see munching on these crackers by themselves or when you don't want the cracker to overwhelm other items that you're eating. If they were a bit lower in fat content (7gm for 25 crackers), they'd be perfect.
These cranberries have a wonderful texture and flavor.  The will make a great addition to my trail mix and sugar rolls.

Cinnamon Altoid mints REALLY do a fine job of making your breath fresh with their extra strong cinnamon flavor. For some people these may taste a little too strong, perhaps; but I enjoy them very much. Of course, being that these have a cinnamon flavor they make for great candy as well. They're delicious.Altoid mints are very low in calories, fat, sodium and more. The main effect, therefore, is simply to make your breath as fresh as it could ever be. They taste great as candy, too. They come in that famous little tin that keeps them fresh until their expiration date.Overall, I highly recommend Altoids as THE ultimate in breath mints. People who also simply love that strong cinnamon taste will delight in these, too.

not hard and difficult to bite like the original granola's.  sold by starbucks individually for much more. great taste. unless you have $$ to throw around, I personally would save these for adults who appreciate the taste, quality and the price.
Very tasty and nicely sweet without being overpowering.  The rootbeer flavor is subtle, doesn't knock you over.  I quite like all the yummy products and this is another winner.
High quality. Good stuff. This is what your local organic store buys and then sells you by the spoonful from the bulk bins.
summary: Your local organic store sells you this same stuff with a mark up!

reviewText: If you enjoy preparing Asian style foods at home it is important to get the proper ingredients to get that flavor you are looking for... Using genuine ingredients will help you achieve results that will have your friends and family asking "How did you make it taste so good?"  (I just tell them I use secret ingredients).  The Shaohsing Rice Cooking Wine is awesome.  You will love it.  Buy some.

i grew up on Ronzoni spaghetti and Rigatoni. Ronzoni is made locally so it was always available at a good price and my mother - the best cook in the world - bought their products and made "macaroni a couple times a week. Recently, Cooks Magazine did a show on public TV and mentioned that Ronzoni's spaghetti had always scored their highest numbers for taste and texture. Go figure! But this show included Barilla and they said that this made-in-Italy pasta nudged out the former king of the hill, Ronzoni. Naturally, I had to get a box and test it and, to my minor surprise, the taste, texture and ability to stand up to a strong sauce (home made - chopped San Marzano tomatoes, onions, garlic, olive oil, a touch of aged Balsamic, a few red chili flakes and a tiny bit of sugar) was quite close to tried and true Ronzoni. Is it better? Well, Cooks thought so and they seem to be a lot more respected than I but having enjoyed Ronzoni for (gulp) decades, it's hard for me to say that Barilla really bested them. I would say it was a close contest and Barilla can hold its head high.A few thoughts - make sure that you do not over cook this or any spaghetti. It cooks quickly because it's so thin and goes from good to glue when you boil too long. Also, and this is key, salt the water. Yeah, I know SALT!!! Tell your doctor to forget it. The only reason people who watch everything they eat live longer is because they are so miserable that it only seems that they live longer!Salt - it makes all the difference in the world - just don't over do it.4 Stars and maybe 4 1/2 considering it took on the champ.  Check out the write up at:[...]You'll thank me later ;-)
summary: It's good - even when compared to my personal favorite, Ronzoni

reviewText: This review is for the Sriracha flavored Kettle brand chips.(From the Kettle site) - Ingredients: Potatoes, safflower and/or sunflower and/or canola oil,maltodextrin, sugar, salt, red bell pepper powder, spices, garlic powder, paprika,vinegar, natural flavors, dried red pepper sauce (aged red peppers, vinegar, salt),paprika extract (color).Serving size 1 oz. (13 chips): 150 calories, 9g fat, 1g sat. fat, 16g carbsThe one drawback of these chips, like many kettle chips, is the high fat content and high calories per serving.  The bags I received were 2 ounces, so the labels actually included the new format with the nutritional information per container!I opened several bags at work and asked my co-workers to help me rate them.  Pretty much everyone agreed: very tasty with a medium level of heat, slight Sriracha flavor, but good spicy potato chip flavor, good balance of salt, not too terribly greasy like cheaper commercial brands tend to be.  Everyone agreed that these were very good and they are highly recommended to kettle chip fans who like a little heat.  Just don't expect them to taste exactly like Sriracha.  If you want that, get the sea salt flavor and just put Sriracha on the chips.  =)Recommended!

I love ginger - I have been known to make pots of tea from fresh ginger and honey, and I'm finishing off a ginger syrup that I made that is fantastic with bubbly water (and even vodka). So, I was looking forward to trying this. Having tried it, I can say that I would not ever purchase this.I tried it hot first, following the instructions (then putting half in the fridge to cool). First, it doesn't look at all like the picture on the outside of the foil packet. Instead of a lovely golden yellow, it is the light brown of a beef or vegetable broth. Hoping that wasn't a harbinger of things to come, I sat down to enjoy the flavor. Unfortunately, I didn't really enjoy it. There was VERY little lemon flavor - more like a slight lemon aftertaste, and only if you're really looking for it. The overall flavor is much more bitter than fresh ginger would be, with an almost medicinal taste. The ginger bite is there, and is about the only thing that really reminds me of what ginger should be.Then I tried it cold (with an ice cube to help cool it down). The flavor didn't seem as strong, but it still had the bitter taste. After those first few sips of both hot and cold, I honestly couldn't drink any more of this. The aftertaste was too much and I genuinely did not want to finish the drink. So - I didn't.Overall, if you're used to something like Stash Ginger Honey tea, or even tea made from fresh ginger, then this is no substitute. The flavor profile is very different, and the bitterness is hard to get past. If you have the opportunity to try a smaller amount before purchasing this, then I would highly recommend you do so. It definitely seems like something that would appeal to a very specific (and possibly limited) audience.

We are coconut lovers, especially coming from the part of India where everything starts and ends with coconut. Unfortunately we have not been consistently getting good fresh coconut in this part of the world. We have been on the lookout for a way to satisfy our craving for good coconut. Our only other alternative was to use frozen coconut from local Indian stores. Even though we have been seeing dried coconut in wholefoods, we were skeptical about the freshness and the wholesomeness. After extensive research on the web, we found that there were many others like us, and they were using and recommending this brand of Organic dehydrated shredded coconut. We got our first batch a few months back and have been using it since. Extremely happy with the quality of the coconut. We have tried so many recipes, including desserts, entrees and also fresh coconut milk.Highly recommended :)here are some nice recipes using this coconut:[...][...][...]
summary: Highly recommended, next best to fresh coconuts !!!

reviewText: As with most sodas you can immediately tell the difference in a bottle vs. a can. Even the tactile feel of the bottle give one the same feel as a new haircut.  This also happens to be my favorite flavor. Let me qualify that; it is my favorite Izze flavor. I am afraid they would go out of business as I use this as a treat instead of a water substitute.When I am in a brick and mortar book store I purchase the Izze at any price and a cup of ice to sip as I peruse through potential purchases and discuss thing with other patrons.At home I keep some a few bottles handy for emergencies when I feel like setting back in a cushy chair and thinking over the remains of the day. Of course the sparking liquid is date sensitive so I am sure to consume it before it goes out of date. Also be aware that the bottle contains two servings, so occasionally I put a stopper in the open bottle. Looking at the ingredients makes me fee ecologically responsible. I am not against refined sugar mind you but I abhor corn in my drinks.

Tried them all and Coffee-Mate is the best.  It doesn't clump up like other creamers and it dissolves quickly with little sticking to the cup.  Pricier than no-name generic brands, but if you love a smooth cream in your coffee, this is it.

I love cereal. I'm like Seinfeld where he has all those boxes of cereal in the kitchen except I have more. At any given time I'll have 10-20 boxes of cereal in the house - different kinds. They keep a long time unopened so I stock up when I see a good deal. This cereal is one of my favorites. The taste is really good. If you like blueberry taste this is for you. I also love that it's a lot healthier than many other cereals with it's high fiber content.
This coconut oil is the best!  Not only is it organic, but it is the most affordable coconut oil I have found.  I love it in baking, cooking, and as a body moisturizer.  It smells heavenly!
I am totally addicted to these chocolate twizzlers.  I can't find them in the stores where I live.  Thank you for selling these, please don't stop.

I'm a pretty big fan of Think Thin's Chunky Peanut Butter bar and wanted to try some of the brand's other flavors so I bought this bar at the store.  After trying one of Think Thin's other fruit flavored bars, I was leery of this one but it seemed like it had the potential to offer interesting flavors.The flavor of the Tangerine Cremesicle does taste artificial but not terrible.  If you hate fake chocolate flavoring, this may be an option for you.  This bar has less protein than Think Thin's other bars at 15 grams (most have 20 grams).  Those with sensitivity to sugar alcohols and soy should probably pick another protein bar.Think Thin's  Tangerine Cremesicle bar has an exterior white coating and a tan center. The exterior flavoring is similar to vanilla.  Also notable about the exterior coating is that it is sensitive to heat so if you will be in warm temperatures, expect meting to occur.  For photos of the bar and nutrition facts, please see the product image gallery.As there are so many protein bars out there, I doubt I will reach for this one again.These bars are a product of the United States.

I gave four starts because I love how this machine offers the ability for milk capsules to be added to your coffee drinks. The taste was fair to good, and did help smooth out the flavors of the coffees. In general, I like coffee black but I also enjoy cappuccino, but found that these capsules helped mask some of the dry, tasteless coffees.
Nice and fresh and crunchy.  You can get really good deals on these if you monitor the price and coupons with Subscribe and save.

This is one of my my favorite flavors of the Sensible Foods Fruit snacks. They are gluten free which is necessary for me with Celiac Disease. I love this flavor and like to sprinkle them on yogurt for breakfast in the morning when berries are out of season and so expensive. I wish the pieces were bigger to make it easier to just eat by themselves as a snack. My daughter is diabetic and also loves this line of snacks.

Like the title says, I'm fairly tolerant of low/no fat substitute foods....I don't expect them to taste nearly as good as the original, but imho, this was SO bad, I actually ended up throwing the jar away (which I normally NEVER do with food unless it spoils....). I can't even begin to describe the taste...it was beyond just chemically-tasting. It literally tasted like what I'd imagine a thick, wallpaper glue would taste like. And I don't mean just a bad aftertaste...it literally tastes like some kind of weird, chemically strange glue that they tried to make taste peanut-y.  And the consistency is nothing like peanut butter, not even runny peanut butter. It's sort of like a thick whipped gelatin-like mousse.  Really bad.Try PB2 (or generic defatted peanut flour you can buy online) or the "Better n Peanut Butter" brand of low fat peanut butter.  Although it needs to be kept refrigerated (or else it can get moldy in a few weeks after it is opened), it is fairly close to peanut butter in both texture and taste.
summary: I'm pretty tolerant w/ fat free substitutes, but I couldn't stomach this stuff....

reviewText: They are good dried in a trail mix.  They are also good cooked with rice (with a little extra water).

I just tried this product. I used one of the entire 3-ounce packages with 128 ounces of water after bringing the water to 180 degrees in the microwave (I like to make tea in quantity). After expanding, the package of pearls fits perfectly in aNew Twist-Lock Spice Ball Tea Infuser Herb Infuser, Stainless Steel, Extra Large Size (4 x 3.5"). I was able to make another 64 ounces of tea reusing the peals but it was half as strong and not as good. Now, Rishi Jasmine Pearl is 5 to 10 times more expensive than tea bags (costing $.50 to $.75 a cup) but it's a completely different flavor and so can't be compared.I know I will likely offend the purests here with what I did next - I added three individual packets ofCrystal Light On The Go Natural Lemonade, 10 Count Packets (Pack of 6)(enough for 48 ounces in the 128 ounces of water). But, the acid (I assume) wholly changed the flavor of this tea (much greater effect than I've found with any other tea). I'm not surprised that a Google search shows green tea lemonade is a fairly popular recipe. This combination is now a favorite drink. My next experiment will have to be with a couple of cups of fresh squeezed lemon juice.I'm trying green tea because L-theanine (the amino acid providing the unique flavor of the tea) has been shown to boost one's immune system as well as to reduce mental and physical stress (in other words, untwisting twisted thinking ... this was my primary goal as I often get mentally jumbled with to-do lists, etc). L-theanine is supposed to be helpful for concentration (improving cognition and mood purportedly in a synergistic manner with caffeine) and relaxation. Thus, L-theanine can be found both in many nighttime sleep aids (without, of course, the caffeine) as well as daytime power drinks.UPDATE: Don't make a large quantity - the tea becomes very bitter, even undrinkable, after a couple of days.2nd UPDATE: S.L. mentioned the contamination issue. Salmonella is a problem with eggs, hamburger, etc. However, I understand tea that has been sitting at room temperature for any length of time (such as Sun Tea or by adding new tea to a used pitcher as is commonly done at resturants) is a notorious source instead of the coliform bacteria (I believe salmonella is more about handling issues - for example, four years ago a Arizona tea vendor made 14 people sick with improper washing). Thus, one should never keep brewed tea for more than eight hours at room temperature ("Sun" tea is better made in the frig over night). Even refrigerated fresh tea will last only 2-3 days... and fresh lemon juice has the same limited shelf life. Don't drink if the tea appears darker. Many restaurants "solve" these problems by switching to instant tea and "garbage" sweeteners (which in no way defeat the positive effects of Green Tea's L-theanine) as they will remain good to drink much much longer. Fresh tea leaves also often themselves become contaminated with coliform bacteria. I assume this is why bagged teas brew tea that lasts days longer as well as the point for the serious packaging used in this product (I've also found store bought mango and orange juice used for sweetening last much longer than fresh as well). Again thusly, making large quantities of tea to use for more than a few days afterward wholly defeat the purpose of a healthy drink - even worse than coffee or root beer (banned for its ill effects)... ha ha.I now use half of a 3-ounce Rishi Tea package in a 51 ounce bottle of Highland Spring Water (crisp and not mineralized water is key to good tea as chlorinated, deoxygenated, and hard tap water will produce negative interactions) to "brew" several days in the frig. I then add three 17-ounce bottles of Orange Mango Sparkling ICE Spring Water (which already contains a small amount of green tea) and the juice from a couple lemons (I still find the fruit acid very important to a far better flavor).
summary: Tastes great but costs much more

reviewText: I found using 2 packages at a time works a lot better for me.......don't have to worry if I have enough dough, and if there's any left.........roll out thinner, brush with some melted butter, sprinkle with cinnamon sugar...nuts .......dessert is done too!Add the olive oil and warm water.....I used more than called ... using my hands a little doesn't take any more time either.
summary: OLIVE OIL  DOES  MAKE THE DIFFERENCE!

reviewText: This honey has an excellent flavor, especially after i set it in warm tap water (100-110 degrees F) for about an hour to get it real creamy. The sweetness is perfect, the creamy body is just right and it just has a downright nice "honey taste".The creamy honey is far better than the raw, organic honey that can crystalize after sitting for a long while, which has a grainy texture I don't care for.

I am rating this only 2 stars because I did not like the taste.  Of course it is a personal preference.  I also did not like that eggs were required to bake the bread. I simply wanted a gluten-free bread mix.  I tried the sweet bread recipe as well as the regular bread but I didn't really want a sweet bread with all the sugar and it did not improve the taste  anyway.  So now I am stuck with 2 unopened packages of this stuff.  Anybody out there want them to try?

I've had a lot of couscous, but somehow missed out on this larger "pearl" type. The shape makes it a completely different product! The texture is more chewy and pleasant, and it holds up better in general. Cooking it is as easy as making rice and the instructions worked just right.  The "original" flavor just has rosemary and is pretty perfect as a base for recipes or just with salt.  This version, unfortunately, adds a mix of spices, corn syrup, and MSG.  The result is a generic flavor reminiscent of bad rice mixes.  The texture is also more slimy.  I recommend Side Mates pearl couscous, but go with original and add your own flavors.

reviewerName: Modern Blue Argonaut "No I do not have a shoe...
reviewText: I've been using Torani syrups for years, and the flavors are generally accurate and the quality/concentration very good. My only realy complaint with this is that they're still using Splenda as their sweetener when Stevia is an all natural zero calorie healthy sweetener. I wish they would do a Stevia line. Torani also sells pump tops to install into the bottle, but be sure to use it a few times first or the syrup will splash out.

The lone ingredient is organic coconut chips. Chips must be the technical word for this size of flake. If you are interested in eating foods more in their natural state but uninterested in cracking your own coconuts, I'd say this is about the best you can get. These chips are delicious. The taste is light and buttery and mildly sweet.  I like them as a snack right out of the bag. They are a nice addition to my green smoothies and I look forward to trying them in grain-free pancakes.
I can tell this is lowfat, especially compared to the regular flavor. Still beats anything Keurig so I give it three stars.
Love my k-cups. This is our favorite flavor. we use a lot of these and this is a great price.

I'm not really a fan, and won't get these again. The flavor, while somewhat "grainy", wasn't bad. The bars were especially crumbly though. Open the pouch and there's not a single bar to eat, but about twenty little pieces of one. So much for convenience. Additionally, the bars are only 1.2 oz (a Clif Bar is 2.4 oz), and while the ingredients are good, they aren't organic (in a Clif Bar: mostly organic). And Clif Bars stick together in one cohesive piece like they should. No trouble eating them during active sports (cycling, etc).Anyway,Clif Barsare my go-to 'bar food' of choice for packing for trips, accompanying extended exercise, etc. I'm always looking for new healthy options, but these don't compare.
summary: Small, crumbly, and not organic. Go for a Clif Bar instead.

reviewText: My kids love putting drinks in the freezer and trying to make semi-frozen slushies. But if they forget to take them out they get frozen solid and then they spend a lot of time chipping them out. So I thought this would be a great buy. It's instant and they can have their slushy at just the right slushiness.There are problems though. Our slushy cup leaks. I know there is a hole on the top (if you are using soda, you have to let the air escape every few shakes) so even covering that, the lid leaks at the sides. Messy! It takes a lot of shaking to get the icy look of a slushy. But even after getting an arm workout, shaking it for three to five minutes, the drink does get icy looking and very cold but still doesn't have that frozen feel of a real slushy. It is just ever-so-slightly slushy.Probably not worth the money, even as a junky fun thing. I'd rather go to the convenient store and get a 99 cent real slushy.

The spaghetti with meat sauce is one of the better ones of the Hormel line but it does have its faults. The sauce is sickly sweet and has a tang of too much acidity for my liking. The noodles, though, are surprisingly good and the texture of the bits of meat add just enough to the meal to make it better. The meat itself, like most of the Hormel line, doesn't really have much of a taste of it's own but without it the spaghetti would fall much flatter. This would be definitely a five star for me if only the sauce was a bit more robust in flavor with less of the overwhelming sweetness. The other pasta dishes of the line can be doctored up easily by adding some hot sauce to mask the sweetness but for some reason I'm not a fan of spicy spaghetti so I can't bring myself to do it :)For what this is -- a non-perishable prepared food that is fairly cheap -- it's pretty good. It will fill you up quickly at very low effort and cost, but if you are going to compare it to spaghetti you can make yourself, well, there really isn't any comparison.
summary: One of the better Hormel meals

reviewText: I love tea!!!  I also make it a point to buy organic products as much as possible.  I was really looking forward to trying this tea but found it disappointing.The jasmine is so strong that I found it overpowering.  I tried making it again using much less tea and steeping only briefly but the jasmine was still too strong.  I will not buy this product in the future.

Bought these when they showed up as a special offer on my kindle fire, thank you Amazon!  I hadn't tried this Lindt Lindor truffle flavor yet.  I love the white and milk chocolate combo!They arrived in good shape  and the green wrappers with the daisies make them look so cheerful and pretty, they will look so nice tucked into an Easter basket! That's if they last that long, they taste really good. :)

These tasted great and were very fresh!  Everything seemed to be very high quality.  I would have given it 5 stars, but out of the box we got one package that had moldy fruit in it.  It happens, it's fresh food, but it was still a nasty shock for the person who had poured them directly in their mouth :(

The product is normally great.  However, it arrived frozen this time.  The delivery was delayed due to a winter storm and the product must have frozen during the delay.  This caused the contents to separate more than usual.  I contacted the manufacturer who said that if it had been frozen it would affect the quality and they were right.  I was too desperate for the milk substitute to deal with returning it so just used it and resigned myself to the poorer quality.
summary: A great product arrived in a sorry state.

reviewText: I don't have much of a sweet tooth.  Hard candy and soda taste terrible to me.  I have my coffee shop drinks made with at least half the amount of syrup or sweetener usually used.  These coconut chips are perfectly sweet to me.  In fact, Nutiva has become my favorite brand of coconut products!  Every Nutiva purchase of mine has been high-quality and wholesome.  Everything has arrived promptly and in good shape, including these coconut chips.  Since these are organic, not overly sweet, and convenient to purchase through Amazon, they'll be replacing the dried coconut sold at my local Costco.  It's all Nutiva for our house!
I  have found that other Goji berries taste much better but these are by far the cheapest ones. They are pretty small as well.
This brand is my second favorite keurig brand!  I am picky on which brands I like and rate this after Caribou which is my favorite!

Having grown up in Europe I can assure you that this is as good or better as the cocoa my very rich aunt always bought for me. It is especially good if you add a tiny bit of instant espresso powder to your mixture.
I didn't read the ingredients in this stuff so I could just ENJOY! A sprinkling of crushed red pepper made it ZING!

I'm a popcorn lover who has no love of sweet popcorn. There are times when I'm quasi-hungry, i.e. craving something that's not junk but nothing that can qualify as a meal either. Popcorn is a good choice; the problem is that I'm no fan of salt, even though I like butter. I've been searching for a quality shake-cheese (no, I'm not a New Englander), preferably cheddar, but there's nothing available here in brick-and-mortar establishments.Enter Kernel Season's White Cheddar Seasoning.This stuff is just what I needed and one need not limit it to popcorn! Since I always add melted butter to my popcorn, no problem with Kernel Season's sticking and in my experience, one need not add copious amounts in order to get the benefit of a natural cheesy taste (your own mileage may vary). Another reason I like having it on hand is to add cheesy goodness to things to which I'd normally add cheese I grate when needed. Don't get me wrong--Kernel Season's is no substitute for that Fontina Val d'Aosta you've been using up by adding it to tomato soup but it certainly does in a pinch and adds a nice depth to soups, salad dressings, and such. There are times I don't have cheese on hand and it's nice to know I can fall back on Kernel Season's.It's evident that a lot of care when into the development of Kernel Season's, including its presentation. The 2.85 oz. shakers can easily be tucked away to be enjoyed away from home, e.g. at picnics or even at the movies (don't let the users catch you). As long as it's kept cool, it doesn't need to be refrigerated, it's certified gluten-free, and it's even kosher! (Although things are improving of late, it hasn't been my experience that there's much good going on in the way of kosher cheese, which makes Kernel Season's even more of a standout.) I'm extremely fussy about what I ingest and on that note, I'm very pleased to be able to recommend Kernel Season's. I recently suggested it on Chowhound and am awaiting feedback from first-time users. Give it a try!

MiO's Liquid Peach is a low-to-no-calorie mixer.  Mixing a squirt or two of it with an 8 to 16 oz. glass of water creates the equivalent of what I'll call "peach water."  While that tastes fine, mixing in more liquid makes the drink stronger than I prefer.  The peach flavor, however, is a nice change from water with lime or lemon and doesn't require me to wring the juice out of a peach.  Worth a try.
We've bought this coffee a couple times now and love the flavor.  A very rich, full bodied coffee without any bitter notes.
summary: Rich, full bodied - no bitter or flat notes at all.

reviewText: These are delicious. I can look down and realize I've eaten half a box with no trouble...The cookies are a nice size and have a satisfying crunch. They do make lots of crumbs, so beware. They're not overly sweet, but they don't taste like cardboard as many elimination diet sweets do either. There's a slight smattering of sugar on top that's a nice touch. If you can eat frosting, I imagine they'd be really good for decorating.
summary: One of the Best Enjoy Life Products

reviewText: These are the only rolled wafers I've ever found that do not contain hazelnuts. I'm allergic so this was a great find. Beware the occasional empty box though. One box in one case of one order was sealed, but empty. Surprise! But OK, minus one buck and one star for bad QC in this instance. Otherwise, these are very tasty, great price (twelve on last order, a buck-a-box), and more than half the cookies per box are whole and unbroken. Will be buying again.

My local Walmart and Target both have this, ground or whole bean, at a regular price of less than $9 per 12 oz. bag. It's WAY overpriced here.It is an excellent coffee - I'm drinking it as I write this: an interesting hint of woody, creamy, citrusy taste that's dark but without the burnt aftertaste that comes with many dark roasts.
summary: 1 star for price, 5 stars for taste

reviewText: Some people love the taste of beer and alcohol.  I can't stand it.  Likewise, some people don't like the taste of V8 Juice.  I love it.  But, I'll admit I didn't love it at first.  It's an "acquired" taste (grin).I try to keep as many cans around the house as possible.  It's great for snacking and is great comfort food.  The only problem I had with this order wasn't Amazon's problem.  The UPS guy "tripped" getting out of his truck and the box went slamming to the ground.  And when I opened the box, 2 cans had popped open.  But, I can forgive the UPS guy and 2 cans out of 48 is livable.

These chips have some of the best barbecue flavor of any chip without all the grease. The texture is a little hard, so sometimes if I get a thick chip it hurts my teeth. But the taste is worth it!  The irregularity of the size and shape of the chips tells you that they're real, not something created in a lab.
