Plus through Amazon I save almost 50% off the grocery store price!I just wish Amazon carried the baked salt and vinegar flavor. It exists, but is not easy to find. I manage to snag some every few months or so but at almost $4 a bag I can't really stock up the way I could if they were available through Amazon.

the prunes were moist and soft and delicious.  and, especially important, organic.  will buy these again.  you can rely of newman organics for quality.  and all profits on all newman's own products go to charity
I tried making scones with this gluten free mix and the results were good.  The scone turned out tender and tasty and I found it easy to make.  I will buy this again!

Update January 30, 2014: I discovered why Japanese seaweed salad tastes so good.  It mixes seaweed, whether dried or fresh, with rice vinegar, sesame oil, soy sauce, just a little salt and sugar, a little ginger juice, sesame seeds and finely chopped scallions.  No corn oil.End of update....This product has way too much corn oil.When roasted seaweed products first got marketed in U.S. major stores, they contained sesame oil and later started mixing in canola oil and recently a lot of corn oil.  They use so much that the thin squares are very greasy - way greasier than usual for seaweed snacks.Corn oil doesn't work as well with the natural seaweed taste.  The best seaweed snacks use only olive oil but they're expensive.  The next best use only sesame oil.  Then comes sesame mixed with canola, then sesame mixed with corn oil.I notice when I eat some, I am disappointed with the taste compared to other seaweed snacks but my hands actually get very oily.  Everything I touch gets oily.  Also, this type of oil isn't agreeable with my stomach.Update January 10, 2014:Whenever I had guests, I'd open one of these packages and have them try.  Nobody would try more than one or two.  I could not give away unopened packages.  I threw out the remaining packages yet I continue to buy several other Kirkland brand items when I'm at Costco.
summary: Greasy - way too much corn oil

reviewText: You are VERY lucky if you find a gum that doesn't have its flavor vanish before you've gotten in a bunch of chews.  Orbit cinnamon has a lot of flavor and you can actually sit down while chewing.  With other gums, you don't even reach your chair before you run out of flavor and have to get up to toss it away.  Best of all, it's sugar free -- that's zero calories. Can't get better than that.
summary: sugar free and long term delicious

reviewText: I love using Italian dressing for a marinade for chicken breasts as it adds zesty flavor and permeates the meat well. I also love adding it to my pot roast in the crockpot along with a packet of brown gravy mix and a cup of water. Let it simmer on low all day while you're at work and come home and add sides and dinner is served.  I tried this as a dressing on salad per the directions and I loved the freshness as opposed to bottled shelf dressing. I will be using this more often as a pantry item since it is so versatile.
summary: One of my favorite go to seasoning packets for marinades

reviewText: Another great concept, but unfortunately not real good tasting.No sugar, but other than that not much to offer.Good idea, but not much substance to taste or even convenience.But a valiant try!

I use this product just as instructed and it develops a great, robust tea. I always add some turbinado sugar and milk to my teas and this one is not exception. The tea brick makes it easy to measure out just the correct amount - no guessing here.
I prefer raisins over prunes, but these are the best raisins on the market.  Again, I cannot find them locally so I really enjoy ordering off of Amazon.

I never was a big fan of walnuts, because sometimes they can taste bitter. Well, these ones are very good. I don't think I found any bitter ones yet. Very impressed with the quality and I think the price is very good. I use them in smoothies or sometimes as a snack, dipped in honey (definitely a must try).

I just found out that today is National Peanut Butter Day, and started it off with some toast with my PB Crave Peanut Butter. It's a great flavor pairing of peanut butter, chocolate, and raspberry. I knocked off a star because it's a bit hard to spread and the raspberry flavor leaves a bit of an aftertaste.  The label says natural raspberry flavor, and I expected raspberry preserves or raspberry chunks as opposed to "flavor." Also, I'm not a fan of white chocolate and would like this product better if the white chocolate drops were peanut chunks.  I liked it, but it would be fabulous if tweaked a bit.

Our little one LOVES his yummy, organic fruit yogurt smoothies. One of the best additions to our routine!This is a perfectly healthy, portable and vitamin packed snack for toddlers. Generous portion, sized well for kiddo hands, and an easy snack that is ideal on-the-go or when you want to encourage independent eating.Each pouch contains a blend of organic fruit and yogurt-- which means vitamins, protein, and calcium. Fantastic snack!
Use this all of the time! Economical and great flavor. It lasts for a long time! Use it on my pork tenderloin and pot roasts. Delish!

Yes the consistency is very thick but it loosens up after being in a kitchen cupboard.  The taste is very flavorful and varied with chocolate chunks, white chocolate chunks and raspberry all mixed into the peanut butter.  I love raspberries and do not find the flavor or taste at all objectionable as another reviewer commented.I would use this on crackers or to top a cookie I might even put it into the wonton wrappers, while making crab rangoon for the Superbowl party, for something sweet.

Starbucks Natural Fusions ground coffee contains the right balance of (added) vanilla flavor and bold coffee. Normally, flavored (let alone pre-ground) coffees aren't very high quality; however, this Starbucks blend is very good. It's not stale or poorly roasted, nor does it have any kind of artificial smell or taste. There's no strange after-taste, either. It brews well, and I'll likely purchase it again. The vanilla "flavor infusion" doesn't overpower; the aroma is absolutely amazing - not flat, with the right amount of depth and complexity.I prepared this coffee drip-style (not in a machine), and found it required a bit more than usual to make the strength I prefer. Additionally, though I prefer black coffee, this coffee responds well to a bit of sugar (it heightens the vanilla flavor) and cream.
summary: The right balance of vanilla and coffee

reviewText: We have this recipe we make at Christmas for fudgy tasting chocolate cookies. Wow were they good this year?! Couldn't keep them in the house…
Use in making gluten free cookies and muffins with other flours and adds a nice texture and flavor, as well as the additional nutrients added.
summary: All Red Mill products seem to be very good.

reviewerName: Clyde O. Stephens ""Old Fart Ex Tex""
reviewText: This is nothing like the "Powdered Milk" we had when I was a kid during WWII.  I bought this stuff so I could make some milk for cookin' when I run out of the bottled and there is no one to get it for me. It is a surprisingly good substitute once I remembered to add extra water to make it more like the 2% I usually use.  It is really quite good.
summary: Nestle Carnation Instant Nonfat Dry Milk, 25.6-Ounce

reviewText: I like bolder coffees, and usually like Columbian blends.  This coffee, however, was on the bitter, rather than bold side.  It was a little less expensive than most K-cups, so maybe I'm expecting too much.  I will not be ordering this brand, in the future.

After careful consideration and reading all the helpful reviews that made my mouth water, I tried this product.  I was not disappointed in the least.  It makes the perfect comfort food.  In fact, I had a rather stressful day and made some and it made me feel quite good.  I am not sure what is in the packet of sauce mix, but it is wonderful when combined with tomato paste and water.  It makes your taste buds sing!If you are on the fence about this one, try it! You will love it.  My gratitude goes out to everyone of you that have done a review!!! Oh and to Amazon too!

I just discovered this candy at Walmart and only bought one bag to see how I liked it. I wish I'd bought more!  I love almost any combination of fruit and chocolate and these sweet-but-tart little morsels are a superb example of how delicious that blend can be.  Walmart's price is currently the best by a large margin, so off I go to stock up on my latest confectionary addiction!
This popcorn arrived fresh tasting.  There are about 14 cups of popped corn in a bag.  I like it because it is low sodium and also it is not covered with greasy popcorn oil.
summary: I like it because it is low sodium and also it ...

reviewText: I don't think I've ever been as flummoxed by a snack item as I have been with these.  The crackers are indeed wonderfully savory and packed with rich flavor, but eating them... well, it's like eating dried biscuits.  They are a little too hard, far beyond just crisp, with a cardboard-like texture.  So despite excellent taste, these may not be the first thing I would reach for when snack time comes around.
summary: Taste is indeed tasty, but the texture is near cardboard

reviewText: Just the 'meat' of the artichoke.  Sliced, chopped or left whole, these bottoms are the most economical way to get your money's worth.  If we are going canned, it is the only one we use.

I highly recommend this product as it contains two super foods. It is so tasty, just as described in devious reviews. I am always satisfied with this brand and have previously purchased their goji berries and cacao separately. This is a very healthy alternative snack.

wheni tried it in the sample box it was my fav. Itold everyone how good it was. wheni bought  the box it didnt taste the same.the sample u could smell and tast the maple. in mine there was harly any fla. a t all.
summary: i gave most of it away

reviewText: I keep trying to like this. I think I will have to try it in soup. I don't detect a weird flavor or smell like some people are claiming, and I don't wash it painstakingly either. If I had to change anything, these noodles would not be as slippery. I have almost choked when they tried to slide down my throat before I was done chewing. I like the idea of using them in a soup and as soon as I get around to making my coconut Thai soup, I will give them another try. Probably will add a thickener to the soup to give the noddles a little traction...

I have noticed that All K-cups come off as a bit strong for my taste. But I have been looking at these since LOOOONg before I got My Coffee Machine. They always interested me. They are good with some cream and sugar I was not dissapointed like with some other K-cup sets I have bought.

This review is for the Take It Sleazy light roast.  I didn't get this because I was expecting gourmet coffee, and neither should you.  Personally I love coffee & this isn't half bad.  In fact, it's pretty good in a normal way - nothing strange or out of the ordinary.  This flavor is a very mild coffee.  For a late afternoon when the caffeine is hitting you too hard, try this.  Or for those quasi-coffee fans, this is not overwhelming so you can hide the flavor with sugar & cream easily enough.  Honesty my friends, honesty.  Now that being said, why get it?  Because nothing better sets the mood for office shenanigans, inside jokes & overall cool perception than Workaholics.  If you're a fan, then you know.  It's like if Office Space was a TV show, but also more edgy & crude.  I personally love working in an office, but yet most people around me don't really get the humor of something like Workaholics.  I bring these pods to work, sets the tone for the whole day.  And if you're lucky enough to work with other fans - then prepare the quote-fest this will inspire around the ol' cubicle.  Personally I prefer the medium roast - Let's Get Weird.  It's strong enough to keep me awake at work in the mornings.  My next order to Amazon, The Sampler.  Why?  Because hey... you gotta be fresh!
summary: Not for Coffee Snobs, For Office Swag

reviewText: I bought a box of these on impulse at my local grocery store, and they sat in the pantry until the day came that I needed a side dish that wouldn't take much time to prepare.  My family loved them!  I'm sure they are not as good as the real thing (having never actually mashed sweet potatoes) but for a quick side we found them to be yummy and nicely seasoned.

If berry-flavored Mountain Dew sounds appealing to you, then this is your drink. Personally, I'm disgusted by this flavor and hope to return it soon; the texture is revoltingly thick and syrupy and the flavor is more grape juice than anything, though some faint berry taste does get through. It's also no healthier than regular soda pop: Although they can claim "no sugar added", the claim of "full serving and fruit and vegetables" is extremely misleading because a serving of either typically consists of a large amount of fiber and a small amount of protein, and in this drink everything but the sugar has been removed has been removed. Real stuff also has higher vitamin and mineral content. I'd consider that false advertising, since having this will only make you crave more, not feel full. I should have checked into the nutritional information before ordering. Strangely, I think it would actually be a better drink if it was diluted by half with water. TheStrawberry Bananaflavor is much more palatable, though still somewhat overly sweet - oddly, it's less syrupy than this flavor despite having more sugar.Since it's difficult to find the nutrition info online:Calories: 100Total Fat: 0 gCholesterol: 0 mgSodium: 60 mgPotassium: 280 mgTotal Carbs: 25 g-Fiber: 0 g-Sugars: 23 gProtein: 0 gVitamin A: 15%Vitamin C: 100%Negligible amounts of other vitamins and minerals.
This is a tasty product, but a bit too pricey for regular purchase.  Container size could be larger and price more affordable..

Anyone who takes the time to read this entire review will find it helpful. Those who have not read it will vote it down. Yes, reading is required to know why I recommend these, as well as things to watch out for.The reason I purchased chia seeds is because I wanted to start eating all natural foods that are thought to help fight or prevent cancer, and chia seeds were in a list of foods I got from several websites (also flax seed, but men should not eat flax because it can enlarge the prostate). So, I chose chia seeds because I wanted a food supplement that my husband could also eat.FAST/FREE SHIPPING & LOW PRICE, BUT:I ordered them on the 22nd and they arrived on Saturday the 26th - sold and fulfilled by Amazon via the subscribe and save offer ($19.95 with FREE shipping and a discount applied for subscribe and save came to about $16 and change for the bag, can't beat that). Keep in mind you can adjust or end subscribe and save items very easily so I highly recommend it with any item you order that offers subscribe and save. BUT if the price gets above $23 I'll look for it elsewhere. Getting tired of finding a good item at a fair price just to have the price hike up when I'm ready to reorder or after I or someone else gives it a good review. Greedy sellers, beware. We consumers are on to you and will not tolerate your greed much longer!!GOOD PACKAGING, BUT:When food is involved I get very picky about packaging. My first requirement is that it is in a container that prevents contamination. It came in a box with a bag that was shrink wrapped against a piece of cardboard so it would not shift around in route. The bag of seeds is clearly vacuum sealed very tight. My only complaint is that it is in a plastic bag (I believe all plastics are toxic) but you must consider the only way to ship this stuff air tight would be in plastic or glass, and you know it won't be shipped in glass. So I did not take away any stars for the plastic. I transferred the entire bag to an air tight glass jar with a metal screw on top then I keep a small shaker top bottle (spice jar) filled with it for easy use.Note: it's important to keep in mind that when you break the air seal of an item like this (any vacuum sealed package) you're basically starting the degradation countdown. Meaning, it's stated that they can last longer than 2 years and they most likely mean if you do not break the air-tight seal. I have chosen to break the seal so I can get rid of the plastic, and in doing this know they will only last the stated 2 years or less. But I expect to have eaten them all within about a year. I mention this for those of you who might also not want to keep the seeds in plastic.CLEARLY LABELED - INCLUDING PACKED ON & BEST BY DATES:Another thing that's important to me when buying food (especially by mail) is clear labeling with all the info I need about the item. There is a nutrient values label with the company address, website, and toll free phone number, stated USDA Organic, and storage instructions. There is also a packed on date, best by date label. The nutrition label also stated can keep for 2 or MORE years, which is helpful to note just in case the dated label was removed. Here's the nutrition facts as per the label with my comments in parenthesis:> Serving Size - 1 tbsp = 12g, 113 per container (that's about .15 cents per 1 tbsp serving, not bad)> Calories - 60 (that all natural organic raw high fiber calories, those are the good calories you want)> Calories from Fat - 25 (as per above)> Total Fat - 3g> Saturated Fat - 0g (perfect)> Trans Fat - 0g (perfect)> Cholesterol - 0g (perfect again)> Sodium - 0g (excellent)> Potassium 60mg (equal to a couple bites of a banana, not bad)> Carbs - 5g (good carbs, with fiber)> Sugars - 0g> Protein - 3g> Calcium - 8% RDA> Iron - 6% RDA> Magnesium - 10% RDAAgain, the reason I'm eating chia seeds is because numerous reputable websites stated they are believed to help prevent and fight cancer. Of course there is no proof of that, but if it has other great properties, is cheap, healthy and doesn't taste bad then why not?MORE THAN I PAID FOR:The bag is supposed to be 3 pounds. I always weight pre-packaged items that are sold by the pound to make sure I'm not getting ripped off. The bag weighed nearly 3.5 pounds (3.436 lbs to be exact). That's nearly 15% extra for free (nearly $2.40 worth of seeds for free). Considering the price was the lowest I've found anywhere (locally or on the internet) I call that a great plus.USES:I really can't taste them. I've put a small pinch in my mouth to taste on their own and detect a light nutty flavor, but they are so small it's hard to taste anything. But I didn't buy them to eat straight. I bought them knowing I'd add them to other foods, like an herb or seasoning. They actually look like coarse fresh ground pepper when sprinkled on food. These are the foods I've used them with (see below), and I can tell you they did not change the flavor of any food unless I added huge amounts. Remember, 1 tbsp is one serving. So, for example if you mix it in a burger or a couple scrambled eggs, all you need is 1 tbsp and that's not enough to change the taste.MIX SEEDS INTO:meat loaf, meat balls, hamburger, tofu mixes, bread dough, cookie dough, muffins or cupcakes, pancake or waffle batter, scrambled eggs, omelets, poultry/mushroom/clam stuffing, mashed potatoes, salad dressing, any kind of dip, soups, sauces, ketchup, mustard, mayo, juices, slushies, ice-cream, home made sherbert, and just about anything that can be "mixed" or stirred.orSPRINKLE SEEDS ONTO:salads, vegetables, cereals, ice-cream, dessert icing, fruit cups, or sprinkle on just about any food.I've tried these seeds in all of the above ways over the last 5 months and I either didn't taste them or the flavor was a little nutty, enhancing what I was eating. So, as long as the price is right I will continue to buy and eat these chia seeds, with just about every meal or food item.Happy life and good health to you all!
summary: Versatile, Raw, Organic, Fiber, Protien, Healthy. What's not to like?!

reviewText: This stuff is potent!  Seriously, I could dot my tongue on the surface and taste a mouthful.  This caramel dip is so sweet, it's like saccharine.  It's so saccharine, a diabetic would pass on it.  And it really doesn't taste too much like caramel.  I mean, vaguely, it does, but that's if you haven't had caramel in A REALLY long time.  As with most WF products, don't look to this as a replacement; look at it as an alternative.  I have a feeling this jar will be in my fridge a looong time, which could be good or bad.

I grew up eating pancakes with real maple syrup, and the fake HFCS-based syrup just doesn't compare. Maple syrup is just wonderful with breakfast or as a sweetener in cooking. I had never had grade B maple syrup but recently decided to try it because it's a few dollars cheaper. Turns out I love it just as much if not more than the grade A syrup I was used to. It's not graded by quality like some foods, but rather by the color. Grade B is darker and has a stronger flavor. If you like one you'll like the other, and you'll like this Anderson's maple syrup. With Amazon's subscribe and save it's a much better deal than buying at my grocery store.
These truffles are typical of all Lindt Lindor truffles.  They are melt in your mouth delicious and just a treat to taste,.
summary: Lindt Lindor Stracciatella White Chocolate Truffles

reviewText: Nice peach tea taste made with Sucralose (which I like, Aspartame and Nutra Sweet products give me headaches).  This is not a powder mix, so the concentrated liquid mixes with water very easily (you almost don't have to even mix it).  Great taste for a diet product, and you can mix in the exact amount of your liquid to suit your own taste.  I like that you can even slip a little into your glass of water without making an entire pitcher of the stuff (not like most packet-based products that force you to make a quart of the stuff). A nice product if you like peach tea.

I am not really much of tea drinker, but I try them from time to time.  This tea I found to be quite unusual in its flavor, with ginger most prominent.  I've been trying to eat more ginger (and other super spices), and I love the flavor of ginger, so I have to say that I did enjoy this tea.  Love instant tea mixes like this too.  If I drink this again (just got one packet), I would add a squeeze of fresh lemon to it.
summary: Unusual flavor, but I liked it.

reviewText: I prefer this hemp powder over the Living Harvest brand.  The Navitas hemp protein powder is a much finer grind, almost a powder, which makes it much easier to blend into drinks and smoothies.  I also appreciate that it has a higher protein content: 50% rather than the 43% the Living Harvest brand boasts.  It costs a little extra, but I think it's a much better product.

They're strong alright.  A bit too much for me.  The flavor was a little overpowering for me and they were seriously hard to bite into.  I can't imagine what someone with dentures would do with these.  I brought the bag to work and offered a taste to co-workers.  5 people stopped after one cracker.  Some said it needed dip to soften it a bit.  I would not buy these.

It's good and it's real. Maple syrup. You gotta have it for Pamela's. Use sparingly, but often. We put into small squeeze bottle and try to make it last because of the cost, but honestly... when it's real maple, you use less... maybe not at first because you're used to eating the fake stuff and it takes a lot of that to satisfy, but use real butter and real maple syrup and soon you'll find you don't have to use but just a bit to be happy! Highly recommend.

Truth be told, I'm exceptionally hard to please with water flavor enhancers.  I typically think they taste way too "chemically" and often fail to taste like they intend.The MIO Liquid Peach Tea is not an exception.  The peach taste is absolutely all you get, and its assaulting.  It is not a "day at the beach, little umbrella in your glass with some ice" memory flashback.  Using the recommended dose, It is an over-powering sickly sweet peach flavor that is not very reminiscent of warm summer days, or tea in any capacity.After you get over your initial shock of the extreme sweetness, you may then note the acidic aftertaste of the chemicals used to acquire the peach'y goodness.  Although I recognize I may be overly critical and many may not be as judgmental as I am, for my personal palette - this tea is just too harsh.I was under the impression this would be a water flavor enhancer, not a water flavor obliterator.On second thoughts however, with something this strong - I believe it will do well in places where you are desperately trying to mask the flavor of impure water. Overseas the water in Iraq and Afghanistan is reportedly considered notoriously bad so I think MIO Liquid Peach Tea would be loved with open arms.

This stuff is great!  One review said that it tasted bad on everything but I mix it with a small amount of yogurt and it actually tastes pretty good.  Goes great with blueberry in my opinion  =)  Will definitely be back for more.
It's okay, fast cooking, but there are others I prefer.  That said, eating my way through 11 pounds will take awhile.
I love Almonds and then when you add chocolate they are fantastic to eat and to serve when you have guests in.

reviewerName: My 2 Cents "and a penny for your thoughts"
reviewText: These cookies are terrific. Fresh and moist. Not hard like many store bought cookies. They are almost like moist little cakes. The individual packaging makes them a cinch to pack in a hurry and solves the problem of trying to keep the rest fresh.

I received the package early but they stuffed vanilla and chocolate cookies I didn't want in the middle. something like you would see at a convenient store. a roll of 8 cookies in a pack. It is NOT advertised here.
Never having tasted this condiment previously I was made curious by a food blog I had read online. So I got some. Now I know.NT

The name of this fruit mix is curious: "Go Figure"? Is there a weight loss message there? If so, you've picked the wrong snack. These are very, very sugary fruits, and drying them makes for something as carb-dense as a dessert tray.But let's talk taste. Figs are very tasty and rare. Here, you get 2-3 of them per bag, dried but still pleasantly moist. I found myself wishing that I could get a bag with just the figs. Dates are almost pure sugar, which makes them overwhelm everything else in a mix. And I've never found dried apricots very pleasant, and these are no exception. They're likely included because they're cheap.I can't recommend this fruit assortment at this price point. You could load up onNavitas Naturals Goji Berriesat about the same price, ounce for ounce, and those are a much more satisfying/nutritious snack.
I was interested in changing from artifical sweeteners and decided to try honey. It works well and I will order again.
summary: used as a sweetener in coffee

reviewText: I've certainly enjoyed Werther's hard candies in the past, so was eager to try these soft chocolates. I'm happy to say that they pass the sweet tooth test with flying colors! The blending of the caramel and chocolate is smooth, the texture is perfect, and the individually wrapped pieces are large enough to make just one a nice sized treat. They're attractively wrapped in gold foil, and when we served them to guests as an after dinner treat, my niece declared it to be "perfection!"  Now I just need to find out if Werther's is making any dark chocolates!

PB CRAVE is unlike any other peanut butter you will ever eat--it "packs a POW". A high-quality product featuring and blend of creativity and charitable good sense, it's also a lot of fun! This is a thick, chunky, intense peanut butter--not the ultra-creamy, whipped peanut butter you are used to consuming. There's a whole lot of flavor action going on with this product--which makes it perfect to eat by the spoonful or to use in recipes. I eat peanut butter by the spoonful just about every day--hey, it's my own jar--and one big spoonful of PB CRAVE really hits the spot. I also tried it on graham crackers and made some awesome no-bake "school house cookies"--the kind with oatmeal. PB CRAVE would also make a terrific dessert sauce for ice cream or cake, and it would be fabulous on pancakes, waffles, and french toast. I would recommend carefully warming some PB CRAVE in the microwave and then blending in some room-temperature milk, chocolate syrup, honey, maple syrup or corn syrup to make your sauce. As always, when serving food prepared with peanuts or peanut butter, make sure to advise everyone in case someone has a peanut allergy. The flavor that I tried was "Razzle Dazzle"--peanut butter with Wild Honey, Dark Chocolate, White Coco Butter Drops, and Natural Raspberry Flavor. As I said before, it's intense! The other flavors are "CoCo Bananas", "Choco Choco", and "Cookie Nookie". PB CRAVE does come in variety packs, and I would love to try all the flavors! According to the company, PB Crave is a natural, premium peanut butter made with US Grown Peanuts. Now, here's where the charitable good sense comes into play, according to the PB CRAVE website, "A minimum of 2% of the profits from every jar of PB Crave peanut butter goes directly to "Project Peanut Butter", a non-profit organization focused on treating malnourished children". If you're a "spooner", like me, being aware of the good works behind the good food makes every bite a little bit better.
summary: high-quality product features creative flavors and charitable good sense

reviewText: Even though this cracker is thick with taste...mine is garlicky and parmesan, the cracker itself is too thick in my opinion.I don't have the best teeth in the world and in fact have had lots of work done over my lifetime. This cracker is too thick for me to bite comfortably.  Having said that I made the most of the thickness and crunched them up into small pieces to put on my salad.As far as I'm concerned even though the crisps have the suggestion that they are good for you with some of the nutrition facts being on the front they are in fact pretty fattening.  The portion size is a mere 9 crackers with 5 grams of protein, 3 grams of fiber, no sugar and 12 grams of whole grain. What isn't on the front is that within those 9 crackers are 110 calories, and 200 mg of sodium and 16 grams of carbs.I follow the weight watchers diet as a lifetime member being on maintenance and these 9 crackers are 3 points.  That won't mean anything to most people but to me I could have alot of real food instead of those 9 crackers.All in all, if you don't worry about your teeth or your weight as much as I do, these crackers are really good.
Arrived a day early, they taste great & they are very fresh. Will buy again because my family loves them too.

I am used to KAL stevia, and having read some of the other reviews, perhaps the one I received was from a bad batch. But - I have had to use AT LEAST 4-5 times as much compared to KAL to sweeten most items, and for some items (i.e. my high protein breakfast drink) it just disappears. Never has quite the same "sweet" effect of the KAL either.

I have tried numerous ways of achieving that perfect coffee in the morning. After many different purchases and many different methods, I think i have finally found the best-tasting and most cost-efficient way to have a nice cup to start the day.Kudos to Community Coffee Co., a family-owned business out of NOLA (New Orleans)!First, this is a whole bean offering, nice roasted without that black, burnt look and taste (like that big chain who charges an arm and a leg for a single cup of coffee - sheesh!)Next, using whole beans and an inexpensive grinder, i can choose the amount and grind size perfect for my brewing method (i use several, but in the morning, it's a hot drip through unbleached paper of a tad-finer-than-normal grind)Finally, i can choose the amount of water vs coffee to achieve that perfect ratio for perfect taste for my palate - YMMV (your mileage may vary). I find the bean to offer a smooth and creamy taste; low-acid, with a nice finish on the tongue.This not only saves time, but also money, as I'm getting a gourmet taste, gourmet blend, and gourmet service for my morning brew!Thanks, folks! This bean is a winner for me!

I ordered these to try out hemp seed, as I heard they were a great source of protein and fat from a plant source. They were delicious, and the packaging was all in tact and in good shape when they arrived. I decided to order the larger size from the same company the second time I ordered from them.
I was really happy with this trail mix, The quality was Great, will buy more, I had never heard of this brand .

reviewerName: Mrs. K "From the wilds of the Mojave"
reviewText: My never-had-to-diet-in-his-life husband said these tasted pretty good. I have to agree. The chocolate chunk was pretty tasty.The best part is that they are not super sweet. They contain soy protein nuggets, a much tastier way to get your protein from a bar than the silly putty consistency bars on the market.Only 6 grams of sugar means it doesn't make me sick AND they contain 24% of the fiber you need in a day.
summary: Husband says it doesn't taste like diet food

reviewText: I had fun making this. It was a little tedious to make each piece of sushi though. But I like to put a little work in to get a reward. Flavor wise, I was not a big fan. You know it's candy but it just tasted odd. Not very sweet. I also had a packet of powder left over. I checked the directions and didn't see it anywhere listed. But that may be due to my mistake (I don't know Japanese).
summary: Fun to make, odd to eat

reviewText: DO YOU WANT A PRODUCT YOU WILL LOVE AND LOVE TO EAT THEN BUY THIS IT IS THE BEST I EVER HAD AND BETTER THEN GOING OUT TO BUY

In a perfect world pop corn would be the size of small clouds, fluffy and filled with authentic white cheddar taste. Each kernel would be perfectly coated and it would taste exactly as it is announced to be.  For a confessed cheese pop corn addict, I have done all I could to find the perfect product. I have purchased everywhere I see a tempting bag. Regretfully, it is rare and hard to come by, when you find a superior Cheddar flavor. That does not mean I stop trying, but pretty soon I know that some bags just don't cut it.  The competition is not as fierce, as let's say, potato chips or tortillas, where you walk down the aisle and several manufacturers are competing for the hard earned dollar.Loyalty has its rewards. Some products are much better than others, and after a while the choices become much more simpler when one knows which is which that taste the best. As tedious as it is to restore the teeth back to normal after eating pop corn, it's just the one bag that calls my attention the loudest.Enter Orville Redenbacher Ready to Eat Popcorn, Sharp White Cheddar, 1.5-Ounce Each. When amazon was nice enough to send me one solitary bag, for a moment there, I was under the impression that I would have to pop it in the microwave. Soon enough I realized that this product, new to me, came from the big honcho pop corn maker. Never before knew they sell the pop corn already popped. I immediately open the bag and in no time it was gone. This is my take: the pop corn was, indeed, large, but at the bottom of the bag there was the customary little bits and pieces, which I basically do not like for now they are like tiny crumbs. The flavor of the pop corn was tasty, but lacking perhaps the sharpness I expected from the bag's description. Decent, but not spectacular. The amount in each bag is enough to get one's fix, as opposed to the larger bags, which I have a lot trouble sharing them and keeping some for next day. Basically they get consumed while watching a show on TV. I guess what I am saying is this: they are so easy to eat!I thought this product was a little better than average, it would definitely be a contender if I saw it in its large version in the aisle of snacks. I have had more cheesy than this one, but one can tell right away that Orville knows how to do pop corn. Brush, floss, whatever it takes to remove up to the last particle once done.  In the meantime they can be enjoyed very easily, to the tune of 4 Stars.

There is nothing sissy about this Ginger lemon drink.  The taste and aroma are incredible but it's also soooo smoothe going down you'll want Rob Thomas and Santana doing the sound track of your afternoon break.  The powder pack mixes instantly without clumps in hot water.  I understand that each serving has less than 75 calories which is reasonable.  I added a little soy-milk because of habit but also liked it without.  This is a good drink without caffine to use before bed to wind down a little.  I'm going to buy it for a pantry stock item.

First, I was expecting hard candy, so it was a nice surprise that these are soft chocolates. They are about the size of those chocolate coins (the kind wrapped in gold foil), but these are more of an oval shape. The milk chocolate is swirled with caramel. The taste is creamy and smooth, but more of a caramel taste than chocolate I thought.The bag says 6 pieces per serving, which I thought was a little much. For my taste, 2 pieces is a perfect treat. Don't think I could eat 6 of them in one shot - too sweet. The 5.2oz bag contains around 4 servings total (around 24 pieces).  Candies are 230 calories per serving with 16g of fat, 2g fiber.Not sure what else there is to say about these. I liked them and would buy again. Not as indulgent a treat as Godiva or Dove chocolates, but these are of good quality I would expect when I think of the Werther's name.

folks -- read The Coconut Oil Miracle, by Bruce Fife; you'll see that there are tons of reasons to USE organic coconut oil, and Nutiva is excellent, although not inexpensive.  I use the autoship option, and the price and quality of this product cannot be beat ANYWHERE.  Once again, BLESS you Amazon!

I grew up eatingWerthers Originalshard candies, so when I saw that there were Caramel Chocolates available, I decided to give them a shot.  My initial impression of the caramel chocolates was that they were a little waxy and lacking depth of flavor.  Before I defend that statement, let me provide some background information.  In today's market, there are a lot of super-premium chocolate products available, many of which have a high cacao percentage or are sourced from premium organic cacao pods.  Once you start eating these high-end (milk) chocolates with the higher cacao content, many of the mass produced milk chocolate products start to pale in comparison.  Do some research and you will find that many lower end milk chocolate products are made with vegetable oil or other shortcuts to cut costs.  I am not saying that the Werther's products are low-end, but to me they lack that "true" chocolate depth...and it is probably because I am used to these higher cacao content bars now.  Also, the caramel flavor is also not as pronounced as I would have expected.As a good comparison test, go out and buy aGreen & Black's Organic Milk Chocolate Caramel Barand compare/contrast.Bottom line - these are not that bad, but there are better alternatives out there.  The best way to eat these is to let them slowly melt in your mouth versus just chomping one down.
summary: Not bad but not my favorite

reviewText: I really enjoyed the smoothness and richness of this coffee.  My husband complained of a slight bitterness, but my palate couldn't detect those notes,  Overall, a decent coffee, but we won't be switching to this brand.
summary: I enjoyed this smooth, rich coffee

reviewText: Chocolate lovers delight! This is probably my favorite pop tart flavor. It is best toasted because it will be all warm and toasty. Eat with milk! It reminds me of a chocolate candy bar. Or better yet smores!

You never really know what to expect with instant beverages so I suppose it's best to keep an open mind. The Gold Kili Instant Ginger & Lemon was pretty tasty, but given that it was a bit weak on the ginger has made me doubt whether or not I'd actually purchase the product.It's a incredibly sweet beverage. You can definitely taste the lemon. Given the fact that ginger is listed first, I think it's fishy that the beverage tastes more like lemon than ginger. But I suppose that's to be expected.If you like instant beverages then give the Gold Kili mix a try. It's a lot different than most instant beverages I've tried so you might welcome the change. As an instant beverage, it was good but I don't know how eager I am to shell out money for the product.

I got these to try something new, but I guess I am just not into flavored coffees and the sweetness of the cinnamon roll flavor makes it harder for me to enjoy this coffee.  I would drink it again in a pinch, but I would take any number of other coffees first.
Oh my! This bread and cheese = excellent grilled cheese sandwich! Or toasted and and cut into croutons. Or anything you can think of to do with bread. I keep ordering it so I don't run out.Get some.

reviewerName: christinemm  from The Thinking Mother blog
reviewText: Nutritionally a great thing about this product is it is made from beef from grass-fed cattle.Our family loves beef jerky and we have tried a wide variety. This one is quite mild flavored. It is not super smoky. It is not spicy. It does not have a heavy black pepper taste. It is nicely seasoned and mild.Unlike other brands, this jerky is cut up into bite sized pieces. The fuss of trying to bite off a portion of the beef from a large piece is NOT an issue with this jerky. It is convenient to have the jerky precut into small pieces.If you like a mildly flavored beef jerky this is for you. If you want a grass-fed beef jerky product, this fits the bill.
summary: Bite Sized, Mild Flavored, Grass Fed Beef

reviewText: Creamy and delicious chocolate will take care of any craving you have and quite possible put you in a coma.
We have been using this cornmeal for several months and it is great.  It makes delicious cornbread.  It is a comfort to know that it is not genetically modified.
This is a light to medium roast coffee with nice cinnamon flavor. If you like your coffee a bit bolder, just brew on a smaller size.

Tried these, which cost less than Bob's Red Mill, however, I prefer the better product, Bob's,  which is from Oregon, USA. I also dislike the idea that I  contributed to the excess fuel consumption, transporting them across the Pacific Ocean, which is the scenario if purchased again from Bergins. I'll recommend Bob's Red Mill.

I only drink organic coffee at home. That's why I was excited to read the reviews on this product. All I can say is I'm really glad I also bought Starbucks Via. This stuff is awful! It doesn't even taste like coffee. I'm somewhat flexible. I'm not really that picky. I can drink just about any coffee in an "emergency." I could not drink this stuff. I don't really know how to describe this product. When I tried the Starbucks I was very impressed, however. To me it tasted like what you'd get at an actual Starbucks.Take my word for it, go with Starbucks. It's not organic, but at least you can drink it.
summary: Not drikable, even in the African jungle.

reviewText: Red Rain, was just OK, I really did not feel any difference. The taste was not very good. There are other energy drinks out there that taste better and work.
Very delish, but a little better made with milk instead of water.  Of course, I feel that way about pretty much all hot chocolate/mocha mixes.
The blueberries were okay, at best. The package is very small. I was expecting more for the price I paid. Unfortunately, the product did not deliver.

Good really Good.Bottle size nice just enough liqueur and the dark chocolateadded the correct touch.  My company enjoyed themand felt it their duty not to leave me any "empty" bottles.Next time will have to hide some!

When my husband and I both tried this looking at each with a confused look.  We immediately said the same thing at the same time, how can they get so little taste in there, but still be there?!?!  I'm a die hard diet soda drinker, which has not helped his regular soda drinking habit.  We are both looking for water to help us work to soda free, plain water life, we decided this was not the route for us.

The Numi Garden Pack consists of six varieties: Beet-Cabbage, Carrot-Curry, Spinach-Chive, Broccoli-Cilantro, Tomato-Mint, and Fennel-Spice.  Each of these pairs is combined with either green or black decaf tea.The resulting combinations are not what I expected. For example, the Tomato-Mint in black tea is really spicy, something like theNumi Cardamom Pu'erh Tea, which is a spicy black tea. However, the Cardamom tea does have caffeine, which gives it a lift. Another, the Broccoli-Cilantro in green tea, is more like vegetable soup made from bouillon cubes than like tea.  In none of them is the tea flavor at all pronounced.  I do prefer to keep my tea separate from my soup, although, I do find these samples interesting.

reviewerName: Penny Pinching Polly "Check out my website fo...
reviewText: My daughter and I love cereal and we like to have a variety to choose from.  With Kellogg's Favorite Assortment, we can choose a different cereal every day without worrying about an entire box going stale since they are individually packaged.I take these along on trips to the zoo, to the park, camping, or anywhere we may want a meal or snack.  It's easy to buy a milk and have a quick meal, or eat it dry as an easy snack.  You can leave a couple in your glove compartment, diaper bag, or your desk at work, without worrying about them going bad.

Lindt Chocolate Lindor Truffles are delicious chocolate that makes you want to eat the whole bag after you eat just one!  Delicious Dark Chocolate that is a pure delight to enjoy.  The center of the chocolate truffle is creamy and delicious chocolate smoothness.  It is a hard task to put all the descriptive words that are experienced when you eat this great chocolate!  One of the best affordable chocolate candies that are out on the market today.  A wonderful Dark Chocolate that is highly recommended to all chocolate lovers!!  Enjoy!

ORVILLE REDENBACHER READY TO EAT POPCORN - SHARP WHITE CHEDDARBeing a popcorn fan I was interested to see how the new ready to eat popcorn by Orville would be.  Popcorn people, he has done it yet again!Coming in a 1.5 ounce bag that is bright red and quick to draw your attention, this popcorn rocks.  The white cheddar taste is abundant, yet not over-whelming.  The taste is smooth and mild.  The popcorn is crunchy, the kernels large, and very tasty.  There is no residue on your hand while eating as I've experienced with other brands of flavored popcorn.The nutrition facts for a 1.5 ounce bag are as follow:Calories -- 240Calories from Fat -- 140Total Fat -- 16gSaturated Fat -- 2gTrans Fat - 0gCholesterol -- less than 5mgSodium -- 420mgPotassium -- 130mgTotal Carbs -- 21gDietary Fiber -- 2gSugars -- 2gProtein -- 3gThis is good for a quick grab and go snack; however, I much prefer microwave popcorn or regular popcorn.  However, for a fast snack this will do.  All in all, pretty good and flavorful, although the calorie count and sodium counts are higher than I usually like to indulge in for a treat.Thanks.Pam

These are really great.  I have eaten a ton of these and I don't really even bother with any brand but Crown Prince when it comes to canned seafood.  My father has loved sardines for 70 years and I recently bought him a 12 pack of these for xmas.  He says he doesn't think he can go back to the cheaper brands he was used to.
summary: Love Crown Prince, love these sardines.

reviewText: In a "Supersize Me" world Izze should be applauded for bucking the trend and marketing an 8 oz. drink product, which is a much more sensible size than the quart size or larger products crowding the shelves. I gave a can of this drink to a friend of mine who commented that they enjoyed the sparkling water mixed with the juice. On the other hand, I prefer a sweeter orange juice. This, to me, had a dull taste that reminded me of eating a frost burned orange.I thought the grapefruit juice was very tasty. It is on the sweet side and reminded most of Ruby Red grapefruit. I think if I was at home mixing this juice from concentrate instead of buying the concentrate premixed in a can, I would use less water.
summary: Izze Clementine Sparking Juice, Grapefruit Sparkling Juice

reviewText: Kellogg's Special K Granola Bars satisfy the sweet-tooth craving; but the contents suggest that this particular granola bar (with 7 grams of sugar, 110 calories in less than an ounce, and low vitamin content) does not provide the level of health benefits which are available in other (albeit less tasty) energy bars.

Make Kefir water!  I received about 2-3T of grains in a double bagged small plastic bag with some brown sugar all over them.  I immediately read the instructions and set about making my first batch of Kefir juice - well, not exactly, but it took the first batch to wake these guys up!I used a large 1L glass jar with the lid left hanging open, put a coffee filter over the top and closed with a rubber band and waited......NOTHING HAPPENED and after 24 hours I didn't see much activity, a few bubbles.  I was beginning to think the guys must be almost DEAD.  Waited another 24 hours, not much going on in there so I poured everything through a plastic strainer and put together another batch of water and sugar and added the grains.  Moved this batch to my Master Bath (68 degrees), where it is a lot warmer than my kitchen (62 degrees).  I sat the jar on a dressing table in front of a sunny window, wrapped a towel around it and walked way for 48 hours!  After 48 hours I went to check and OMG I not only had bubbling Kefir water but now had what looked like 1/2 a cup or more of Kefir grains in the bottom of the jar!  WOW.I have now done about 5 batches of Kefir water and have what is probably 1/2 a 3L glass container full of Kefir grains sitting in my refrigerator in my basement to give them a rest from all that activity.  They are growing me out of house and home, LOL!  I have given away at least 1/2 cup to a friend and not sure what I'm going to do with the rest.  We Americans are very protective of our pets and now I'm burdened with very small pets that need a new home before I'm forced to flush them done the drain or feed them to the orchids I own!I have made several second fermentations to get carbonated Kefir and used a variety of fruit juices.  I find that the grape or red juices seem to taste the best over some of the other fruit juices.  I've read, but not tried, citrus fruit juice because it can become "stringy."  I did try a batch using Kefir with a fruit drink that was a mix of blueberry and banana and my husband loved it but I thought it was kind of "mucky" tasting.  I know, what does "mucky" taste like?  The banana made the drink creamy and murky to look at with lots of sediment in the bottom of the bottle.  I did not like it but, as I said, my husband did.  I have used a variety of sugars, i.e., white, brown and coconut but so far I like the brown the best but that's something you'll have to decide for yourself.  This is bound to be an on-going science project in my kitchen that promises to be interesting.
summary: Do Exactly What They Live to Do!

reviewText: what a RIP off for 1 tablet to equal a HALF of packet of Splenda! PURE sucralose which you can buy on Amazon (just look for the Hard Rhino brand), PURE Sucralose measures 1 TEASPOON makes a GALLON of unsweetened KoolAid mix. I find this a total rip off to make these tablets so weak! Even a 5 lb bag of splenda is a joke, they add LITERALLY 95% maldextrin to the bag so it will measure like sugar, i mean who cares about that! I love sucralose but i hate SPLENDA brand!
summary: why make it 1 tab = just a HALF a packet???!

reviewText: They said you could control the taste by how much of the product you added to hot water. I used the whole thing. It was a very strong, pungent ginger/lemon taste. It tasted good but strong. I think this would be ideal mixed with honey when battling illness. It tasted potent. Someone might like to used this mixed with liquor for a hard lemonade. If you are looking for an herbal tea like drink, this ain't it.
summary: If you like ginger and lemon...

reviewText: OK, I'm from Buffalo so if you're going to sell a Buffalo Wing Pretzel, it better be good.Let me be honest, this is no substitute for an Anchor Bar wing, but as for a Buffalo Wing Pretzel, it's not bad. The pretzel pieces are mostly smallish, crunchy bites. A few larger pieces sneak in once in a while but mostly these are smallish nuggets with a pretty tasty and spicy, Buffalo Wing-ish taste.They're kind of addicting if you like the taste, and I do.
summary: Crunchy pretzels with a nice zing

reviewText: Love this assortment except for the icky lemon ginger. I'll be ordering (and already have) the individual flavors in the future. The Strawberry Pomegranate is my absolute favorite, followed by Raspberry Hibiscus. Meyer Lemon is wonderful if you're under the weather. Acai Berry is VERY sour/tart, but manageable with sweetener. Mango Passionfruit could stand a LOT stronger flavor-barely is there.
They are good but they are a little to salty for my tastes. The kind of salty that makes your tongue feel weird after eating a cup or so.

Those who know how to make sticky rice know that you need a medium grain calrose rice for best results (something that's almost impossible to find in eastern North Carolina).  This is one of the two brands I prefer, the other being Hinoide.

PB2 Powdered Peanut Butter is a great product for those who love peanut butter but not the fat or calories. I have a digestive problem and have to keep the fat low, PB2 allows me to enjoy peanut butter again. It's also great for those on diets.I add this to Dr. McDougall's Thai Peanut Noodles to thicken up the sauce and to add more flavor. It works really well and makes it more like the restaurant version of this dish without the fat and calories.PB2 can be used in recipes too!I do find that I need to play with the amount of water to get the consistency I need. It's well worth it though.The seller (Health & Beauty Pro)is offering it at the best price I've ever seen.
summary: Great product at a good price

reviewText: I had my doubts about this fruit bar when I first saw it on Amazon, but I thought I would give it a try.  It's made of blueberries after all...what's not to like?Well, I was pleasantly surprised.  Coming from Maine, I love the taste of fresh blueberries.  In the off season or on the run, this would be a great alternative to the "real thing."  I think that you will enjoy the flavor of this product.  It does not taste artificial but very natural.Go ahead and buy it!

Nutiva adds to its range of organic whole food products with coconut manna, a whole coconut meat product that is organic and nutritious. This is not the same as their coconut oil - this is the full coconut flesh - which does have a high "healthy" fat content. Having been satisfied with other Nutiva products I've used (such as hemp & chia seeds, coconut oil, hemp protein powder mixes, etc.), I expected high quality and wasn't disappointed. This coconut manna tastes great and is easy to use and store. You can put some in any recipe that calls for coconut and this sure beats having to crack open a fresh cocunut and cut out the coconut meat. For quality, organic coconut that doesn't require coconut cracking labor, Nutiva offers an excellent option.
summary: Tasty, healthy whole coconut - pure organic food

reviewText: Reading the many favorable reviews of this truly awful product, I have to conclude that the people who wrote them have never had a good homemade cookie in their lives. It's plain unimaginable to me that anyone could like these. They are dry as a bone and are exactly like eating compressed sawdust. There is a little flavor there from the chocolate chips, but the cookies are so astonishingly dry that you may not notice it because you'll be busy trying not to choke to death. For heaven's sake, if you're going to eat something this awful, have a glass of milk nearby and your telephone handy in case you need to call 911.

Yum, I like Carrot Cake and I like Larabars.  So this was a pretty good mix for me.  Very flavorful and a great meal replacement, this is definitely one of the better bars I've had lately.Carrot Cake didn't really taste like a cake.  Let's be honest here, the Larabars never taste like the baked goods they're titled after.  But they still taste good.  This one had a little bit of carrot flavor, some spices, and pineapple tastes to me.  There were also some crunchy nuts thrown in as well, and they really did a lot for the texture of the bar.  It really was delicious.This bar had more ingredients than the Larabars normally do.  Which honestly isn't bad, because where there are normally four ingredients, there were nine in this bar.  Dates, Almonds, Walnuts, Raisins, Pineapple, unsweetened coconut, carrots, cinnamon, and extra virgin coconut oil.  All great ingredients and healthy.  And it's the first time I've seen a spice used in the bar, and I did enjoy it.  This bar was lighter on calories as well.  190 calories actually.  You still probably don't want to use it as a snack, but it works just fine as a light meal replacement.  There were also 24 grams of sugar in this bar, which is high, but at least it's coming from natural sources.  And from those natural fruits there were even some vitamins in the mix and 3 grams of protein.Very delicious and aside from the high sugar, a great bar for breakfast.  It definitely was satisfying for me.Review by M. Reynard 2012

This tea sampler couldn't come at a better time.  I was just recovering from something like the flu and could not tolerate anything to eat.  I was a little concerned being sick and having a non desire to taste anything unusual but I was surprised to find out how satisfying these teas were.This is really more like a cup of light hot soup.  Not broth based but just water and flavors.  I like all the ingredients listed so I thought the combinations were pretty good.  My favorite probably was the spinach chive and the broccoli cilantro, maybe because I REALLY like those vegetables and herbs.  I even squirted some fresh lemon juice in these two and they were great.  My other favorite was the carrot curry, I really like the sweetness of it.  My least favorite was the tomato mint only because I am not much of a fun of mint with anything but ice cream or chewing gum.Overall it was a good thing for me but it really depends on the flavors you are familiar with and also think of these teas more like soup rather than an herb tea.

Don't get me wrong, this is a good product, but I guess I was expecting something with a more robust edge to it and a stronger flavor. As with their caramel coffee, it's a very subtle taste......you don't get the bold taste that's typical of the Starbuck's bold roast coffee I nortmally like. You also don't get the strong "flavored coffee" taste that I like when I buy other flavored coffees (e.g., Maxwell House etc.).That said, if you're looking for a decent coffee that isn't overpowered by the flavoring, this might be a good choice for you
summary: Good, but nothing out of the ordinary

reviewText: This base is similar in taste to the one that Amy's soups use.  So it definitely tastes chicken-y (and I know this, since I've only been off meats for 3 months!).  I don't feel like you have to use very much, which is a plus.  I'd put it just above the "Better than Bullion" brand chicken flavored vegetarian. :)
Am glad i purchased them. They taste abit flat because they have no sugar but they are very nutritious. my diabetic mum and grandmum loves to drink them without fears

couldn't find this spice at the store- but found on amazon - taste is good - mix of spices for chili and other items - Not over powering and doesn't appear to have any salt in the mix - Adds flavor to meats and chicken etc.  Highly recommend for the price and delivery

When I got these blend-ins, I was prepared for them to be a complete wash.  After all, V8 claims their fruit drink tastes like fruit, and it most definitely does not.  So the idea that I could put a whole bunch of vegetable puree into brownies and not have their flavor or texture change on me seemed ridiculous.  Still, I figured that if all else failed, I could make soup.Well, I still make take a shot at making carrot and spinach soup, but all else did not fail.  I added the squash packet to a batch of brownies the other night, and changed absolutely nothing else about the recipe, and they came out perfectly.  In fact, I think the puree might have protected the brownies from burning (I left them in the oven a bit too long, but they still came out fine).  I have a very good sense of taste, especially for the taste of vegetables, and I couldn't even get a hint of squash flavor.  Does this make brownies a healthy food?  Well, no, probably not.  But it does sneak vegetables in where there previously were no vegetables, and that will especially come in handy for a couple of my picky, picky roommates who won't even put lettuce on their sandwiches.Long story short:  I will be buying again.  This stuff is awesome.

A longtime fan of Popchips, I was anxious to try their new line of torilla chips. And they did not disappoint. These have a great (and different) texture and the variety of flavors nicely compliments the existing flavors in the potato chip line.
I LOVE IT BECAUSE IT IS ORGANIC AND OF VERY GOOD QUALITY AND YES I WILL BE ORDERING IT AGAIN SOON . I HAVE TRIED OTHERS AND THIS HAS BEEN THE BEST YET!! I RECOMMEND IT TO OTHERS.

This is an Amazon Certified review. I bought this Hershey's Halloween Snack Size Assortment in order to help out with the number of kids we have come here. I bought two bags. There was so much candy in them that I had to have my wife take the rest to work with her and help out getting rid of it. It was a terrific buy.
These cookies offer a yin and yang for your taste buds...there's the ginger from the cookie and the zing from the filling. Different from most lemon filled cookies, the filling isn't super sweet...

These are the whole strawberries freeze dried, not cut up strawberries or pieces of strawberries. The number in the package varies a lot from just a few to quite a few based on size. The flavor is good. The fact that they are entire strawberries makes them much much much better than other freeze dried strawberries - including the same company's strawberry banana mix which had sliced up strawberries. These are very good.
summary: Very nice because they are whole strawberries

reviewText: This bread baked fine in my bread machine and rose well, but it was a letdown when it came to flavor. I wouldn't say it was bad; in fact it was good, but not any better than store-bought bread. I ended up giving the birds half the loaf and won't be purchasing this again. My quest to find a good rye bread mix that's as good as the deli rye I used to buy continues...
Subscribe and Save.  I like the quantity savings and the deliver to door convenience.
summary: I like the quantity savings and the deliver to door convenience

reviewText: Its always nice to grind your own beans and these are very good.  The taste of caramel in your coffee is yummy.  You will enjoy a yummy delcious dessert coffee but I have it for breakfast.  I have never tried this brand before but it was worth a try.  I enjoyed good  and fast service, so I would certainly buy from this seller again.

Pure Chocolate Mallowmars have been around for years and they are still fantastic. Rich, real chocolate, covering a fluffy marshmallow and a soft cookie. These are delicious and truly addictive. Mallowmars have just the right texture. My wife thinks they would be better without the cookie, but for me, the cookie is an integral part and I am perfectly happy with them. They are a great treat, but a bit expensive. Sometimes though, you just have to indulge yourself. What would life be without a little indulgence? Pretty dull.
summary: The Original is Still The Best

reviewText: I can't believe these are low-carb. They are moist, flavorful and absolutely delicious. Perfect for when you're craving something you probably shouldn't eat while on a low-carb diet. I'm off Atkins now, but I still recall these muffins fondly.

The best cereal I found so far, that is organic, gluten free, and tastes good (and one I can get at a discounted price through subscribe and save). My son eats this almost every day, and doesn't get tired of it. I just add fruit or raisins for variety.
summary: The best cereal I found so far

reviewText: I found this vanilla flavor to have a good flavor and well suited particularly to those who have more recently made the switch away from drinking cow's milk. I bought these when the price was fair and currently the price is even better, but I've decided to stick to unsweetened now..yet have noticed that all 'unsweetened' milk substitutes on Amazon tend to cost much more than the sweetened (unlike at stores where they are priced the same).But for myself, I'd rather avoid drinking sugar whenever possible and can now accept substitutes that taste less like milk. (Unless the prices for unsweetened versions become more reasonable, I'll buy unsweetened versions at the store from now on or do without.)

I love Ginger tea, the hot and pungent taste, sometimes mixed with mint, or lemon. I used to buy Ginger tea bags, but recently switched to Ginger tea "concintrate" that appears to be ginger jam, which you add to hot water. Its not very economical, and of course, you cant pack it for lunch, or take it from the house. (cos it comes in a glass jar you keep in the fridge.) GOLD KILI ginger tea, solves those problems of cost and portability. The 2oz aluminum bag contains freeze dried ginger lemon tea. However, add the WHOLE bag to a cup of tea, and you'll be overwhelmed. One of those 2oz bags, makes a small teapot of hot tea. Short of using fresh ginger, slicing it and boiling it, this tea is the best. The lemon overtone is mild, conplimenting the ginger, not clouding it. For a sore throat, take this concintrate, add it to pure honey, and take by the teaspoon every hour. Also, for fast ginger stir fry, use a packet of this Ginger honey tea, add it to your stir fried veggies and tofu, along with some soy sauce, and you have a good chinese stir fry sauce. Ginger is good for nausea when traveling. If you carry a pouch of this freeze dried tea in your wallet or purse during cold season, you can treat the first signs of flu, ie the nausea, sore throat, or stuffy nose, as soon as it starts. For a stuffy nose, this is good tea, when mixed with some peppermint tea. (Or, try using a peppermint candy cane, as a hot tea swizzel stick.) I really enjoy GOLD KILI INSTANT GINGER LEMON tea for its intense taste, and convenience. The consintrate is sugar free, so dont forget the honey.
summary: GINGER TEA, and ginger stir fry starter

reviewText: I have used this dip in a number of different ways, and each was wonderful.  Mixed with softened cream cheese, I used some as frosting on a low-carb cake and the rest in small spoonfulls refrigerated to make luscious caramel candy.  I have also used it as a simple dip for strawberries, and on top of an egg-custard to make it taste like flan.  It is incredible that anything can taste so good and be not only carbohydrate free, but calorie free!  I love this product and will be ordering more very soon.

The main reason I purchased this was because I was looking for something that's as close as can be to Fanta's melon soda.  I love that brand's melon soda and always look forward to drinking it whenever I'm able to visit Japan, but it's pretty much impossible to find that particular flavor in the states, unless you happen to order it from an auction website, which would be pretty silly, since it doesn't make sense to actually buy something like that online that's obviously being sold over-priced for what it is.As a previous reviewer noted, the flavor of this is pretty light and is not strong (even after properly stirring), so according to your preference, you may have to use just a little extra than what is recommended.  Although I have to admit that this does not taste anything like Fanta's melon soda, it is in my opinion, the closest thing that I could find (that you could make on your own with the addition of sparkling water), and the good thing about these syrups is that you can control how sweet it's going to be, versus buying a can/bottle of soda at the store which has way too much sugar and/or HFCS in it.  Mixing this with sparkling water gives just a faint green color, nothing like that intense green you'll get with Fanta's melon soda, which in retrospect may also be a good thing, since it means that there's not too much (or according to the ingredients list, any) artificial coloring used for this syrup.Taste-wise, I felt that the flavor of the syrup does taste as similar as can be to (and remind me of) melon, and I personally didn't think it tasted bad or that it left a weird/unpleasant aftertaste at all, but then again, everyone's taste perceptions are different and as the saying goes, you can't please everyone.  I am ultimately satisfied with this product and will happily keep using it whenever I happen to have some sparkling water on hand and feel like drinking and making my own melon flavored soda.  Also looking forward to incorporating this with some alcoholic beverages, such as with Flor de Caña.
summary: Closest thing to use for your own melon flavored soda

reviewText: I have to admit, I was skeptical about this purchase both because of the price and my not so good experience with another brand of pricey healthy tuna from another online vendor but the reviews convinced me. And lucky for me they were right on! I am very finicky about fishy smelling and tasting fish - I know I'm a fish snob. This stuff is delicious. I do wish it were less expensive, but the challenge is if more people buy it and hence allow the price to go down, that also means the demand goes up and some places end up compromising their product. I hope this stuff continues to be of the quality I am now spoiled by!

Go figure. Had a pizza party for our four year old granddaughter and when she saw these, and she has had them before, she knew she would rather eat these than pizza. Now which would be better for her I wonder? We insisted she had to eat pizza and after she ate a slice (hey! it was great pizza) we rewarded her with some of these. With all the high fructose in the treats the market makes available to our kids it is great knowing there are some healthy snacks out there that the kids love. She prefered them to opening Christmas presents! Her mom likes them too and especially likes the amount of protein in them.
summary: Our granddaughter likes these better than pizza

reviewText: I am a Heinz Ketchup freak.  I need it on almost everything.  So I bought these chips.  They are awesome and really do taste like Heinz Ketchup.
summary: Oh my, they realy DO taste like Heinz Ketchup!

reviewText: Purchase this product for my husband. He loves the original flavor and adds fresh blueberries and honey. Tastes great and quick and easy to prepare.
Taste is fine.Too many of the chips come out broken/too small to eat.Expensive for the overall quantity of edible chips.

This coffee has a nice smooth flavor with a hint of creamy caramel.  Before brewing I can smell really nice caramel notes in the cup.  Once brewed, the coffee is rich, with a lighter caramel flavor.  I found this to be a slightly darker roast than I've seen in other flavored coffees.  The caramel flavor is smooth and light.  This is not too sweet to be relegated to dessert coffee.  I'm quite happy drinking it in the morning and at night.  Versatile and delicious.
This is the winner for me as far as wheat products go.  It's nutritious, taste great and is very easy to digest compared to other wheat products.

Just do a search for the latest exhaustive studies done of all the top imports and a few great california brands - including Bariani.Most all of the imports were oxidized and adulterated - a few of the california most expenside were a bit off too. But this and California Olive ranch were tops.

OK, you may have tried the regular Shirataki noodles.  They have a texture nothing like a noodle.These Tofu noodles are excellent!!  I purchased them and have used them with tomato sauce, Asian dressing in a cold noodle salad, and also in a fritata with eggs and sauteed veggies.Just rinse under cold water for 2-3 minutes, then microwave for 2 minutes, pat dry and go for it.Amazing!
summary: You Must Buy These-just like Angel Hair Pasta!

reviewText: I've been using this Brand a long time, I can cook with it, and use it in everything I used to use honey or sugar or agave in.  I keep it in my purse too.  Of course it has a different type of sweet taste but it isn't chemicals and it doesn't cause cancer.  It's a plant.  I recommend this type highly.

This is a convenient way to buy and drink tea.  The tea is delicious, and I like the fact that it is organic.  I think the price is good, but I stopped buying it and now make my own iced tea, which is not very hard to do.
Love the crunch. The taste is simple and a very healthy and protein rich snack. I've also used it as a salad topping

I am a big hot chocolate fan.  When I found out I could get Swiss Miss in K-Cup form I was pretty excited.  It's convenient, it tastes good.  The only drawback is that there are no tiny little marshmallows.
summary: If you like hot chocolate in the pack, you'll love this!

reviewText: I am always looking for chips that are somewhat truly natural.  I am definitely a crunchy chip loving person!  I believe I enjoy the crunching sensation of consuming this kind of food.  These chips are the bomb!  They have the greatest flavor and if you look at the ingredients brown rice and almonds to me you can't go wrong.  Again, the flavor is fantastic.  They also hold up to dipping in dips etc. i.e. hummus, tunafish, etc.  The only problem is I can consume a whole bag at one sitting!  it is hard to stop eating them once you start.

My youngest has graduated from college but she was home when this package arrived from the Amazon Vine program. We opened it together and had a blast checking out the goodies. I never sent my kids a prepared care package at exam time because those I knew about offered either sugary candy or too much fruit which would spoil quickly.This would be a welcomed package at a stressful time. The foods are organic (important to todays "green" students), have no trans fat, have some nutritional value, don't require refrigeration and are easy to open.  To satisfy any craving, there is a nice mixture of salty, crunchy and sweet but none are too much.The Vitamin C drink mix is great for preventing colds and replenishing this vitamin that is overtaxed at a stressful time. (The Vitamin C was not listed on the description but was included.)The first thing we sampled was the Sharkies. They are like Swedish Fish and the consistency of gummy bears.  They are designed to be eaten after a workout. They were just OK but may taste better after a workout. This addition is a good reminder that exercise is beneficial for stress reduction.I'm munching on the Mini Cheddar Cheese Bite Size Crackers as I write. They are delicious! The taste of real cheese is so much better than all that processed stuff.One drawback of this package is that there are many carbohydrates and no fresh fruit. Overall, worth considering!
summary: Wish I had known about this sooner!

reviewText: I will start off by telling you I am Italian, I have used Olive oil my whole life and never tried anything else. So it took me a while to know what to use this product with.  (Trial and very bad error!! don't make spaghetti or tomato sauce with it).I found that cooking American, Japanese  dishes or Italian deserts works well with the oil. BUT NOT Spaghetti..( cold shivers)But I also found that my dog ( 2 ) and four of my  (12 ) cats... just kidding  ( 5) cats love the taste and I found that it is very good for their coats and skin. One day while trying to cook with the oil my two dogs (Prissy a shih tzu and Shotzi my Pompom) were in the kitchen jumping up and down wanting what I had. So I took  a spoon ( that my husband says his and only his ... so don't tell him) and let them lick a little oil thinking they would taste it and leave, after them the firkin cats had to get in on the action and the next thing I know I had to lock everyone out of the Kitchen. Needless to say, their coats are sleek and shiny. ( I tried to put a little on Prissy's tummy for dry skin but she would not stop licking herself.Do some research look at what can be done. I had a ball working in the kitchen with it
summary: 1ST TIME USER, AND LOVE THE PRODUCT

reviewText: I'm pretty picky when it comes to energy drinks. The drink has to both provide energy as well as *not* taste like someone's foot or other body part. High standards, but sometimes I get nicely surprised now & then.PROS:1) This actually tasted good enough to where I wanted to drink more of it.2) A nice enough energy high without feeling like my heart was going to burst.CONS:1) There was a weird aftertaste that I couldn't quite shake.2) Energy didn't seem to last as long as it does with other energy drinks such as 5 Hour Energy.In the end my only real problem with the drink was the aftertaste. I was a little bummed that the energy high didn't last as long as I'd have liked it to, but I'm willing to overlook that flaw since it didn't make me jittery or make my heart race like other energy drinks occasionally do. Luckily this isn't something I'd take my time sipping as I would a bottle of soda, so the semi-metallic aftertaste wasn't that bad. This is something that I can see myself buying again in the future, to be honest.
bad taste waste of money. worst item i ever bought on line. it still upset my stomach, so still to much acid!

I've enjoyed Teeccino's Mocha drink for more than a decade as a substitute for morning coffee.  Ordering it from Amazon on a regular basis makes it so much easier and less expensive to enjoy.  It is delicious, different and healthy.

I tried the artisana brand first, which i was head over heels in love with.. usually after trying one brand, ill keep switching around just to see whats great, whats not. I found nutiva to be pretty comparable for less. Yes artisana is ahhh-maazzinng, but this is just as sensational. I dont mind the gritty taste, to me its not even gritty. I dont melt it or anything. I eat it on a spoon right out of the jar, topped with some fresh coconut oil, smothered right on to a banana for breakfast, with a side of almonds and green tea. Its my new favorite breakfast, and actually keeps me full a lot longer. I'll continue to purchase, while i may explore other brands, i do like there coconut manna. As for coconut oil, jarrows by far has the best oil i've ever tasted. It is very rich.Cheers!
A little bit weak for my tastes, but would probably be good for people that don't want a strong cofee.
