Excellent chocolate/caramel combo, in bite sized pieces.  i prefer to let them melt in my mouth - it allows you to savor the chocolate/caramel, rather than biting it.  this stuff is so good, it'd be easy to down a whole bag yourself in one sitting, if you're not careful.  it's that good. I got this pack at work, and when my staff found out about it, the candy was gone in short order.
summary: Superb chocolate - let it melt in your mouth

reviewText: Really, one word sums it up. YUM! Especially love the peppermint hot cocoa. Oooohhhhh. Soooo good! Love getting a variety to try at one time!

I have been using Simply Organic's Vanilla Extract for several years now.  I find it to be perfect for my needs.  This is about 2/3 the price that I pay for the vanilla locally.I suppose that I could go into the aroma and all that good stuff; however, I'm going for boring in this review.The only thing that would make this better is if Amazon offered this extract up on their Subscribe and Save service.

I use this all the time for various things. The smaller sized cans are nice to be able to add a little protein in to a dish and not worry about having part of it left in the fridge. One can makes a nice serving of chicken salad for a sandwich, only takes a couple minutes to whip it up.
summary: Good staple to have on hand

reviewText: If you have ever had a Kellogg's Pop Tart, that is essentially a similar product.  These Stila bars are just in a package that attempts to make them look healthier.  When they say they are 100 calories, that really just means they are small.First ingredients are the sugars, followed by flours and starches so these are very high Glycemic Index.These weigh only 26 g and 18 g are carbohydrates.Taste wise it is a crispy pastry with sweet fruit filling.  It tastes a lot like a Pop Tart with a slightly crunchier shell.  I even tried toasting one of these in the toaster (careful, not very long) and it tasted really good.So I like the taste of the product (like other mostly chemical products), but I don't see the value.  I would rather buy Pop Tarts as they are a lot cheap.  If you only ate half a Pop Tart they would be 100 calories too and be about the same weight.  These might be slightly more appetizing cold due to their shell.
Love this sauce. It's fantastic in rice dishes, and as a replacement for soy sauce--much less salty.

I've been using the Wabash Valley Farms Popping Oil for a long time, and really love it!  The smell of microwave popcorn is nauseating, and the taste is almost as bad.  I really wish they'd ban it from our office.  When someone pops it, the normal smell is awful, but when they burn it, I have to leave the building!  Ugh!  Early on, my Mom taught me to cook my own popcorn in a heavy, lidded pot on the stove, and that's the way I've always done it.  This popping oil is luscious and makes the popcorn SO much more tasty than that nasty stuff from the microwave!  Try it, you'll like it!!  It'll make movie night at your house the BEST ever!

Love this!!!!!!!  Because this is one of my favorites, this is the size for me.  With the larger size I become an overeater.  This way I keep them in the freezer and indulge eagerly but successfully in terms of over eating

These bars are great!  Chewy, but not too much and nice flavor from the cranberries.  Oskri makes really nice snack bars and I've enjoyed every variety I've tried so far.  My husband takes them with his lunch for a mid morning snack, plus you get all that fiber!  Yummy!

My favorite of all the Dentynes, and impossible to buy in Kauai, so have taken to ordering from Amazon.  Thrilled to be able to have my favorite gum and not have to pay a fortune for it, came fresh and tasty.

IT SAYS ON THE BOX EACH DRINK CONTAINS: THE POTASIUM OF 2 BANANAS & MORE ELECTROLITES THAN A SPORTS DRINK. THEY MIGHT SEEM A LITTLE HIGH PRICED BUT GO TO GROECERY STORE BUY 2 BANANAS & 2 SPORTS DRINKS AND YOU WILL PAY MORE TO GET THE SAME NUTRITION YOU GET FROM 1 JUICE BOX OF THIS COCONUT WATER.

I purchased this for my husband who uses it on his face after shaving. It has made his skin look so alive. He is in his 60 but after using the oil,he looks younger. We had been using a different brand that was oily and heavier, but this oil is lighter and not so coconuty smell.
I have LOVED wintergree Canada Mints for decades.  Love them.  Broke a tooth on one though, bummer.  But if you want a good wintergreen candy, and lots of it, this is for you.
great for making a great cup of chai. I use 2 teabags and add almond milk, lots cheaper than paying $5 a cup at the local cafes.
I was looking for a reasonably priced organic whole wheat flour. This was a great option! I love Bob's Red Mill, and the flour easily substitutes for white in all of my recipes.
summary: Good flour for a good price

reviewerName: Livin' La Vida Low-Carb Man "Jimmy Moore"
reviewText: My wife Christine LOVES her vanilla latte coffee made with heavy whipping cream. We eat a low-carb, high-fat diet, but that doesn't mean we're deprived of the little things in life that make it enjoyable. This Torani Sugar Free Vanilla Syrup is the perfect way to complement and mimic the Vanilla Latte from Starbuck's that she loves so much when we make it at home. This product shows you don't have to sacrifice taste when you give up the blood sugar-spiking sugar in your diet. ENJOY!
summary: All The Vanilla Flavor Without All The Sugar

reviewText: As far as taste goes, this is by far my favorite cereal, but despite the whole grain (very little apparently), it has very little fiber (zero,actually, according to the box itself), so I usually don't eat it.  Too bad.
summary: My favorite; wish it had more fiber

reviewText: After failing to find such a simple product in the local grocery stores, I resorted to Amazon, where I was able to find it in seconds and…… pay less for it to arrive at my door step.  Just the way I like it.I realize that supermarkets have limited shelf space, since what seems like hundreds of feet are dedicated to a single brand or two of corn.  But to be met with no hominy AND an employee who had never heard of the stuff amazed me.  Fortunately my cravings for those nutty undertones, from full sized kernels of buttered corn, were satisfied with the offering from ‘The Allens’ label.For the uninitiated from “NOT the South”, you should try this simple and inexpensive vegetable and see if you don’t get hooked also.  It’s like super corn or what one might imagine kicking a can of Niblets’ butt, if corn had a social hierarchy, was ambulatory, and actually had something resembling a posterior.  Other than that, I feel my simile was flawless.Should you reside in an area where hominy is not available or illegal, you have a conduit to class and distinction via Amazon.  Good luck.
summary: Hominy which is as good, as it is easy to find.

reviewText: I love veggies and prefer mainly dehydrated veggies for cooking because there is less waste which is more cost effective. The celery is great for cooking and should be added about 20-30 minutes before your stew or whatever you are making is done.

I enjoy the time, convenience, and the taste. My mother has Alzheimer's so getting her to eat is hard, but she enjoys these little meals. They are just the right size without being too much. The calorie and protein content are just right for her diabetes. They come shipped right to the door, and easy to store.

I was extremely dubious about trying this oatmeal since I hate instant oatmeals. I usually make old-fashioned steel-cut oatmeal at home but heard good things about this and decided to give it a try. To tell you how much I like it, I've had it every morning  and I just ordered 3 more cases; it's now my go-to morning cereal.Why is it so good? Well it's obviously quick and easy - you just tip open a tiny part of the top and microwave it for 60 seconds. You do not add any water.And I think that's the important thing here - this is real steel-cut oatmeal but it's already cooked and you're basically heating it up so no water is needed. If I'm not making that sound appetizing it's only because it may not sound great, but it is great tasting.The only thing I would say is that I love really chewy oatmeal with almost a brown rice-like texture. If you prefer your oatmeal much smoother, you can always add milk to it (sometimes I add a little almond milk.) But if you really don't like that chewy texture you might want to consider a different cereal.Highly recommended.
summary: I love steel-cut oatmeal the old fashioned way - but this comes close and it's great

reviewText: I have been eating the KIND Almond and coconut bars for about two years.  I like the fact that they are not too sweet, but filling in between meals.  Amazon has good pricing on these bars

There are a vast assortment of yellow mustards available out there, but Plochman's consistantly provides an excellent product with the best price around. I prefer the smaller, easier to handle size of this bundle. I will continue to purchase this product!

This stuff is really good, little expensive. While the one amazon ships comes in plastic jars, you can still buy them in glass jars elsewhere. If your a coconut oil lover, you're gonna have a new love!

The first bag I purchased was perfect and tasted fresh, sadly the second order I purchased was hard and partially stale in flavor. Of course I will continue buying these over Haribo due to the larger bag.

Yummy, yummy, yummy, yummy, yummy, yummy, etc.  I think these are especially tasty.  My BIL was feeding some of these to one of the grandkids and he couldn't open them fast enough.  We have these on auto renew.

Product was received exactly as described.  I love that I can drink Organic coffee, as an instant coffee.  The little single serve packs are really nice to use - you don't need to dirty a spoon - just add hot water and it's ready.  It's definitely not the best coffee I've ever tasted, but it's the only coffee we drink, and drink 1-2 cups a day.  It's the only Organic INSTANT coffee available.  It's also a lot cheaper to purchase it online than in the Natural Grociery stores - that is, if you can find it there.
and then mix that with some sprite or 7 up and you have a lovely summer beverage. Ill probably have to reorder and keep drinking in order to really really know if its any good or not.

Another dried fruit that I bought from Amazon was out of stock, so I bought these.  My grandson loves them (he's 19 months).  My daughter likes them because they are big pieces.  The others were small and left crumbs in the tray of his stroller.  We will be buying more of these.

The SWITCH ORANGE TANGERINE SODA doesn't taste too bad and it is carbonated, but the taste reminded me of orange juice that went sour. You know, when the O.J. has gone way past the expiration date and you gulp some and it has that bitter acidic taste.Anyway, the soda is made from a combination of apple, grape, tangerine, orange and acerola juice, and doesn't add sugar, corn syrup, preservatives or artificial colors. It's also gluten free so that's good news for those who are trying to watch what they eat and drink.The 8.3-ounce can is smaller than the standard 12-ounce can of soda and maybe it just takes a couple of tries to get used to the flavor.Like I said, not bad but I'll stick with regular/diet soda. But for a healthier alternative for soda lovers, I suggest trying one of the "SWITCH SODAS" OR any naturally flavored sparkling water.

This item was $48.99 or so just a week ago.  The trend now on Amazon is that sellers start hiking up prices as they keep getting 5 stars reviews.  The product is excellent, is too bad that Amazon is now flooded with too many greedy sellers.  Best to shop around for prices.
Although the reviews are all over the place, I really like these snack bars because they are quite tasty, being both chewy with a little bit of crunch.
summary: Tasty snack bars - chewy with some crunch

reviewText: I have tried a few Old Wisconsin's foods and they have all been great including this one.  The one thing I did not expect was how much you get.  I must have snacked on this bag for at least a week. My dog would know when I was going to the fridge for these lovely little bites and with a good enough pout I would toss her one (stingy I know but hey these are good and they are mine).I would recommend once you open the package that you move them to another container because this bag is not resealable and gets a little greasy.

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of this drink.It's refreshing, smooth, and tasty. The tea contains pulp from passion fruit that add oomph to the green and aloe vera coolness and smoothness of the drink.Despite 19 g of sugar for every 1 cup (8 fl oz), the drink manages not too feel unbearably sweet.The remaining nutritional facts for 1 cup (8 fl oz) are as follows:calories 80total fat 0sodium 38 mgtotal carbs 20gprotein 0 gThere is a disclaimer about it being not a significant source of saturated fat, cholesterol, dietary fiber, vitamins A and D, calcium, and/or iron.For those interested, the ingredients are; water, cane sugar, green tea infusion (green tea leaves and water), aloe vera, citric acid, natural passion fruit flavor.Bonus: The drink comes in a sleek container that offers a good grip on the plastic bottle.My only complaint, if I had to give one? At 340 ml (11.5 fl oz), there wasn't enough of the product! The bottle says to refrigerate after opening, but I am willing to bet that won't be necessary - it's too delicious to stop drinking!
summary: a pleasant, refreshing, and delicious surprise

reviewText: Honestly haven't tried them yet....but my aunt pointed out that their ingredients looks quite dangerous and resemble those in other foods high in GMO's.Ingredients:Water, Wheat Gluten, Red Beans, Tomato Paste (Tomatoes, Salt), Soybean Oil. Contains 2% or less of Salt, Modified Corn Starch, Onion (Dried), Hydrolyzed Soy Protein, Corn Protein, and Wheat Gluten, Sugar, Monosodium Glutamate, Caramel Color, Autolyzed Yeast Extract, Garlic Powder, Corn Syrup, Dextrose, Spices, Natural Flavors From Non-meat Sources, Vitamins and Minerals (Niacinamide, Iron [Ferrous Sulfate], Vitamin B1 [Thiamin Mononitrate], Vitamin B6 [Pyridoxine Hydrochloride], Vitamin B2 [Riboflavin], Vitamin B12 [Cyanocobalamin]), Paprika, Extract, Corn Oil.
I order these all of the time and every time I order them they arrive in great, fresh condition and always are very good and last for a while!!!

I really like green tea and actually am a fan of Asian drinks with pulp inside so I thought Chantea Aloe Vera Green Tea with Passion Fruit would be a great fit for me and it was. I thought the green tea flavor was just right mixed with the passion fruit and the pulp/chunks was not slimy but just the right texture. What did have me a little confused was that I was expecting the pulp/chunks to be Aloe Vera but instead it really seems to taste like passion fruit every time I break one in my mouth. Don't get me wrong, for I don't dislike that I was just a little confused and was not expecting that taste.Would recommended to those who enjoy tea drinks with pulp/chunks on the bottom, especially those who like green tea and passion fruit. It did remind me of young cocoanut juice with pulp, so if you are familiar and enjoyed the pulp sensation on the bottom this drink might just be right for you.

Every Nature's Path product I've had has been great and their Organic Crunchy Vanilla Sunrise cereal is no exception. Featuring about four different shapes and textures into on cereal make for an interesting dining experience, and quite a tasty one at that. With a light vanilla flavor, it's sweeter than I was expecting, this is more for the consumer with a sweet tooth of which I am on occasion, but it isn't so sweet that you'd want to sprint to the nearest dentist after eating. This would be a great cereal for kids as a replacement for the unhealthier cereals marketed for children out there, the only downside is the box screams healthy and not "Kids, eat me!" All organic and natural, the ingredient list a dream; I love when I know what everything actually is. Nature's Path is a product of the USA and the box is made from 100% recycled paperboard, which makes this recycler happy.Here's a glance at the more important nutritional facts:Serving size: 2/3 cup (Seems a bit measly but fairly normal in comparison to most other cereals, which are usually 3/4 cup, but it's about the amount I generally have for breakfast anyway.)Calories: 110 with just the cereal, only 10 from fat.Total fat: 1 gram, no evil fats like saturated or trans, but no polyunsaturated or monounsaturated, which are good for you, either.Cholesterol: ZilchSodium: 130 mgTotal Carbohydrates: 25 gramsDietary Fiber (included in Total Carbs): 3 grams (Could be better but better than a lot of cereals.)Sugars (included in Total Carbs): 7 grams (Not bad, not bad at all. Ideally, one shouldn't have more than 6 g for breakfast, but what's one gram? ;P)Protein: 2 gramsThe cereal is also gluten-free and contains 11% (.15 grams) of omega 3 fatty acids per serving.No real added vitamins to speak of.So, would I buy this again? Heck yeah. The blend of flavors, from the vanilla to the added sweetness to the flakes to the Kix-like spheres, it's one of my new faves. Topped with slices of banana, it lifts my mood like the morning sunrise. :D
summary: (4.5 stars) Lifts my mood like the morning sunrise

reviewText: Just like in the stores. When you go to a fancy coffee shop, they often add swigs of this stuff to your coffee. It's delicious. Now you can add it yourself at home, and that's great. It's too sweet to sip alone, but add it to coffee or even to your baking, and wow, it's really good.
summary: Just like in the fancy stores...

reviewText: The bottles are huge and they last a long time. I absolutely love this for my skin, hair and cooking. It's perfect if you want to eat healthier too. Worth the price.. love it!!

reviewerName: But I'm feeling much better now...
reviewText: While the taste of these bars was OK, the texture left a lot to be desired.  I much rather prefer a baked like product, not one that is just pressure formed together.
Who doesn't like Swedish fish?  Warning, these things are ridiculously addicting!  Definitely my favorite candy and I would recommend them to anybody....except maybe a diabetic.

My little guy has been teething nonstop since forever. If the teeth aren't coming in, they're about to. He often seems discomforted by the irritation and pain.That said, crunchiness has often provided some soothing for him.While these aren't terribly crunchy after about half a second, he always seemed happy jamming them into his mouth and biting down.Once regular solid foods were introduced he pretty much gave up on these. I'd say the were good from 7-10mos for him.We went through about a dozen containers during that time.The containers, btw, make great bowling pins and robot arms afterward!
summary: Awesome early finger food for fussy teether

reviewText: Summertime is coming, and I tend to make a lot of iced green tea... and since I use 6 bags for each pitcher, this big box of teabags is just the ticket. These Lipton bags make refreshing, healthy iced tea (I make it with either honey or artificial sweetener) that is hard to stop drinking. I also occasionally use them for hot tea, and they make a nice cup; full-bodied but still light with no bitterness.
This is the only oil we use for stovetop frying.  We also use it in most of our baking.  It does not have a strong coconut taste, it is very mild.

My 9 month old loves these, and sometimes she'll refuse her baby food if she eats these first. My 2 year old steals them from her sister, so we go through these rather quickly. I love that the container is BPA Free.
summary: My kids can't get enough of it

reviewText: I use this stuff in many things.  Lasagne, Hamburger Helper, spaghetti sause, etc.  My meat-eating husband loves it.  I'm from-birth vegetarian and didn't know that it was imitating chopped animal until I attained a certain age of understanding.  At any rate - I highly recommend it.  Most delicious.  Use it in anything that you would use hamburger.
i really like aroma the coffee gives as its being brewed and it also tastes greatit has a rich and flavorful taste to itvery good coffee i would recommend it

This was terrific - not too sweet but with a strong passion fruit flavor and no aloe bitterness,  120 calories per bottle, made in Taiwan.  There is some aloe floating in the solution, and if you don't like pulp, that is something to keep in mind.  Sweetened with sugar.
This tea is delicious, gives you a nice energy boost, and is also a mild appetite suppressant, making a good choice for your afternoon break.

The following review is the review I wrote on the vanilla flavored Teeccino. I saw no reason to change it except to mention that I found the Mocha flavor to be even better. It's not nearly as chocolaty or sweet as hot chocolate (thankfully) and it has only 20 calories per cup. It tastes more like coffee then the vanilla and mint and is the flavor smoother. My wife didn't care for the other two but loves the Mocha. It makes for a great, healthy after-dinner desert drink.*This is my second time trying Teeccino and I must say the more I drink it the better I like it. As I've gotten older, coffee is having adverse effects my digestive track and it's not been good so I need something else and tea just doesn't cut it. Teeccino seems to be about as close to coffee as one can get without being coffee. The mint was really good and this vanilla nut may even be better. Teeccino doesn't leave that bad aftertaste coffee gives you (even the really good stuff) and it seems to give a slight energy boost. Nothing like coffee though. No brain stimulation. I think the energy comes from the inulin. I did some research on inulin and I suggest you do the same. I'm still not sure if it's a good thing or not. Some say yes and others no. It doesn't seem to have a negative effect on me as of yet. If you need to get off of coffee or hot chocolate or your just tired of drinking tea give Teeccino a try. I think you'll be quite pleased. Oh yea... I put honey and milk in mine and it's really good that way.I've been making a pitcher at the beginning of the week and keeping it in the fridge. It seems to keep very well. It's easier to heat up a cup on the stove in the morning so I don't wake the entire house with the noise of the coffee maker or microwave.

I have never been one to rely on nor crave a bar. Following a gluten-free and low- allergy controlled diet, I stumbled across these KIND bars while looking for nutritious options for my teens, thinking I would be able to try them. Well indeed they truly are scrumptuous. My 18 year old loves them and when running out the door will grab one or two for the road. I have only tried the Walnut and Date and the Cranbery, Almonds and Oxidants as I follow a blood type diet and do not love things that are too sweet. We are on our second box of each and I will be looking at the other varieties to try in time.
summary: one of a KIND, delicious gluten free bar

reviewText: It tastes okay, not great. Like a dry biscuit with sugary strawberry flavoring.The ingredients are NOT all that healthful. It contains no trans fats, which is good.But it does contain high fructose corn syrup (which is worse than sugar -- Google it), and caramel color. I heard a radio report claiming that some people now believe that caramel color may cause some cancers.So check whatever you buy for caramel color. Lots of bread and cereal products contain it.Quaker Stila also contains Red 40, and FD&C; Yellow 5.What's with all the artificial coloring? What would this product look like in its natural state?Curiously, the advertising for this production says it contains "whole grains," but this is not on the package. The ingredients list Oat Flour, Enriched Flour, Wheat Flour, and Toasted Oats. Not "Whole Oats Flour," etc. So I really don't know if this is a whole grain products.Not the worst snack you can have. It does contain apple powder and zinc oxide. But while many less healthful snacks exist, so do many more healthful ones.
summary: Mediocre taste, and not all that healthful

reviewText: If you're looking for a chocolate that combines with peanut butter, this is a good choice.  The whole family was popping these in their mouths and savoring the taste.  They are much better than eating something like REESE'S Peanut Butter Cups and more moist than that.I will say most of mine came smashed because Amazon just used a padded envelope for shipping.  Hopefully yours will ship in a box for protection. Otherwise you might have to scoop the peanut butter back in the chocolate on some to enjoy it.If you already like lindt chocolate truffles and like peanut butter...this is a good place to start your chocolate snack.
summary: Great choice for peanut butter lovers

reviewText: When i went to my grocery store ( giant ) i could not believe the price for one box of honey nut cheerios, so when i went home i went online to amazon.com and found a great deal on cheerios and this is my place to buy cereal from now on.
this product has a fresh, lively taste...I usually use regular Lipton, I am now a changed woman...green tea will be my drink of choice from now on

I only had the opportunity to try one of these, so I wish I had been able to try one or two more to get a better assessment of the product. But overall it was okay. I was apprehensive about the taste because most energy drinks leave behind an unpleasant aftertaste, but this product didn't have it. I actually enjoyed the taste; it was refreshing with just the right amount of carbonation.I work the overnight shift, and I drank this about halfway through my shift to help give me some extra energy, but it didn't feel very effective. I didn't feel any more energized once I had drank it.I like the fact that this drink is better for you than other energy drinks, but it doesn't seem worth it if it doesn't help energize me.Overall, great taste but don't expect to feel energized.

It inspired us to become like fine wine connoisseurs, where we could taste, discern, and feel the difference that Penta awakened in us. When we introduced it to the world, it was love at first sip and the rest, as they say, is history.Today, PENTA water is available in more than 3,500 stores nationwide and the love for it continues to grow with many more stores being added monthly. Penta is also sold internationally, including in Australia, Canada, and Japan.Unlike many supplements and beverages that use synthetic additives, Penta has no additives so it is naturally and fully absorbed by your body to maximize its antioxidant effects. Oh, and did we also mention that our water is proven be the purest around? After all, not all waters are created equal.So you see, at the end of your day, at the beginning of your day, and in the middle of your day, the type of beverage and the kind of water you drink really matters.Penta is for the nourishment of your mind, body, and soul. It goes beyond hydration to become a way of life, a choice to fully embrace a vital, healthful life...today and tomorrow.Zero Additives. Ultra-purified Water. Now that's refreshing!PENTA, Live PURE."***I've personally been enjoying the amazing Penta Water since it became available to me locally in 1999. It absolutely re-hydrates me, leaving me feeling energized, refreshed and renewed. I drink Penta everyday with my dietary supplements (It's especially effective with a 5-Hour Energy Shot). Thanks Amazon, for these excellent prices too.***

This tomato sauce is very close to fresh tomatoes in taste. It is nice and thick with a fairly dark red color. I enjoyed it very much. It is easy and fun to use because it cooks up fast and there is no cookware to wash afterwards.

The aroma while brewing was great, but the actual drink felt watered down. I recommend using the 2nd smallest brewing size on a Keurig Platinum - the taste was still a little off, but decent.I peeled the K-cup open after brewing to see the contents and it looked like apple sauce more or less. Keurig boasts that the cider is all natural with no artificial flavors or preservatives so I was curious. The ingredients however do list organic malic acid and Reb A, which is a stevia extract. I dislike any kind of substitute sweeteners, so that could be why the taste was off for me.For any Weight Watchers followers out there, each K Cup is 2 points because of the 20 grams of carbs.

This is just so good!  Half the bars are milk chocolate with 34% cocoa solids and half are dark chocolate (70%).  I started with the dark, of course, and it is heavenly!  I'm not very tolerant of the waxy, sugary supermarket stuff or of the slightly stale taste some higher-end chocolates get but this was really good.  The ginger bar has a real ginger taste.  The cherry has cherry bits.  Another nice thing is that while the bars are 80 calories each, they are scored into little squares so it's easy to eat a smaller portion.  I'm going on line to see if they sell them in bigger packages.  This is what chocolate should be!

I actually made this purchase for the grimm prospect of having a few weeks without ability to purchase milk at a store-not totally a prepper but my family depends on me to provide.  Have a slim amount of products I have purchased for the chance of severe weather or stores closing for a few weeks.  Add this nifty product to some home canned potatoes or coffee (whatever) and you have milk in minutes.  Not the boxed version we are all familiar with. Nope-this stuff is rich and flavor packed with zero SOY.  Ha ha on me for being prepared for the future-it came earlier due to my work schedule and lack of time to go shopping. First morning no creamor milk in the fridge and have to pull this out- really rich creamy coffee- happy-Next dinner everything ready to go and there is the milk issue for a ingredient i didnt have on hand-mixed this with some water- and yep, its that good no one could tell the difference.I put water in a jar-some of this magic and shook-had enough to last for a few days and not to worry about spoilage.  Im so so happy going back to get a few more cans and never worry about running out of milk for meals again.
summary: Wowie Zowie this stuff is good and never made it for its intended use

reviewText: Well, let me start by saying that I love to cook. I am fanatical about different variations in my cooking to help spice up meals a bit. I find that I can use the Fischer and Wieser in a more variety of ways than I have been able to with other brands. You have to try it with oil and vinegar in salad dressings (makes a wonderfully, light, flavorful vinagrette). I also like mixing it in cream cheese and using it on top of crackers (with fresh raspberries on top) and served in a tray full of mixed appetizers. The smoky and sweet taste is incredible. I have tried many other chipotles, but I really like the Fischer and Wieser brand better than the ones at my local Stop and Shop. Get this when it's on sale on Amazon, get it delivered to your door within 2 days (with Prime) and you will be amazed of the versatile things you can do with it.
We use an air popper to make popcorn. This popcorn pops well and tastes great. Very pleased and will buy again.

This chili lives up to its reputation. For an even better taste, try this with refrigerated linguine instead of spaghetti. Be sure to use enough chili and add finely shredded cheddar cheese. Better than the original 3 way.

Love Nilla wafers, especially if they are fresh.  You would know yourself, if you were my age, that nothing tastes as good as it was in our younger days.  These have changed quite a bit as well.  The flavor is not as good and everytime I have bought them lately they are not a golden brown, they are more blonde.  I needed bulk in the vanilla wafers so I bought this thinking ok, the double box will do.  Needless to say, they were as usual, blonde and really soft.  They must have been on the shelf too long or in a damp warehouse.  I could not use then as I had intended.  The date on the package is still good for quite awhile.  They are still sitting in my pantry.  I think the next time I use them, I will spread on a cookie sheet and stick them in the oven to toast them up a little and then see what they taste like.  I will possibly try another brand next time I buy.
this is the only peanut butter i really like. it's sweet and chewy and has that great skippy flavor and no transfats.

I bought this to add to bread and to make seitan with.  It worked well for the bread, but my seitan just never seemed right.  It would still be lumpy and tough after kneading and never lived up to my expectations.  I figured I was kneading or cooking it wrong.  Once I used up all 8 boxes of Hodgson Mills, I ordered Bob's Redmill brand.  Woah!  Now my seitan comes out exactly like it is supposed to, and my whole wheat breads come out softer and more flexible than before.  I don't know if my case was defective or what, but I would not buy this brand again.

Wow! When they say its good, they weren't kidding. Even though its not  like the local honey from here in Texas, you can tell that its a much stronger type. The pollen count is way up there and the taste is very unique. I've been mixing it with a teaspoon of cinnamon powder which really brings out the flavors. If you never have tried this type of honey, you really need to.

This so-called Saffron "threads" is closer to being sawdust than threads.  It has no aroma when opened, crumbles to almost dust when taking a pinch out, and adds nothing to the taste except for a taste of staleness, and nothing to the color. Simply not worth the price or the effort--don't waste good food by adding this floor dust.
Beware!! what they are not telling you is that the stuff is so high in corn syrup that's it's candy -- not food.amazing that the nutritional info leaves out the ingredients!
Sorry Tasty Bite. Too much salt. Not enough Masala taste to keep my interest. I'm not a future customer of you products..

I really like this soup.  It is fast to prepare.  I just use my coffee maker for the water and just pour the water in the bowl with the instant miso and stir and cover the dish for about 2 minutes and it ready to eat. I use a real Japanese Bowl with lid to prepare this soup.
I don't know a single person that likes these things.  Why do they keep making them, and who the hell is buying them?

This is the second batch of vital wheat gluten I have ordered. I make a lot of homemade wheat bread and pizza and I find that adding this to it makes all the difference when cooking with whole wheat flour.
summary: Great for cooking with whole wheat flour

reviewText: We love this salt and it has a very good flavor.  We really think it tastes better than regular table salt.  We have been using for a while now and I can't imagine going back to the old stuff.
summary: Very good salt with great taste

reviewText: I have been using Stevia for several years now.  I occasionally try something new, but always go back to my stand-by.  Not any more!  This is very concentrated.  I use 1/8 tsp in 12 oz water and get just the right amount of sweetness.  Previously I was using 1/2 tsp for the same volume of water.  The other one states it is cut with fiber so that you don't use too much.  Well, this version shows just how much fiber I was getting--I suspect it was rather profitable.  Considering the different amount required, this is significantly cheaper.  I poured this into a jar I had (in the sink) and very fine dust seemed to go everywhere, even though I was careful.  I couldn't see it, but I could sure taste it.  An interesting experience to say the least.

We tried these King's Hawaiian Rolls for the first time the other night. We were told that they made great buns for pulled-pork and pulled-chicken sandwiches. They were everything we hoped they would be. Not only were they fresh, but their slightly sweet taste worked well with the barbecue flavor of pulled pork and pulled chicken. Of course, they're rather small, and so the sandwiches were fairly small as well. (This simply gave me an excuse to have several sandwiches.) I'd highly recommend these both as a dinner roll and as a sandwich roll.

So cakes are exempted from VAT in the United Kingdom? Geezus, that's dangerous. I can eat three packages of Jaffa cakes in one sitting, so the statement that this three-pack will "keep the entire family busy for a while" is clearly about somebody else. A normal British family, perhaps?If I ever become a "doomsday prepper", I'm gonna stash Jaffa cakes for at least one year in my mountain cabin AND DO WHATEVER IT TAKES TO STOP LOOTERS AND MARAUDERS FROM ENTERING THE PREMISES.And I'm not talking VAT exemption here, kids. :-0Five stars? You'd betcha!
Normally I love these, but the last batch I got tasted like they had been burned.  Yuck!  I don't know if it was just that batch or what, but I don't think I will be buying these again.

These Cheez-Its offer a slightly more mellow taste and a great degree of portability packaged into these unique cups. While the Cheez-Its are sealed with a pull-tab piece of foil, there is also a removable lid up that you can use to reseal the cupholder compatible package when you're done snacking.I have always enjoyed rice cheddar flavors on rice cakes, and I believe it translates well to these snacks also. I would prefer it to the traditional Cheddar variety. These are very convenient and more than tasty enough for a mid-afternoon snack session.
summary: Slightly More Mellow and Very Portable

reviewText: Would recommend giving this a try if you are a tea lover. It was a nice surprise with no aftertaste like some have.

This is an interesting bar - not like anything else out there. I don't really like oat or soy based bars, so this was an interesting substitution to a granola bar. It is kind of like all natural snickers bar without chocolate coating. It is chewy, not dry at all. It is less sweet than other bars I've had - it is still 9 grams per bar, but you don't taste it that much. I think it is because they overdid on salt. It is high on sodium - 230 mlg per bar. And I did find it salty. Wish they reduced sodium on half - then it would be my new favorite bar!

Before opening the Jamba Juice I went to the website mentioned on the can.  It appears that the company is a juice bar in California that is in the process of franchising.  They normally make smoothies and this drink is produced by NESTLE and is not a normal product of Jamba.It is 70% real fruit juice with carbonation and a natural sugar substitute added.  The flavoring is from puree which is an interesting concept, while the juice is mostly apple and lemon from concentrate.  The sweetener is from "extract of stevia" a natural sweetener (per Nestle).  The caffeine is supposed to be natural for whatever that means (maybe it's what they remove from naturally decaffeinated coffee).The two things that are good about it, besides the juice and puree, is that is has a slight carbonation and no sugary taste.  It does have a slight aftertaste but that may be the puree.  All in all not bad.Zeb Kantrowitz
summary: At Least it Has Real Juice in it

reviewText: Love these noodles.  Buy them in bulk and save save save.  Nice taste and texture... they came unbroken and ready to cook so excuse me, that's what I'm just about to do!  Enjoy!  Wide and wonderful... just like in the restaurant.Y U M M Y!All you low-carbers are so jealous! ha ha.

After trying several brands it was a delight to find this product.  Real, quality oatmeal in an instant.  Taste and consistency seem much better when microwaved vs. when made with hot water.  I find 1 1/4 cups of water with 2 packs of the oatmeal is ideal.  Adding some Trader Joes freeze dried raspberries or strawberries is a winner
summary: Finally found a really good instant oatmeal

reviewText: This is my first try on Psyllium husks. I am still learning different ways of using it beside putting in my smoothie. It has neutral taste. It gels up fast. Suppose to help lower cholestrol.

So far I've only tried the Orange Tangerine flavor and it's pretty good overall.  It does have a tangerine taste to it, though it's accompanied by other flavors.  It's clearly much more natural than regular soda or those 10% juice drinks since it's just fruit juice concentrates and carbonated water vs. the typical high fructose corn syrup plus artificial flavors, colors and preservatives in something like Sunkist.  I think the juice blend is appropriate for this type of beverage.  It does contain more apple and grape than tangerine or orange, but those first two juices complement the carbonation well viz a viz sparkling cider.  I think straight carbonated orange/tangerine juice would probably be a bit much.  The Switch reminds me of Appletiser, which is one of my favorites and has been around for many years, but is still pretty hard to find in the US.That having been said, I had to dock one star for a couple of reasons.  First, the cans just seem too small.  If they're sticking with aluminum cans, I'd like to see the standard 12oz size offered.  It seems like that would also have the advantage of making it easier to offer in regular beverage vending machines.  Alternately, 16 or 20oz bottles would also work.  The second issue is the price.  While I understand there's a huge difference between the cost of real juice and artificially flavored corn syrup, the current price still seems high, even in comparison to other juice drinks.  That might be partly because it's from a relatively small company that doesn't yet have the giant economies of scale that the likes of Coke and Pepsi can take advantage of, but it still seems like the price could come down a bit (or at least serving size could increase without a price increase) and it could perhaps still be made back up in increased sales volume.I pick up Appletiser when I can find it, and I'll likely do the same with The Switch, at least from time to time.
summary: Very good, could be a bit better.

reviewText: Better Than Bouillon is a line of "concentrated paste food bases" that includes three vegan options: vegetable, beef, and chicken (or rather "no beef" and "no chicken"). The "not bouillon" comes in small, 8 ounce jars and requires refrigeration after opening. You use the paste much the same way you'd use bouillon - there instructions for use on the jar - but according to the manufacturer, the paste is supposed to result in a "richer and more natural flavor" than one can get from bouillon cubes.I've bought a jar of each to sample, but thus far have only tried the chicken flavor (to make vegan chicken noodle soup - of course!). While the broth is indeed delicious, I can't say that I prefer it over the vegan bouillon cubes I normally use (namely, Edward & Sons and Rapunzel brand, though I'm still shopping around). Since it comes in a semi-liquid form, it's also messier and less convenient to use than a traditional bouillon. From an environmental perspective, the jars mean more packaging and greater use of resources in shipping.On the positive side, none of Better Than Bouillon's vegan options contain palm oil, whereas both Edward & Sons and Rapunzel do. So bonus points for that!Use it to make vegan soups, gravy, rice, seasoned veggies, pasta sauce - whatever your heart (or tummy) desires. Just be sure to recycle that glass, people!
summary: Yummy yet messy! But no palm oil, yay!

reviewText: The flavor of the coffee is nice, but the fact that each of the 3 cups that I have prepared have resulted in grounds in my cup leaves me disappointed in this product.  I also have to clean the Keurig as a result.  The foil seals seem to pop when I close the cover.  They look just fine when I place them in the machine.  It's not worth ordering these again.

I purchased these for a friend who loves shortbread and has highly discerning tastes.  I think he inhaled them, so apparently they're excellent.  They also arrived the next day with Prime and in perfect, unbroken condition.Thanks, Amazon.
summary: A gift that went over very well

reviewText: It is a great tea hot or cold and has a great flavor.  Try it you will love it too.

I like tea. I like cute metal tins. I think a cute metal tin is a very good way to store tea. This is a very nice thing to arrive in the mail. It cheered me up a dreary winter day. I enjoyed the tea and the tin, and it put me in a very good mood for the rest of the day.I suggest you order this item and send it to somebody who needs a gift. Chances are, it will make them feel... happy.
summary: A little gift to give you a lift

reviewText: Another flavor my husband loves....try them all.......................prices average out cheaper than supermarket and they carry many more selections than supermarket.

Because of the minimal packaging I didn't expect much or even for the cups to work as well as the usual ones.  I pleasantly surprised at the excellent flavor of the coffee and the way the cups stood up to brewing. This is a very dark roast, not for the timid coffee drinker. It would do well as an iced coffee due to it's rich, bold flavor - hmmmm, not a bad idea, I think I'll try it right now!

If you love mint, then you will like this tea.  If you only like mint as an added flavor note, then this may be a bit too intense for you.  I enjoyed the flavor.  I had not had mint tea before, but I love lots of different teas.  I was surprised at how much it reminded me of eating food with chewing gum in your mouth if you eat anything with it.  I like mine sweet and it isn't bad with lemon if you like it that way.  The mint is dominant and strong, so it may not be suited to all tastes.  I didn't really get an energy burst from it, so I can't really comment on how that feels.  I probably wouldn't regularly buy it, but it isn't bad.  If you like mint, give it a try.
This suger free cider is great.  It has good flavor without the "sugar free" after taste.  I like all the Grove Square products so far.

I love peach tea and this Stash Peach Black Tea is my favorite. The peach flavor is very natural and in just the right amount.I once passed up this delicious brew in favor of green tea's antioxidant properties until I discovered that black tea has its own equally impressive health benefits. Recent studies have concluded that regular consumption of black tea improves blood vessel function and significantly reduces the risk of stroke, heart attacks and heart disease (by fifty percent), and can help fight cancer and manage diabetes. This is because:*Black Tea contains flavonoids that help to lower low-density lipoprotein (LDL) or 'bad' cholesterol that can lead to strokes and heart attacks.*Black Tea contains the antioxidant polyphenols theaflavins and thearubigins, which have significant cardiovascular benefits.*Black Tea contains a chemical compound known as TF-2 that can help prevent breast and stomach cancer by killing cancer cells through a process described as "apoptosis programmed cell death".*Black tea contains high levels of glucose inhibiting polysaccharides that are helpful in managing diabetes.Studies have also found that black tea drinkers have less cavities and plaque accumulation on their teeth because chemical components in black tea called tea polyphenols suppress the growth of cavity-causing bacteria and prevent the formation of the matrix material by which dental plaque adheres to tooth surfaces.So, needless to say, I now regularly drink and enjoy my Stash Peach Black Tea and feel really good about doing so!I use 6 bags to brew a 12 cup automatic coffee pot full of this tea. I sweeten it with stevia packets and it tastes wonderful hot or cold.NOTE: The health benefits of black tea mentioned above are the results of a 15 year study by Netherlands National Institute of Public Health and the Environment, a four month study by Dr. Joseph A. Vita at Boston's School of Medicine, a study of over 3,000 people in Saudi Arabia where black tea is preferred to green, research conducted at the Rutgers University, research conducted at Tianjin Key Laboratory in China, and a study at the University of Illinois at Chicago College of Dentistry.
summary: HEALTH BENEFITS OF BLACK TEA; delicious peach flavor, natural...

reviewText: My sweet tea drinkers assure me this is a fairly good quick brew tea, but they can't shake the overly sweet and unpleasant after-taste. The general view was that this tea suffers from the quick brew method of K-Cups and probably has to many chemical flavoring elements in it. One trick that separated the really don't like it peeps from the It's all right group: Those brewing the K-Cup directly on ice didn't like the taste while those who added the ice after brewing were more happy with it. Maybe a good deal at 35 cents a unit, but one to avoid at nearly twice that price.

I was attracted to this item mostly because of the cool tin, which can be used for storage after the tea bags are used up.  The tea itself is fairly ordinary -- not bad... just undistinguished Lipton English Breakfast tea.  My wife keeps a variety of teas in the house, so I thought she would be happy to add this one.  However, she was disappointed by the routine flavor.  She said there a lot of other types she prefers.I drink tea rarely -- I'm a coffee guy -- so I am far from a connoisseur and defer to my wife in evaluating this product.  Like many foods, tea has its fans who know what they like.  I tasted a cup of this tea myself, and thought it was fine, but I don't have a wide basis for comparison.In any case, the tin makes something mundane seem much more interesting.  It makes a nice gift, though folks who enjoy tea might find the taste of this one kind of bland.
summary: The tea is so-so, the container great!

reviewText: this is just the same as the regular splenda as far as taste & there is no way you will ever know if the extra is really working or not. It is nice to have it in the little packets so it's fresh when you add it to your coffee or tea. I don't bake with splenda as everything I've tried with it goes flat when you use splenda instead of regular sugar, even if you use half regular sugar & half splenda.
This sauce tastes very fresh and I don't have to make it from scratch since I've found scarpetta brand.  Try it - you'll like it.

I received these downrange to help break up the monotony of the same food over and over.  It did not work.  However the food was packaged perfectly, tasted as they should, and was (as always) a cheesy goldfish.

I used to occasionally buy the Crystal Light Sweet Tea product in the summer, but the Aspartame (Nutra Sweet) Sweetener in Crystal Light would always give me headaches. The CL powder tasted kind of fake tasting to me and a little too strong.  MIO Sweet Tea, on the other hand, is a pleasant tasting liquid with good sweet tea flavor without being too sweet or strong/harsh tasting, like the CL powder.  I also like the fact that you can just slip it in to your drink without having to make an entire pitcher of the stuff.  Very clean, sweet(but not sickly) tasting tea, and there's zero calories per serving!

I love everything about this drink.  It's got plenty of carbonation.  Even without added sugar or artificial sweeteners, it's plenty sweet, without being too sweet.  I LOVE tangerine, and this has a very tangerine-y flavor and aroma.  If you love oranges or tangerines, this is the perfect drink for you.I ordered this from the Vine program out of curiosity, but it will be one of my "must buy" items in the future.  I'm also going to buy some for my grandchildren.  Since it has no added sugars, and I know they'll love it, it will be perfect for them.

These are the best canned tomatoes I have tasted. They have a fresh flavor, similar to home-canned. This is my second time buying a set. They are a little more acidic/bright, and have a rounder flavor than other tomatoes. Comes with a basil leaf in each can. Note, the 28 oz tins are a better value than the 14 oz ones.

When I brought the box in from outside it got my labs attention right away. Good smells were coming from that box. I opened it, took two chicken pot pie treats out (same shape of course, you have to be fair) and they both assumed the "Oh boy..we get a treat position." No doubt about their reaction. They loved them!I love the natural ingredients as my boys are my furry kids and I want them to eat healthy. Also am impressed by the donations to charities Cloud Star gives. Very awesome.Thanks for a great product. Will be ordering more.
summary: Always exciting at my house when a new dog treat arrives!

reviewText: Love this pure, raw, organic honey... For lab analysis of pollen in honey refer to the link provided in the comment section.DANDELION: I consume dandelion all the time since it is a superfood to me and I have to travel all the way to a store every single time to purchase few bunch of those beauties since it is a rare green not sold in most US counties. One cup of raw dandelion offers me 112% vitamin A and 535% vitamin K, shocking amount of health in raw stage, a competition to kale but not popular due to its bitter taste. In some of the trails that I hike and mountain bike, there are huge branches of dandelions and luckily most people are not familiar with dandelion so I end up with happy, healthy, wild greens when working out in the mountains but that happens only spring time since when rains stop and heat moves in, dandelions dry out till next season of rain. Healthy, healthy, healthy food. Dandelion is a weed which originated from Asia, China/India centuries ago. It is a superfood since as a green vegetable it is loaded with unbelievable amount of vitamins. Dandelion grows in many gardens as well as grass, a beneficial weed for gardens and nature, its taproot bring up nutrients for shallower-rooting plants, add minerals and nitrogen to soil and release ethylene gas which helps fruit to ripen. Dandelion attracts pollinating insects, especially for northern hemisphere bees, providing an important source of nectar and pollen early in the season. In Europe especially Germany, dandelion is used in herbal medicine to treat infections, bile and liver problems.REAL HONEY: Raw honey is expensive. USDA organic honey is more expensive than just even organic honey without the stamp of USDA. To combine RAW and USDA organic and add qualities like Only 100% pure raw, unpasteurized, unfiltered, undiluted, untreated, unprocessed, no HFCS, not adulterate, not blended with other items such as corn syrup and rice syrup, makes it the true honey not glucose tasting like honey. For that reason that superior product, that superior superfood never sells in big buckets, or hardly ever in any container over 16 oz jar.FILTERING: At country's top honey packers, Dutch Gold, in Lancaster, PA, raw honey gets pumped through layers of white filters. Before the honey hit the filters, a powdered sedimentary rock called diatomaceous earth is added. This is a standard, widely used process. It removes all the pollen, along with dust, bees' wings, and, of course, the diatomaceous earth.ORGANIC HONEY: Organic honey doesn't go through nearly as fine a filter since organic rules prohibit the use of diatomaceous earth in the filtering process but regardless it is not a raw honey just because organic.VARIETY: Weather, location, flower type and season impact the coloring, taste and viscosity of honey produced by bees. Honey by the cost will hardly even crystallize. Tupelo sold by YS is raw although runny and pourable which will not crystallize due to its high moisture content. If from outside of US then Fair Trade stamp has some assurances of fair treatment of workers although not true in every case.CHINESE HONEY: Chinese honey famous for "ultrapurified," a technique that can involve diluting honey with extra water, running it through extremely fine filters, and then removing the water. The process filters out much more and produces a sweet substance that is no longer honey. The process removes any pollens and the possibility of identifying the source of honey. Chinese honey is barred from the U.S. not because it's unsafe, but because U.S. officials decided it was too cheap. Chinese honey has had more than its share of safety problems. But there's also plenty of perfectly good Chinese honey for sale on the world market. EU is fussier about honey quality than the US, yet EU imports lots of honey from China but not US.QUALITY: A honey is only as good as the producer and regardless of all marketing and claims by sellers, there is no assurance that a jar of honey is full of pollen, unheated or unfiltered at 100 degree instead of 130 degree. Even if the honey was heated only to 90 degree at the time of production, the honey jar could be sitting in a storage or while being transported in containers that the temperatures can easily exceed 100 degrees. The only assurance that I have is purchasing honey from a producer with high quality reputation and a seller with high turnover. Wedderspoon brand and New Zealand are on top of my list. Purchasing Wedderspoon directly from Wedderspoon or authorized distributor is the only assurance I have for proper storage, pollen and enzymes that honey is consumed for.USES: I consume honey not by labeling but by the amount of pollen it carries. Only 100% pure raw, unpasteurized, unfiltered, undiluted, untreated, unprocessed, no HFCS, not adulterate, not blended with other items such as corn syrup and rice syrup from only trusted brands. I consume honey all the time since it has many nutritional benefits for me. I consume after any meal since it helps digestion. I used to consume chocolate years ago but I do not anymore since I consume pure cocoa which I add to my power drinks. I am into many sports and quality honey is the best quick energy I can get to boost my immune system and give myself a healthy rush of energy when I am in middle of my mountain biking, hiking, backpacking, surfing, etc. I drink lots of tea and I never use honey instead I use molasses. Molasses does not lose its nutritional value when heated but any heat to raw honey kills the quality enzymes and pollen in honey so I only consume honey straight out of the jar with spoon in moderation due to its high calories. Honey is the best ointment for all my scabs in mountain biking trails. After a day when my wounds are sealed I place raw honey for rejuvenation and it is the best healer of all instead of using Neosporin which loosens the scab and removes the scab, leaving scars on my skin. Bravo.

This coffee is tastes really good, but is not the best I've ever had.  Starbucks and several other brands taste as good or better and cost less.  If you're concerned about packaging waste, however, this may be a good coffee for you.  Instead of pods that are fully encased in plastic, these pods have a paper top, and the bottom is just a heavy coffee filter.  No plastic that I could see.  They worked very well in my Keurig and there were no grounds in my coffee.So, I really like the coffee and would definitely buy it again if the price were more competitive with other brands.
summary: Tastes great, but way too expensive.

reviewText: This order came very quickly.The butternut squash is out of this world delicous---creamy, and so tasty you can eat it out of the can. I use it as a veggie, as a topping for some grains and gluten free pasta (as I'm allergic to tomatoes), and to make soups. It doesNOT have a canned taste but tastes like a fresh product. I'm one happy customer!
This is a great mainstream GF product, they taste just like normal BC cookies. The dough looked like normal dough. They turned out great.The product does contain soy for those that are intolerant.
Can not buy locally, My husband and I both like it.  We use reusable pods for our Keurig and save money.

I'm Mike and I really love hamburger helper.I have tried other "look alike" products, but few measured up to the original. But Kraft may have exceeded it with their Velveeta Ultimate skillets line.There are several things I like better with this product.One, it uses larger macaroni and they hold more cheese sauce on the inside.Two is the cheese sauce itself. Not a powdered mix, but a foil-packed Velveeta cheese that you add at the end of the preparation. This also means you don't have to worry about the cheese burning during cooking, which in turn means easier clean up.As to cons, could use more macaroni for my taste, but that is easily added in.Overall, an excellent product and I will definitely be trying some other flavors as well.
Very good coffee.  If you prefer stronger coffee think you will love this!!
summary: Very good coffee. If you prefer stronger coffee think you ...

reviewText: A little drier tasting than beef jerky sticks, and also more salty.  Very salty.  Someone else mentioned a gamey taste, I'd agree except that I didn't think it was too much.  I wouldn't like these if I wanted to eat them frequently, but I'm more like once a week or two.  Good for that, for me.
Good flavor
I love the taste, but it's almost impossible to get it to dissolve in milk. Really only good as a topping. It's also very expensive because the bottles are very small. (15oz.)
summary: Great taste, but too thick for making chocolate milk.

reviewText: It smelled good, I thought this could be good as I brewed my first pot of this Coffee. I wanted it to be good, but after the first few sips I got bitter after taste. The idea of it is good, French Roast is usually sweet and tasty. This has this bitter undertone, not sure if that has something to do with the removeal of acidic properties. Also it's pretty expensive for it not to taste like a fine brewed coffee. Overall I don't think I could pay for this, even though I like the idea of a less acidic Coffee. Maybe if they could lose the bitter taste, but after two pots of it that taste is prominent. So a no go for me.

Lipton always puts out decent tea.  So I knew the tea would be fine.  But I was excited about the tin.  Would it be worth picking up?Definitely.  The tin is very cool.  Has retro artwork from old Lipton tea art.  It's sturdy enough and can hold a lot of tea bags.  My only complaint would be it would've probably been a lot more pleasing to the eye if they had made the tin in another shade other than yellow.  It kind of mutes the colors on the different art panels.Still though, not bad for the price, it's reusable, and you get a plethora of tea included.  What's not to like?

reviewerName: Book Sake "A Book Review & Contests Blog"
reviewText: Lots of oatmeal in each packet.  It seems like its double the amount that is in a regular instant oatmeal packet.  It tasted really good, was just a lot.  It's very filling because there is so much.  I really would have liked to split each meal in half, but that was difficult to do in the way that it's made.  Really quick and easy to make using the Keurig.  For the calories and sugar in each packet, I would rather eat my protein bar for breakfast than this.
Since I first purchased my coffee maker, I have enjoyed this coffee 'cup'. Great flavor made easily and fast! Keurig is a great product!

I read the ingredients and this is a nutritious and high fiber product. As expected the muffins and pancakes are not light and fluffy, but that's due to not being a refined flour. I find this to be exactly what I expected and easy to bake with (just be sure you have baking powder on hand). I've experimented with the muffins and find them to be the density of the bran muffins you might find at the store. There is a grainy undertaste but it's not a bad taste--just not white flour. I will use this product again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a healthier baking product or who is trying to eat a lower carb diet (it's good for diabetics too).

I've ordered from this seller twice now. My nuts always come packaged perfectly. I like the taste of the raw macadamias. They are delicious! There's a definite difference between these and the salted, roasted, etc. macadamias you find in the stores. My bag is almost empty so I'll be ordering again soon!

I've been using the regular Splenda for quite a while now. The Splenda Essentials No Calorie Sweetener with B Vitamin enhances your desire for sweetening without the guilt, it is after all, calorie free and packed with B vitamins. With a strong family history of diabetes, Splenda has been a great supplement to compliment your daily diet with whatever needs sweetening but doing it safely without the fear of over consuming sugar. I highly recommend this product especially so that it now comes as a no calorie sweetener.

reviewerName: Nathan M. Rose "Movie Guy from FlickDirect"
reviewText: These energy boosting products really never work for me, but I figured I would give this a try.  Again, I was let down because no boost was given, and the taste really left a lot to be desired.
summary: Does not really do the trick

reviewText: I like the flavor of this chocolate- a lot, actually. I'm not sure I'd agree with the makers assertion of "notes of red fruit, cherry and raisin, with a hint of vanilla", but there's a lot going on here. It's not a particularly rich flavor like I've found in other high end chocolates, though. I'm generally a fan of Scharffen Berger, but I just don't get a lot more complexity from this bar than from other Scharffen Berger bars.  Like another reviewer, I'd give these bars a A+ for use in baking, or melting over ice cream and other desserts, but as an eating chocolate I'd have to say there are others I find more interesting.

I have tried the blackberry, raspberry lime and this one. I am not a huge grapefruit fan but this is very refreshing with just a hint of grapefruit. I don't discern the mango. I also like the blackberry. If you like hint water then give this one a try...very good!!
summary: One of the best Hint waters

reviewText: It's cheap, it's organic, and it's Clifford! I pack these in my son's lunch every day, and on the weekends he thinks he's getting a treat if he gets one. Clifford juice is great! I like the fact that it isn't too big. My son gets a (reusable) bottle of water every morning, and he does not drink sodas unless he steals some from my friends. I don't like him getting empty calories, and most juice is just that. This has some nutrients but isn't too large. He gets a little sweetness, but not too much. I have this on subscribe and save, so it's even cheaper.

This was one Mayo that didn't have soy nor canola, all reports show it was firm, great taste and a good mayo. all report showed that other buyers like the product too. I have found that it has a great tasting mayo and I do like it very much.
summary: This mayo is Gluten Free with no soy, no canola

reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by this oatmeal. It was tasty and very filling. Each portion is quite substantial (it consists of oatmeal, the "flavoring" in the K-cup and a large packet of apples, cranberries and sliced almonds) and sweeter than expected. I would suggest to the company to try mixing the dried oatmeal and the fruit and almond packets into one. It just eliminates an unnecessary step for consumers, but all in all it's no big deal.

I am afraid this tea does not have flavor of Earl Grey.  If you want to make a strong tea, the bitter taste will come out.  The tea smells wonderful in a bag, but somewhat its aroma went away once it brewed.
summary: The tea smells wonderful, but loses aroma once it brewed.

reviewText: this oil is good in cooking or in salad dressing....it adds a hint of nut flavor and aroma when you use it.....I really do love it!

My daughter has celiac disease, and to avoid contamination issues our house is completely gluten-free.  She needs to be 100% compliant with her diet so I figured the best way is to give her as much variety as possible.  The snickerdoodle flavor is amazing.  Crunchy, light,  sweet and it tastes just like a snickerdoodle!  Both my kids love them.
Taste pretty good. It was such a steal of a price i had to get it.  i love the just add water mixes! nice and fluffy as stated. will buy again
If you love cinnamon red hots, this is it in liquid form.I make iced tea; it is not for the faint of heart and very unique.

Tastes great, and I love everything from this company!  Expensive, but a great way to add super foods to your child's yogurt or shakes without them even knowing it.  I only use it for my son, so a bag lasts a few months.

I've always been a fan of whole grain bread, but I've had problems in the past with finding a decent whole grain cereal.  Whole grains don't need to be boring, bland, dry, or like cardboard, and Kashi has a knack for proving this.  I've tried many, many Kashi products and am consistently pleased with this one.This particular cereal has an interesting and satisfying mix of tastes and textures.  The currants have a nice snap to them when you bite into them, and they are very tart.  I happen to adore black currant, but I can see how the taste might prove a bit too tart for some.  If you're expecting a sweet cereal, you should probably keep looking.There are some nice, sizable chunks of walnuts mixed into the cereal, and they provide extra crunch and a nice nutty flavor, which contrasts well with the mild sweetness of the flakes.On the cautionary side, this cereal packs a considerable number of calories in a pretty small quantity.  While it is certainly healthier than most of the junk you'll find in the grocery store cereal aisle, it is still worth noting that, if you don't pour carefully, you could end up with a breakfast of a hefty number of calories.I've checked the price of this cereal at a couple of different local stores, and it is considerably cheaper for to order it via Amazon.  I think the subscribe & save price is pretty much unbeatable.

I guess we got hooked on this mix for making burritos.  There are millions of packets of taco, fajita, chili, etc. out there, but only one McCormick's Burrito Seasoning.  It's not 'hot', you have to add your own hot sauce.  There is a distinct celery seed note here we really like. Impossible to find in the grocery stores any more, thank goodness for Amazon.
summary: Only this will do for us!

reviewText: This is the absolute best of the Kernel Seasons popcorn flavors. I have tried probably 10 or 12 flavors and this one is just about perfect if you like something sweet on your popcorn. It's basically sugar with a light vanilla/creme flavor. You can mix it in with your popcorn oil for an even coating, or just dash it on top of your bowl. If you are going to try just a handful of these flavors, make sure you get Kettle Corn.

The tea is excellent and the diamond fancy bags are nice.  I really am a big lipton tea drinker and I love English breakfast .  This is a very good one too.  I am still going to say that I prefer the regular traditional lipton bags.  And for the price you just cant beat it.  The reason I say that too is that I do not like the way the diamond bags leak a bit of tea but if that does not bother you, these are great!
summary: Great product in a new diamond shape.  Good flavor.

reviewText: Lorna Doone Shortbread Cookies are made by Nabisco, that great American maker of cookies and crackers. Nabisco (or National Biscuit Company) has been around since 1898, and the Lorna Doone cookies date back to 1912 - these are cookies your parents and grandparents probably grew up with.The cookies themselves are somewhat plain compared to what you might think of when you see the word "cookies." They don't have any candy chips, any chocolate coating, not even any raisins or nuts. Instead, Lorna Doone's are good old fashioned shortbread cookies - adult cookies that taste great with coffee or tea - not overwhelmingly sweet, and certain to please any palate.These are very good cookies, ones that you will not mind setting out for guests of any age or taste.
These suckers are some of the best candy around.  It's a perfect blend of caramel and sour apple.  Perfect for Halloween or any time.  We keep some in the house year 'round.
Twinings of London Tea Single Serve K Cups, Chai, 12 Count is my very favorite Chai tea.  I got it on "subscribe and save" so I won't run out since it's hard to find locally.
summary: Twinings of London Tea Single Serve K Cups, Chai, 12 Count

reviewText: This pasta sauce isn't that bad, but it also isn't that good.  My recommendation would be to add some garlic and onion (the amount of both is imperceptible in this product) as well as some basil and oregano.  It still won't be the best pasta sauce in the world, but it won't scream "I got this on sale!" anymore.
I use this every day.  I store mine in the freezer because it is already ground.  Having it ground makes my life easier.

I tried this when I thought I would give up dairy and found it on Amazon for a good price with the Subscribe & Save feature.  A friend had recommended the Light version for using in coffee as it is the consistency of milk and she was right.  I'd tried both a can of the regular and light and the regular is very thick--great for sauces, soups, puddings, etc. but not appealing for coffee.The cans came well packaged, boxed within another box, unlike other canned goods I've gotten from Amazon that unfortunately have arrived all dented.The one thing I want to point out is that this coconut milk DOES have guar gum.  Since I have eliminated additives like guar gum and carrageenan from my diet and am eating dairy again, I gave away the remainder of my cans of coconut milk to a friend.
summary: Great as a non-dairy coffee creamer, etc.

reviewText: It's a bit strange, mixing kimchi and japanese udon noodles. The noodles themselves are OK, they break up into about 1" sections during the first dosage of hot water. I tried not to avoid breakage with very little success. The overall taste is OK. I recommend just purchasing kimchi flavored ramen style noodles instead. I won't order another.

If you love granola/grain cereal, then this is a variety sampler pack for you. The four granola ('plain', banana-nut, cranberry-nut vanilla, blueberry) are pretty tasty in and of themselves - I was surprised by the bits of coconut that was in them, and the little hint of spice was a very nice touch. They're not as 'simple' as some other granola blends I've bought in the past, but that doesn't mean they're not relatively healthy/composed of a lot of crap fillers. Also, it's a nice grouping of different flavors, sure to please a wide range of palates.The bonus to this was the oatmeal and the pancake/waffle mix. Each one is a bit more than just the usual mixes you find out there on the market, and also come with a bit less of that 'crap filler'. They're also rather tasty as well.  All in all, there hasn't been any of this sampler pack that was a disappointment, and the small bags are nice in that it's easy to keep stuff on hand and not worry about anything going bad. You just may be disappointed if there's one item in particular that you really like.
summary: great granola (and then some) variety pack

reviewerName: Silvia Bridger "Publisher of The Truth About ...
reviewText: This gluten-free meal is quick , easy, and tastes great.  There are directions for stovetop or microwave cooking.

Maybe I'm just easy pleasing, but I enjoyed my Velveeta Cheesy Skillet meal. It's cheesy, hearty, filling, and satisfying. Yes, you have to add your own chicken, but I wouldn't want it any other way. Neither chicken in a can nor dehydrated chicken hold much appeal for me. I do wish there were more of a broccoli presence in this cheese dominated dish, and for a future meal we may add some.For someone watching calories carefully this may not be a meal of choice. The prepared dinner has a stated five serving size, though Mrs. Spudman (she of the canary appetite) and I finished off about four servings together. According to the figures on the side panel, one serving delivers 390 calories (100 from fat) 620 mg of sodium, and 8g of fat.For me this is a good tasting, easily prepared meal that hits the spot. Those eating two servings at a meal don't need to save too much room for dessert.

I have easily been able to incorporate this tea into my daily regimen of meditation and yoga.  It has a soft flavor and can easily be sipped without adding any sweeteners (although it tastes absolutely amazing with a bit of honey).  This has become my default tea to purchase.

I actually rarely use this to cook with as I don't care much for the taste but I use it for my skin as I have Multiple Chemical Sensitivity and I cannot tolerate lotions with many artificial chemicals or fragrance.  I rotate this with other things.
I've had these for about a week now and I've eaten most of the box to myself, they are really great! I will be ordering again soon.

I've been looking for these to appear on Amazon for a while because I like sardines in oil better than those in water.  The oil helps them slide down better and the oil gives a bit more flavor. I'm saddened to see they've used soy bean oil, I'd rather have them in sardine oil or olive oil; soybean oil is OK for printing inks and such but shouldn't be fed in any form to the unsuspecting public.  Oh, well, beggars can't be choosers.
summary: Sardines are Better When Packed in Oil

reviewText: With a formula of all-natural ingredients and a quite flavorful taste, GURU Energy Drink has carved a nice niche in this crowded field of products. The 8.3 ounce can is great to pack in a gym bag or satchel and certainly can be used during those stressful work days. And the cost for the case is certainly a huge plus.
summary: Gets yoU Ready for yoUr activities

reviewText: I've become leary of canned coffee drinks for good reason.However I did enjoy the illy line of canned, portable drinks. The size makes for a just-right and very effective afternoon pick me up. But the flavor really seals it for me. Not too sweet with a slight cocoa after taste.Definitely a fan.

We have begun eliminating corn syrup from the diet of our entire family, so it only made sense to eliminate t from formula as well.  This seems to be well-tolerated.We don’t use formula most of the time, so it is nice to have one that we can use on occasion.  We had no experience with this brand, but would certainly consider buying it again.

We are hot sauce fanatics.We buy hot sauce, and we make our own hot sauce from hot peppers that we grow ourselves too from habanero to jalapeno and quite a few in between.This Gringo Bandito Hot Sauce is a fantastic hot sauce.  The habenero adds that delicious twist, but the other heat is complex and interesting as compared to many other hot sauces.We don't find the heat too hot at all, but it is not mild.  I would say it is a mid range heat.  My family likes this so much, I have to hide the bottle or everyone fights over it and uses it up.  We have had it on eggs, salad, tofu, meat, chicken, and even in mac and cheese- a household favorite.I highly recommend this sauce and know it will be a top choice when we need more.
summary: My Family Fights Over This Bottle

reviewText: Read through the other reviews and you will find the same situation I had with the creamers. It does not arrive in the blue dispenser box that is shown, the 192 creamers arrive loose inside a cardboard box with no padding. Perhaps less creamers would burst during transit if the display box shown was wrapped inside a cardboard box. The box arrived completely undamaged on the outside.
