None appeared to have frozen during transit, it appears that the creamer singles pop during high altitude transit or perhaps when the box is thrown by the shipper or pressure is placed on the box. It is a sticky mess when it arrives. The creamer taste and convenience is great, but it is unfortunate that so many people have commented on this problem and Interational Delight has not fixed its packaging and shipping issue.

I admit it's me.  I just don't care for rooibos tea. The good thing was that this was a small enough container that I could try it by buying only one container.  Part of my problem is the fragrance ... which to me smells like dirty dish water and also reflects in the taste.  I mainly bought this for the peach flavoring and found very little peach taste.

I want to start by saying I didn't realize this was for premature infants so I was unable to use this. But I figured I would leave something useful. The price on Amazon with free shipping is the best price I could find after scouring the web for a half hour. Most other places it's "cheaper" but it isn't when you factor in shipping.  At the time of writing this review was just over $15 per container.One other thing when you ordering something like this getting it from a place like Amazon, somewhere you can trust is just a good idea.
summary: Amazon has the best price at just over $15 per container.

reviewText: Who doesn't love hot choc when the weather is cold glad they can out with the pods size only thing don't put your cup size on largest it will taste weak but other wise it's great.
I needed this oil for some recipes I recently was given, but was unable to find it in any stores I visited.  I was glad it was on Amazon

I took a chance buying 20 lbs of Great River Organic Corn Meal.  If we didn't like it, I would be stuck.  I'm so glad I did!  I've tried many brands of organic corn meal, and this one tastes so much better!  We are "cornbread connoisseurs" - we have cornbread (no flour) 2 -3 times a week.  I also add cornmeal to breads and pizza crust.  We love the taste of this cornmeal.  I cannot stress that enough.  After this 20 lbs is gone, I'm going to try the course ground.  I love it.  Thanks Great River Milling.  Please don't change this product.
summary: This is the best tasting corn meal I've ever tasted!

reviewText: This is great chips.  I love the taste of olive oil and rosemary.  They sprinkled a lot of rosemary in there.  I don't get tire of eating them.

I really love this coffee. It's got a great flavor but not so strong that you can't have it with other food. It's not super bold but not weak either, just right for me. I would highly recommend it to others looking for a great K-Cup and Amazon has a great price.

I stopped buying expensive (for me) Starbucks coffee and put away my Mr. Coffee after I received this item.  This order has lasted me years and the coffee is fantastic.  It's delicious, not weak tasting at all.  It's also convenient for cold drinks because you can just mix it into some milk with brown sugar.  It is also great in brownies and homemade ice cream.  I'm never going back to regular coffee (this is my first decaf buy.)  I am not a regular coffee drinker but I love not being tempted into buying Starbucks or fancy machines.
summary: I put away my Mr. Coffee.

reviewText: Act II Butter Lovers Microwavable PopcornCategory: Snack FoodsWhen looking for a warm, nutritious snack that is fun to share with your family, pop up some family fun with Act II microwave popcorn. 100% whole grain popcorn.Okay, I'll try it! *into My Shopping Cart it goes*Notes after trying Act II Butter Lovers Microwavable Popcorn:Fast and Easy!  Directions on outside of each individual popcorn bag are clear and concise.  Popping times will vary -- so, one can adjust length to whatever normally works for them. As for this review, I just pressed the preset Popcorn button on my microwave -- that I use for all popcorn bags of this size, and it worked out just fine.Popcorn kernels popped very fast and filled the bag with popped corn, with little room left over. I like that! The popped kernels are large and aesthetically pleasing. The aroma is hot buttery popcorn -- just like walking through the doors of a movie theatre. This is probably one of the best tasting microwaveable popcorns I've ever eaten. 'nuf said.Crisp, Tender and buttery, just enough salt, with very few un popped kernels left at the bottom of the bowl.Left overs store very well in air tight container. :)With the Holidays coming up, I'm going to need a lot more Act II Butter Lovers Microwavable Popcorn! 'nuf said.Does Act II Butter Lovers Microwavable Popcorn sound like what you may be looking for? :)  Highly Recommended! --Katharena Eiermann, 2013

I have tried a bunch of coffee from several companies many different brew types and Diedrich French Roast is the best tried so far. It has very smooth mouth feel, low acid, great flavor, and the coffee keeps its character as it cools. I would recommend it highly.Dave  F
I have to minimize how many she eats, because they are a bit pricey. I like them too. I put them in her lunch for snacks. So natural, so great.

It kind of tastes and smells like miso soup...or liquified collard greens.  It has the strangest flavor.  I'm not really a fan, but I'd drink it if I needed some kind of tea and this was all that was available.
It is amazing how much tea you get for the price. It is absolutely delicious and seems extremely fresh and well packaged.
This is nice soup, however 7 out of 8 cans were dented, many were seriously dented.I would only buy this on extreme sale because of the dented cans. I give the soup 4 stars and the cans 0 stars.
summary: Soup is good, cans are dented.

reviewText: I don't drink coffee, but want a "grownup" drink instead of the usual hot chocolate and soda. Herbal teas are OK, but there are times when I want something more like coffee. Pero fits the bill perfectly. Smooth, rich taste, mixes instantly in hot water, and makes a really good iced "cappucino" (recipe on the canister). My 6-year-old granddaughter loves it, too.Recommended for anyone who wants a good-tasting, non-bitter cup of "un-joe" any time.

Without the emulsifiers, this tastes less creamy and breaks crisper when bitten.  I like the flavor. However here is the missing allergen information:on the wrapper it says:Made in a facility that processes milk, nuts, soybeans or wheat.

Since my husband has celiac disease we are always looking for great gluten-free products.  This fits the bill.  It tastes just like original brownies and they are so easy to make.  Kudos to General Mills/Betty Crocker for finally creating products and re-formulating their cereals to make them gluten-free.
summary: A gluten-free product that tastes like the original!

reviewText: This bulk Rooibos tea was as expected, very aromatic and flavorful.  I use it to brew ice tea and blend it with the ASSAM Black bulk tea i bought from them.  Highly recommend this and Davidson's
summary: Another fine Rooibos tea from Davidson's

reviewerName: Amazon Customer "Holla if u hear me!"
reviewText: It's so delicious. Not overly sweet but very good. Love the fact that it is healthy and simple ingredients. Higher in calories than I would like but nuts are high in calories.

I was pleasantly surprised at how easy to prepare and tasty this is! The pasta comes out perfectly if you like it al dente (a little chewy). Now I tried adding water to make it softer but that's not worth the trouble and if you're not careful waters things down too much. The one issue I have is that I miss cheese!! It's probably healthier without it...but still... That's the one thing that keeps it from being the perfect workday lunch.
summary: Molto Bene! (Very Good!) But Not Perfect

reviewText: I have been drinking coffee, without cream or sugar, for about forty years. I purchase whole bean and grind and brew it fresh. This is a 'blend' so do not expect 100% Jamaican Blue. Last year, I did buy some 100% Jamaican Blue coffee beans at $35/pound. To be honest, I did not really care for the 100% Blue. Maybe the cost affected my taste buds. It is hard to describe taste. To me, this blend is mild and full of flavor as compared to many others. In the past year, I have gone through about fifty pounds of this and still enjoy it.I sometimes like to experiment with different types of coffee beans. The other beans by Magnum, that have comparable types in the local markets, have all been superior in flavor and similar in price to the available local brands. I would highly recommend any of the 'Magnum Coffee' types of coffee. This one is just my overall favorite.Ken
summary: This is my number one coffee

reviewText: YUMMY, YUMMMY WHAT'S TO TELL? SOFT AND DELICIOUS BUT VERY ADDICTING. IF YOU HAVE NO WILLPOWER IT WILL TAKE A DETERMINED WILL TO IGNORE THESE COOKIES.

I ordered these for my daughter so she could start off her school day with energy. This energy drink has a great, sharp coffee taste and is jam-packed with caffeine. I will say though that the first few times you drink it you might feel a little jittery feeling, but only if you're on an empty stomach.

You will definitely need good teeth to eat these cookies!  They are not just crispy.....they are almost like trying to bite into concrete.  I love Newman's products & wanted to love these organic ginger snaps, mainly because they are organic,  but they leave a lot to be desired.  I don't know if it was just the batch I received  or if they are supposed to be this way, but they are almost burnt.  The bottoms are very dark, almost black.  They also left a bad after taste that both my husband and & I noticed.  They just did not taste good.  They taste nothing like the flat ginger snaps of other brands.  I will not be buying these.......but still love other Newman products.

Our family often eats granola bars, especially ones that are high in fiber. I was happy to give this little bar a try. While cherry is not my favorite flavor, I kept an open mind when trying this bar. I do really love cashews, so I thought the combination might be interesting and tasty.  My husband an I both had a bite, and we both agreed it was too thick. It was not an enjoyable texture or flavor (even for my husband, who is a cherry fan). The cashew flavor was very subtle.  If you are a huge fan of cherry flavored bars, you may want to give this one a try. Unfortunately, for our family, we will not be trying it again.

As a fan of spicy foods, I was anxious to try out this sauce. The habanero is one of my favorite peppers, adding great flavor and heat. Unfortunately, this product diluted the habanero taste so that it wasn't significant at all.I tried this sauce as a cooking glaze and a dip with beef, chicken, and pork. If you're looking for sweetness, it adds a very pleasant flavor. Unfortunately, that's not what I'm looking for in a sauce that boasts habanero. The mango, honey, and apple flavors dominate this sauce. The ginger is also apparent, but not as pronounced. The poor, poor habanero is absolutely lost in the shuffle.Overall, this sauce is a pretty big disappointment to me. If it were advertised and marketed as a fruity sauce, I'd be much happier with the product. The company advertises this product as having "sweet heat". Well, it got half of it right.
summary: Couldn't Taste the Habanero at All

reviewText: Cranberry almond KIND bars are my favorite flavor.  The bonus is that they have a low glycemic index.  I give these as tips & gifts.  People are so appreciative because these bars are so healthy.  I keep a couple in my purse at all times - for me & to share.

While I like my coffee strong, I am slightly susceptible to acidic coffee - just not enough to have to seek out alternatives. If you are to that point, I would recommend this coffee as a good alternative, but if you are not quite to that point, this is not a substitute for great coffee. It's good enough to compete with the pre-ground mass-market coffees but doesn't match up to the more premium beans. It has a mild, nuttier flavor than I'm used to, and a hint of aftertaste comparable to a diet beverage.What confuses me is that the description claims this is a good choice for decaf drinkers looking for a more robust flavor. I'm not sure I agree with that, but what confuses me is: is this decaf or not? I didn't think so, but this claim makes it vague.20 minute later update: oops, definitely caffeinated... gotta run!

I thought the price for this amount of loose tea was awesome! I love drinking herbal tea and this was the 1st time trying this flavor from Davidson's Bulk Tea. I liked the favor of this tea overall. However, the reason I gave it a four star rating was because I felt it had a slightly odd aftertaste.

Say's it all.For a GF person this is the bread you're going to use.  Even though its the size of baby bread, it's the one that taste the best.  There are other bread companies out there that FINALLY figured out that using one grain doesn't do that job, it ends up tasting like cardboard.This bread doesn't.
summary: Best Bread since the creation of .... Bread!

reviewText: Perfect all around seasoning w/a little kick.  Goes great in pasta sauces, chili, dips, or anything else that needs some non-boring spice.

Not caring for regular tea or the caffeine, I drink herbal tea exclusively and am always on the lookout for fun new flavors.  This Blackberry Vanilla sounded delicious,, not a flavor combination I had seen before.  I should also mention that my true test for how well I end up really liking a tea's flavor is whether or not I need sweetener.  If I need it then the flavor is most likely too bitter for me.Out of the box, the tea bags have a bit of a dried flowers smell, not very fruity.  However, when it is brewing the fragrance is delicious!  The berries wake up, and the vanilla too.I tried this tea both hot and iced.  As a hot tea, the flavor was alright, but it was like there were too many herbs and not enough berries.  I did end up needing a bit of sweetener, as I felt the flavor was too earthy.  The vanilla was too subtle to detect.It was when I tried this tea iced that I found I really enjoyed it.  The cold seems to suit the berry flavors nicely, I can taste the vanilla, and I didn't need any sweetener at all.I have never cared for Lipton's pyramid tea bag packaging.  There is nothing protecting the tea bags inside of the box, such as a paper liner, and since the pyramid shaped tea bags are too awkward to be individually wrapped, it's just open tea bags sitting together in a paperboard box.  Also, the bags and string are some sort of plastic-like material, so I cannot put them in my compost bin.As an iced tea, I liked the Blackberry Vanilla.  But the flavor as hot tea and the less-than-desirable packaging keep me from getting excited about it.

I have always used the Royal product but could not find it in the case size so I thought I would try the Jell-O brand and it is very good and very easy to make. It is very tasty and the sauce on the bottom is also very good. I hope that people will try it. I will admit that it is not what a real Mexican flan is like but this is really good.

Granted, I am one of those people that often leans towards the healthy-looking pastas, so I was probably set up to enjoy this one.  Which I did, finding that even with the extra cooking time and definite "healthy" (thicker) texture this was an extremely tasty pasta that was surprisingly flavorful.  On that aforementioned texture, while it was a bit thicker, I found it leaning towards chewier rather than tough as sometime can happen with similar pastas.  The pasta cooked well, looked great with the accompanying sauce we made, and tasted great.  An impressive quality pasta with all the health benefits the box promises.

I love popcorn. I love carmel popcorn. I love chocolate.  Fudge drizzed carmel popcorn felt like a dream come true.  I truly enjoyed this product, it quite delicious.  It tastes more like eating candy than popcorn, though.  It had the crunch of popcorn, but seemed rather sweet and sugery. I almost would prefer a little more popcorn and a less sweet carmel so that I can get the real feel of eating popcorn.  To sum it up, it's good, but really on the sugery-sweet side.  More like a dessert rather than a snack.

Bunnery Natural Foods Pancake Mix Sampler are decent but the flavors are very light, to light in my opinion.  The worst one of them was the blueberry not because it tasted bad or anything but because the flavor was so light you would almost taste the blueberry then it was gone.The mixes are pretty straight forward.  They tend to be a little dry if you follow the directions so add a little more milk.  This will thin them out but the batter will go farther and they will be moister.  They are also not for those that have an issue with texture as the grains are not finely milled.  These really don't compare the the pancake at their restaurant but they are a good healthy alternative to the other mixes out there.

I have tried all of the flavors & this one is without a doubt, my favorite.  I wish they made it all year round.  It tastes amazing & only 150 calories for the entire pint. You can really taste the pumpkin & all the spices that bring out the pumpkin pie flavor in it. YUMMY!!

I was expecting so much.  Maybe because I'm a full leaf tea drinker I've gotten accustomed to a different chai taste.  This has a mild to medium spice to it, about a 4 on a scale of 1 - 10 (I also like a heavy spice in my chai but most people don't so I'm not holding the level of spice against it), but the spices don't fully taste like what the REAL spices should taste like.  At first it kinda does but then you realize it is not real.  Like comparing REAL vanilla extract to imitation.Then, to add to the chemical spice taste, it has artificial sweetener added.  Ok, I drink Coke zero, so it is not like I'm totally against fake sugars.  But this thing has a fake sweetener taste that REALLY lingers on my tongue.  And it is almost too sweet.  I usually put 2 - 3 teaspoons to a 8-10 oz mug of tea when I brew it full leaf.  So I do like my stuff sweet.  But this is almost an overpowering sweet taste.In all, there was nothing really redeeming about it.  I tried mixing one K-cup with some instant chai latte I picked up at the grocery store (which used real sugar and had no hydrogenated stuff in it, but barely had any chai spice flavor to it) but it didn't help.  The weird chemical tastes still overpowered.  Just not worth the time or money for me.Edited to add:I want to add that I'm not opposed to flavored products (either artificially or naturally flavored).  I pretty much only drink flavored coffees, and most of the teas available from places like the zillion dollar an ounce whole leaf tea places like the one whose name melds the words "Tea" and "Nirvana"  (which I shamefully admit to shopping at) are naturally/artificially flavored. So I wasn't being fussy about the flavor because they added artificial flavors in the ingredients and I was expecting something all natural.Side note on differences between artificial and natural flavors in ingredients: When something says naturally flavored in the ingredients or the side of the box, it just means the chemical they use has a real "counterpart" in nature, whereas an artificial flavor will not. So a flavor like blue raspberry will always be labelled artificially flavored, while a flavor like raspberry might say naturally flavored.  But, they both are flavored via lab produced chemicals. So as far as I'm concerned natural flavors are still an artificial product (unless actual oils are used, like Earl Grey Tea using bergamont oils). When I say this product has an artificially flavored TASTE I mean the taste TO ME does not taste like something in nature, even if it technically is trying to copy flavors (spices) that exist in nature. I hope I didn't confuse things more with my explanations.To Cafe Escapes' credit, there WERE some real spices (actual spices, not just spice flavoring) in there. This is evident because this is basically an instant powder they placed in a K-cup and the entire contents of the K-cup end up in your tea mug, so I notices some finely ground stuff spices in the mug after drinking.  So I applaud them for that.  At the same time though, there are lots of better quality instant mixes that one can just spoon into a cup and add hot water to that cost a fraction of these K-cups.  So that is why I believe this product truly isn't worth purchasing.Sorry for my ramblings, I hope I could help with what I meant in my review.  Feel free to comment with questions about other teas/products, etc you want my 2 cents on.
summary: Chemical taste that lingers on the tongue.  Not for people used to full leaf type teas.

reviewText: This is a nice, light sweet and salty snack. Tastes just like kettle corn without the mess that popcorn can sometimes be.
This product is good if you have young children who like snacks. I would highly recommend it. It's unfortunate that there aren't as many varieties though.

Love these noodles, and so do my kids. I usually add some chopped scallions or green onions and throw a handful of spinach in after microwaving to give some extra oomph! I live in an area where there is not a lot of options in the local grocery stores so being able to order this to my door is fabulous. I use the subscribe and save so that I get the savings and it's always in my pantry. A++

They are spot on, these things taste like paint.I had already purchased a couple of packs of this stuff, resting on myrespect for the Marie Callender brand of which I have always been a bigfan. However, As someone who grew up in the South eating real cornbread2-3 times a week, I'm actually offended that this krap made it out intothe consumer marketplace.I had decided to make two batches, one straight according to directions,and another with shredded cheese, jalapenos, and creamed corn. I couldhave saved some time and supplies if I had tasted the first batch beforeputting in the second. Not only does this stuff not have the consistencyof cornbread, it tastes like I said....like industrial drain cleaner.The batch of Mexican was also overwhelmed by the Draino-like characteristicof the mix. After sampling one muffin from each batch, my primary goal nowis to get through the evening without throwing up. Seriously, I wish I hadsome Ipecac cause I don't feel good at all.Marie, you make a mean Pot Pie, get out of the cornbread business before youkill somebody.

This tea has a great hint of chocolate. It isn't hot cocoa flavored or anything like that. But it is a nice hint of flavor added to the black tea. I like mine with a little milk or refrigerated coconut milk. Sometimes I stir in some chia. Sometimes I even add in this special kind of gelatin that mixes in and doesn't gel (I add it for some protein). Adding in all those things reminds me of when my mom used to make me chocolate Malt-O-Meal as a kid. It isn't as strong of a flavor, but it is reminiscent of it.I like to drink this tea any time of day. It's a comforting tea after a long day. I am not affected by the caffeine in it so I'll drink it before bed.You can leave the tea bag in while you drink it or steep and remove. I haven't found that oversteeping ruins the flavor.If you like black tea and would like a hint of flavor added in your cup, then try this chocolate pu-erh.

This is about as good as dry cereal gets. The freeze dried fruit has a realistic flavor and texture once reconstituted (by the milk most people add to their cereal). The course flakes have a rich, whole grain flavor and texture.This is a good low fat breakfast with 5 grams of protein per serving and 5 grams of fiber.However, the sodium (100 mg) and non fiber carbohydrates (41grams)are higher than necessary.If you want a more natural cereal, you would need to boil some steel cut oatmeal and add fresh fruit.
summary: Whole grain with very good dried fruit

reviewText: The kids are back to school, and I've been searching for good snacks to go in their lunchboxes.  GoGo Squeez provides about 1/3 cup of fruit in a unique pouch.  The kids love it, it's easy and not at all messy, and I know they're getting at least one serving of fruit in their lunch that they will actually eat before running off to the playground.The price on Amazon is comparable to my local store, and with subscribe and save it works out to be a few cents cheaper per pouch.My only dislike has been the amount of packaging involved - you get four squeezes to a box, and a whole lot of little boxes inside a bigger box.  Also, each squeeze has a fair amount of plastic packaging.  I know the applesauce cups do as well, but this just seems a bit wasteful to be carting around that much material for a 1/3 cup of applesauce.Apart from the above, I love these pouches and so do my kids, and I'll most likely order them again.

These capsules are excellent for a huge variety of health concerns. I have used with very good results. However, nowadays I am using Frontier Turmeric Root Powder which is available here on Amazon, is 100% pure, certified organic and you get 1 Pound for less money than these capsules. 1 pound of Frontier's Turmeric powder equates to more than 400 capsules. I stir in water and dissolves instantly.
summary: Excellent but now I use Turmeric powder

reviewText: If you are tired of having peanut butter sandwiches for lunch every day, try one of these Annie Chun's Peanut Sesame Noodle Bowls.  It is delicious and better yet, vegetarian.  The noodles are pre-cooked just right, not too soft, not too hard, topped with chopped peanuts and a tangy peanut sauce, just the way I like it.  However, the dried veggie flakes are just "decorative" and I didn't see any sesame seeds.  Annie Chun surely knows how to cook.  She has got another winner.
Great as a substitute for wheat flour. I use it in recipes for the paleo diet. Makes great muffins, yumm.

El Rio is a great cheese sauce. My local Sam's Club has a huge can of it but it would go bad before we used it all up. Glad to have found the small cans on ebay.  Sauce has just enough jalapenos to add flavor but not so hot that  kids can't eat it.

This bar would make a small dessert or substitute candy-bar snack for a dieter who is craving something gooey and decadent.  The bar seems to be mostly goo with little bits of crunch.  The mocha flavor was good, and a nice change from the usual bars of this sort.  The overall decadence was too much for me, but others may like this.  In order to keep the calorie count down, they are small:  3.25 inches long by 1 inch wide by 3/4 inch thick.  The bottom half is sort of like chocolate candy with crunch bits, the top layer is sort of like mocha frosting, and then there are chocolate stripes on top.I passed these around my knitting group.  One friend said they were better than Kellog's Fiber Plus.  Most liked the flavor, but they couldn't agree as on other attributes.  One said she would definitely eat it if she was hungry because it was natural, an attribute which others (including me) disagreed with.  They also couldn't agree whether they were nutritious or not, because they are low fat and high fiber.  In my mind they are empty-calorie carbo-bombs, with only 2 g of protein and 25g of carbs (3g sugar alcohols, beware; and 9g of fiber).  These may or may not fit into your nutrition goals, but if they do, you'll probably enjoy the flavor, but I'd rather eat a small piece of fine dark chocolate.
summary: Better than K's Fiber Plus, debatable nutrition

reviewText: I'm always hesitant to try healthier options in food that I truly love because I think there's no possible way that I'm going to like it anywhere near what I do the regular option.  I'm happy to say that I was very wrong in assuming that I wouldn't care for this pasta very much.  Not only did my family of 4 like it, but we loved it.  We were actually all in agreement that it actually tastes better than our normal regular Barilla pasta.It's nice to actually really like something that's quite a bit healthier for you.  This will be what I grab off of the shelves from now on.  Barilla has always been my brand of choice so now it's nice to know we'll be getting some benefit out of eating it.I would highly recommend the Barilla Plus line of pasta.

As an herbal tea drinker, I was excited to try Lipton's Blackberry Vanilla tea in the pyramid bags. When taken out of the box, the tea is slightly aromatic and pleasant to look at, as it is easily viewed through the pyramid bags. The string is lightly "glued" in a few places to the bag so there is no tangling and removal from the box is very easy.After brewing, the tea is a pretty reddish purple and has a nice aroma to it. The tea itself has a nice flavor - a sweet tart quality that is enjoyable both hot and cold. The vanilla has a nice undertone to the berries and there is an added depth and tartness from the flavor of the hips.One thing I was concerned about were the bags. Upon taking them out of the tea, they had not softened at all and had a tulle type of feel to them. I had tossed the first one in the compost and then noticed on my second cup that the bag just didn't feel biodegradable. I looked at the box and could not find any information about the bags, so I called Lipton using the toll-free number on the box. The customer service representative that I spoke with said that there should have been a recycling symbol on the box, however I did not see it. The bags are NOT biodegradable, but instead are RECYCLABLE as #1 plastic!!! This information brought my rating down a star. This is truly a delightful flavor tea, however I'm not thrilled about using plastic tea bags in hot water!!
summary: A tea to please the senses!

reviewText: As the title says, it is a good change from oatmeal and has a very good flavor.  The wife is going to try making cookies with this instead of Oatmeal...should be good.  Try it, you will probably like it.

I am avoiding soy, corn, and even wheat products because of concerns about the chemicals. I chose sorghum flour because it is more likely to be grown on small farms with fewer chemicals. Not sure how much healthier it is, so that is why only 4 stars. Bobs red mill seems to have a decent reputation.
summary: Works and tastes just like wheat flour

reviewText: Love these! Yes, you do need to briefly knead them before opening to mix the oil back into the peanut butter. No different than any other natural peanut butter product. My kids get these in their lunchbox as a dessert and they are perfect on the go snacks.

I recently needed to increase my fiber intake and found this to be a perfect solution.  Not only does one of these granola bars contain 36% of the Daily Value for Fiber, but it also has no high fructose corn syrup, and it tastes great. If you like sipping mochas, you will really like these mocha flavored granola bars.  They are so sweet, I have been eating them as a dessert!
summary: Delicious way to increase your fiber intake.

reviewText: From the very politically correct recycled packaging I expected this cereal to taste dense and healthy - but probably flavorless.  It was a nice suprise.  Slightly sweet and tasty, it was great (and I suspect is good for you).

I bought this for my husband who dearly loves ravioli (original) but he was not thrilled with this. I tried it too, it wasn't bad, but it tasted to me like it might have had some itlian sausage mixed in.
Very useful for Chinese recipes. You don't need much, so it should last for years. It's a high quality spice.

When I first originally tried Godiva's Milk Chocolate Hot Cocoa (in hot milk of your choice), I had decided that another brand (a double chocolate type from San Fran that was more chocolaty) suited my own darker chocolate tastes more, but once I tried Godiva's Dark Chocolate Hot Chocolate, I was sunk.Throughout many winters, I've kept going for this Godiva canister, and a cup of this chocolate (usually in 2% milk, hot of course) keeps me from indulging in almost any other decadent dessert. Candy bars are definitely no temptation with this around instead. Godiva Truffles are another matter, though... especially the dark chocolate ones!
Great product for kids and adults. Got for after bariatric surgery. Small portion and really organic fruit. Love it and will order again.

I was excited when I read other reviews about the assortment of flavors that comes in this pack but I was sadly disappointed after having eaten some of it.  There are 6-8 flavors that comprise about 80% of the 5 pounds, then just a handful of another 4-5 flavors that are sprinkled in.  I won't be buying this again.
summary: ... that comes in this pack but I was sadly disappointed after having eaten some of it

reviewText: Lipton's Orange Blossom Hibiscus is a nice soothing cup that taste more like a combination of Orange and Lemon peels.I (We) drink 5-6 cups of tea a day, more than half is green tea and the rest is either chamomile or a fruit/herbal.This package is good, I wouldn't rate it in the top 10 but if you like an orange and lemon flavored tea, this will definitely please you.

Kraft Mayo with Olive Oil and Cracked Pepper takes a little getting used to. It is a "lite" mayo so it has that slight difference from regular mayonnaise. It is not quite as rich and has more of a lemon flavor. The cracked pepper is prominent in the mayo. I can see why some reviewers were put off. Only order this if you are used to a heavy black pepper dose on your food. That said, I find this condiment a fantastic replacement for regular mayo in nearly every application. It is mind blowing on a sandwich and just as good on salads and veggies. If you are partial to sliced tomatoes in your sandwich, then you are in for a real treat. Highly recommended!
This tea tastes identical to the caffeinated kombucha, only it's decaf. Great and calming.  Price is great, too.
NICE MEDIUM COFFEE FLAVOR!  PACK WORKS OKAY IN KEURIG COFFEEMAKER.  My husband and I both enjoy the favor of this nice breakfast blend.

I am sodium sensitive, retaining fluid easily.  The way I use this Himalayan Natural Unprocessed finishing salt, is to make my breakfast toast using unsalted butter.  Then, I sprinkle just a few grains of pink salt over the buttered toast and enjoy it as if I were using salted butter.  Such a small savings of sodium, but it all adds up. To further reduce sodium intake, I am going to look for sodium-free or reduced-sodium bread.I tried using this salt in a pot of cooking food, but its flavor disappeared.  As suggested, it is effective when sprinkled over cooked food, just before eating.I haven't used it long enough to establish whether my BP is lowered, but I like it enough that i take little samples to friends so that they can try it.  At home, beside the cook top, I keep it in a little pot with a lid and find no caking of the salt.
summary: Reduce sodium intake and get more minerals

reviewText: These little apple clusters pack a punch of flavor. They are little half-inch size balls that look like granola. Pop one into your mouth and your taste buds explode with apple and cinnamon flavor. Look at the ingredients and then indulge in more, because there's nothing bad in these. Organic apples, organic apple juice concentrate, organic potato starch, organic cinnamon. That's it. So good and crunchy. They'll surely squelch your munchies!
summary: Wow! Packs a punch of flavor

reviewText: I was previously using an organic almond extract that I bought at a local store. I thought that one was ok, but when I tried this one, I realized there was a huge difference in terms of quality between the two. This is simply superb, absolutely heavenly in whatever recipe that requires a strong almond  flavor.A little goes a long way so it is really convenient.Absolutely recommended.

I have always hated powdered eggs...  I decided to give Hoosier a try because I dont eat eggs all the time.  Buying a dozen eggs to use a few of them and the rest rot got tiring.  I like the reviews so hey why not right?  I was happily surprised, yes there is a slight taste but nothing like any powdered eggs I have eaten before.  I found a way with mixing to make them taste even better.  The suggested mix is 2 tablespoons egg powder to 2 tablespoons and 2 teaspoons water.  I ususally mix about 4 eggs worth at a time.  I used half water and half milk for measurement mixing.  I then add one additional teaspoon of egg mix,  I season with black pepper and a little garlic powder.  I add cheese as well for a wonderful taste.  If you want to do even better use carnation milk instead of regular milk.I will buy these again it makes it very convenient to have eggs when I want and not have to waste any that were unused.
summary: SO MUCH BETTER THAN I THOUGHT IT WOULD BE

reviewText: after drinking this coffee for a week or so, my husband asked if I would order some Columbian instead... he didn't hate the flavor but didn't really like it either

Love the White Mountain Hot Chocolate, but I wanted to try something different and while the flavor wasn't horrible, bad it was a bit too sweet and watered down so you lose the heat of the chocolate you're looking for to begin with.Overall the White Mountain is much better.The worst thing though was of all the K-Cups I've used this is the only one that dripped (and not just the occasional cup, many of the two boxes I used) when I would removed it from the Keurig, creating a nice counter mess.  Not happy with this result.It could just have been a bad batch, though since I wasn't happy enough with the flavor I won't be trying this product again to find out.
I would have preferred this product was just caramel corn.  But the chocolate was very light, and the individual packs made me notice I got a lot more for my cals than I figured I would.

This drink flavor is so much better than the watermelon/strawberry flavored drink. This kiwi/berry drink is less sweet, and has less calories than the other Switch drink.  This drink contains 135 calories, with 33g surgar, 34g carbs. This is a carbonated juice drink with no added sugar or preservatives. I liked this drink better than the first drink I tried because it didn't taste as sweet as the watermelon/strawberry flavored drink. I am glad I took the opportunity to try a different flavor, this drink was refreshing, and thirst quenching. Thanks for the sample!
Excellent sauce. I really do like the way it tastes. I wish it was in bigger bottles like 24 ounce though. Love it!

It has the crunch of a ginger snap cookie, but the actual ginger taste was too overpowering--to the point where it kind of felt like it was burning my mouth. The ginger didn't hit me until after I chewed the cookie for a moment or so... and then WHAM!I had one cookie, and really did not want to have any others (even with my horrible sweet tooth).For those who love ginger snaps, I think you'll enjoy this. For the rest of you who aren't so crazy about them? I don't really think you'll like these.

My choice was the cinnamon nut flavor, but it comes in berry and cocoa coconut as well. A nice little package with bits of almonds, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, pecans, raisins, cashews, sprinkled with dried molasses, vanilla extract, tapioca syrup.. Has a sweet taste with only 200 calories per package.Extra good.
Beautiful display, happy to have  received this for my office coffee/tea station.  I know it will be enjoyed by all.
Just ordered my 2nd bag from this company. Wish the bag wasn't so flimsy - I had to double bag it after opening- but other than that, excellent quality seeds and very prompt delivery.

The eternal quest goes on and on eternally: how to find a *true* Balsamic Vinegar that is affordable by non-criminals?  Well, this is a fine compromise.  It may not have all the oak leaves and certificates of some other brands, but it's the best quality I've found at a very human price point.  Sweet and rich, it won't leave you sour and poor.
summary: A Pax Romani to end the Aceti Wars

reviewText: My wife and I tried this rotini pasta with meat sauce topped with Parmesan cheese.  With so much additional flavor, it was difficult to assess properly the flavor of the pasta itself.  We did like the al dente firmness of the rotini and the fact that it doesn't stick together the way traditional semolina pasta does.We ate some leftovers -- without sauce or cheese -- as a side dish at lunch.  With just black pepper and a bit of salt, the pasta was very good, its flavor coming through nicely.  It still retained its firmness after being warmed up in the microwave.I have tried whole wheat pasta and don't much care for it.  I was therefore skeptical about this "multigrain" pasta.  I was pleasantly surprised.  Its flavor most resembles other name brand pastas, such as Ronzoni, De Cecco, or San Giorgio.There are so many brands of pasta on the market, most people will probably buy what is on sale.  The best aspect of Barilla Multigrain Rotini is its non-sticky nature and its versatility.  It can be used as a main dish, in salads, as a side dish, or even as an addition to soup.

When I bought this popcorn, I was hoping it would be all it was advertised to be.  It was and much more!  It pops almost to the last few kernels and is very crunchy and not stale at all.  I love it and indulge in having this popcorn about 2-3 times per week, which is the healthiest snack for me, in my opinion, and I don't feel guilty about it either!  Thank you Arrowhead Mills and Amazon.com for offering it!  I hope you keep it coming so I can order more when the time comes to do so.

LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS MIX!!!  The Focaccia bread is delicious with a wonderful texture....you can make it thinner and use it as a pizza base...thicker it is kind of like a thick crust pizza, chewy and savory...you can top it with whatever you like....I like a little olive oil, some thinly sliced tomato, fresh basil and a little garlic salt......Delicious!!!  Also...if you have made gluten free breads before you know how horrible to work with the dough can be...sticky and messy....but this is not!  you can work with it and it is not so darn messy!!!  Love this Focaccia bread mix!

My twin boys love eating them as much as I love the convenience of the Happy Baby Organic "pouchy-puches" They allow for my boys (1 year old) to grab them and eat on their own without the mess while on the go. They get all the healty nutrients I give them at home with home-made meals but when we're on-the-go grabbing a few of these is convenient, fas, easy, healty and fun!
Thin, crispy and gingery.  So light and tasty.  Perfect with a cup of tea!  Lovely with a mug of coffee.  I bought a case and would do so again!

A great in-between snack to stave off hunger till you can get a regular meal. Not high in sugar and the caloric count is relatively low. Great product for "on the go" people. It's so tasty, too! Just like candy ... sorry, couldn't help myself, big Lucy fan! I recommend.

I had a lot of coffee beans of a particular bitter kind, it had to be mellow out, so I opted for this flavor coffee to mix it with. Worked like a charm. Now what we have is a strong, slightly bitter, but much more mellower tasting coffee, and with the proper amount of cream and sugar it is a strong cup of coffee but it has the note of Don Francisco Hawaiian Hazelnut Coffee, with a hint of coconut? doing its thing. The mix solved the bitter and rendered a very tasty cup of coffee. 4 Stars.

The packaging helps to insure freshness. I found the taste robust enough to stand up to hazelnut creamer.Also found it mild enough to drink with no more sweetener than I would use with Lipton. I'm not about too give up coffee for "breakfast" but would drink this tea at other times of the day.Based on the packaging I'd be likely to try other flavors from Higgins and Burke.

I like the Lipton Pyramid Tea that I tried previously--Blackberry Cream--but this flavor is unremarkable.  I also find the pyramids to be a hassle and that it is easier to deal with flat bags, which can be composted.

The flavor of these bars is "okay".  I don't mind them, but I wouldn't be looking forward to eating one.These are of questionable nutrition.  The ratio of sugar to fiber (4.5 to 1) is not terribly good.  They don't provide much protein.The ingredients aren't particularly healthy but not terrible either.Another reviewer complained about the size, but compared to other bars they aren't much different in size but they deliver a lot less nutrition.  Try a "Luna" bar instead.
Incredibly delicious candy.  Main draw back is that the filling is liquid and oozes our when you bite in.  I kept in refrigerator as they oozed out when warm.

Do not buy this until the problems with the seals is fixed.  All of the jars leak.  Opened food items are unsafe to consume.  Assuming you get a jar with a good seal, it's good.  If not, it's garbage and has to be thrown away.  What a waste of money...
this is better than any other  chocolate flavored i have ever tasted. just be sure to serve it very cold,
These pita crackers are perfect for dipping. They are flavorful (a little too spicy/garlicky for my tastes), but are definitely something different from the standard chip or cracker.

For something 'organic' and 'granola', this seems much too good and tasty to be healthy for you.  The granola has a great, chocolate taste without being too sweet, as well as a satisfactory crunch to it without being too hard on the teeth.  I'd say that Nature's Path did indeed come up with a 'unique marriage of taste and health' with this blend - everyone I had try it loved the flavor!  There are nice sized chunks of yummy dark chocolate in the tasty granola, and the only complaint I have about this blend is the red berries - I don't know if it's the bag I received or not, but they were a bit missing compared to everything else, just a few tiny pieces here and there.  Yet the granola is still delicious and I didn't really feel it lacking for their tiny presence (the chocolate more than made up for them), just be aware if you're hoping for nice big chunks in yours.

Altoids Smalls are a good choice for a carried product, and Amazon gives you the variety you just don't find in a retail store.  Cinnamon is a personal favorite, and these are zippy without being excessive.

I'm not intolerant to gluten, but I do keep an eye out for healthy snack foods. These oat raisin walnut spice bars have an unusual consistency, rather like fruit cake, but they sure taste better than fruitcake! They're not overly sweet, and it's actually possible to detect the flavors of oats, raisins, walnuts, and spice (mainly cinnamon), and they go well with a nice, hot cup of tea.

To begin with, these cookies are quite possibly the best Oreos I've ever had. It's your typical mint-chocolate combination, but with the uniqueness of an Oreo thrown in. It's like someone finally figured out that a box of Junior Mints, if combined with the inimitable Oreo cookie, could quite possibly take over the world. It's really hard to describe how delicious these cookies are, especially if you keep them in the refrigerator and then drink them with a cold glass of milk. There are only about 20 in a box, so they tend to go quickly, making them a bit on the pricey side. On the other hand, they're excellent for when you have friends over, and they compliment a scoop of ice cream quite well. The chocolate is semi-bitter, as you would expect, but the mint cream is right on target. Seriously, Junior Mints + Oreo cookie = Oreo Mint Fudge Cremes. ;)All that being said, having them shipped via UPS is a hit or miss proposition. The cookies really are not packaged in such a way that all off the tumbling about won't dislodge them from their tray. When I opened my box, about half of them had slid around for the journey to our front porch and were beginning to crumble around the edges. Also, is was wintertime, so the chocolate had started to oxidize a bit (which didn't affect the taste, but definitely the look). I took off one sar because of this, since I felt that in this case, the shipping process detracts from the experience of eating them somewhat (unless you like them already broken). If you plan to buy these from the local grocery, however, by all means, add the extra star back! :)
summary: Excellent! But a word about shipping...

reviewText: If you buy and use sports drinks, you will find this one very convenient. If you find it a little strong, which I did, add more water. Also, by doing this, it takes the product from being rather pricey to affordable.Pretty good stuff.
Have used this for years, but sometime unable to find it in local stores.  Nice to be able to order a large supply to last me for months!
summary: Really like this in my coffee

reviewText: I want to say that this soda does have a very strong flavor, probably the most of all the Zevias, so I can understand why some may not like it. For me though it's a very tasty treat. It's been a long time since I've had a true Dr. Pepper, so I don't feel that it is fair for me to make that comparison. However this is a flavor that I really enjoy.

What I like best is that I can control the amount of flavor I want in my water.  I also like that it is more natural than other brands full of aspartame.  It does have sucralose but honey is the first ingredient.  The strawberry - guava is tasty if you are used to the guava flavor.  The bottle is not very appealing it almost looks like a mustard bottle.  Not bad for flavoring my water.

My baby girl has spit ups every once in a while and I got this thinking that it would help. It does seem to help a little as her spit ups are less frequent. However, when she does on the occasion, her spit ups are as thick as the formula - this formula has a thicker consistency than the regular Enfamil iron-based ones.Subsequently when I consulted my pediatrician over my baby girls spit up frequency, my pediatrician wasn't too worried about her spit ups and says they are normal and suggested that we revert back to using a regular Enfamil iron-based formula and only use the Enfamil A.R. formula when her spit ups are really serious.I guess it still helps to have some A.R. formula around to deal with her spit up issues.Would recommend parents to check on severity of the infant's spit ups with your pediatrician before getting this formula.

I have always enjoyed wine gums. I am from Canada where they are widely available and I always brought home a few kilos of Maynards to last me through the time to my next visit. On a whim, I searched Amazon and noted these well-rated wine gums and decided to give them a try. They are excellent! Different in flavor and texture than Maynard's but I find them better. The flavors are more distinct and intense. I am so thrilled! I hope Amazon keeps these on the stock list for a long time. As other have mentioned, there is no alcohol in these candies. There is no fat either, and comparatively low sugar levels. Enjoy them, if you have been looking for wine gums, these are it, and a great buy to boot!!!
summary: Finally, wine gums in the USA!

reviewText: You can make two mistakes with cinnamon (like any other flavor, I suppose). You can have too much and kill your drink, or you can have too little have people wondering: "Why is this called cinnamon?"Hamilton Mills Toasted Cinnamon Coffee runs just inside the "too much" line. I think it's a better error, because you can always put a tad of creamer or use a big mug and mix one K-cup of this with a K-cup of just coffee (like a good dark roast).The cinnamon notes were strong, but the coffee flavor was pretty strong just behind the cinnamon. It tasted like a heavily cinnamon-added coffee, not just a hot cup of cinnamon-coated mud. That's a good thing.Overall, it's not an everyday cup of coffee for me, because I like straight coffee flavor, but it's a good occasional cup.There was no "mud" or grounds in the bottom of the cup.Brewed: 192 degrees in a B60, used middle-setting (8 oz). Tried it initially with no cream, no sugar, and it was pretty good. Liked it better with just about a half-teaspoon of French Vanilla per cup.As with all K-Cups: pricing fluctuates, but the value here and now is pretty good, if a tad high on price.

I bought this specifically to flavor my almsed shakes (which taste like nothing). It does the job perfectly & I'm really impressed by it. I'll be buying more flavors soon, since I liked the chocolate so much!
yes I would definitely order this again in the future!
summary: Amazon is great for small snack needs!

reviewText: I liked it - it has an unusual blueberry taste mixed with dates and nuts.  I had it for my breakfast today.

My wife and I love our herb teas and have tried several different brands of Chamomile over the last few months and have come home to our old favorite from the 1970's: Celestial Seasonings Chamomile Herb Tea.  It has the richest and most mellow flavor of all the other brands, consistent quality and longest lasting flavor.  We add a little low glycemic sweetener (also purchased here at Amazon online) and the flavor is amazing!  Relaxing, soothing after a hard day at work or in my case dealing with pain as part of my disability, just as soothing and warming.  Perfect for after dinner to settle the stomach, great for just before bed, a very good tension tamer mid day as well.  This is our good 'ol stand-by favorite and we make sure to keep it on hand summer as well as winter. It's a "must have" in our home, and brewing it smells like "home":)
summary: Best Chamomile Herb Tea Ever Tried!!!

reviewText: I got this tea and it's so much tea I am sharing!  I love this tea.  It has an excellent flavor and it's strong enough to make more than one cup with the leaves.  (I use an infuser).  I make sure the water is boiling hot when I make it so I get all the flavor!  Strong Orange flavor as well, not overpowering but perfect with the black tea as Earl Grey should be.  I won't go back to tea bags again!!

Football season starts next month and Emerald's SEA SALT & PEPPER CASHEWS might well be a perfect addition to the Game Day broadcast as I watch my guys, the USC Trojans, beat the bandini out of all challengers on the way to the BCS Title Game. Fight on! Of course, fans of that other squad across town, the UCLA Teddy Bears, would probably find this snack just as toothsome, but how great an experience can it be, munching cashews or not, watching grown men dressed out in sissy powder blue?I'd perhaps prefer a little less salt and a tad more pepper, but then I'd fall into the trap set my wife whose inclinations favor a low-sodium diet. At 270mg of Na per serving, these nuts are a bit too briny for her; if they contained less salt, I might be forced to share. And we can't have that, especially as she thinks football is for Neanderthals.No edible is perfect, apparently. The hand-wringing, food nannies make sure of that. Their handiwork is evident on the label with the warning:"ALLERGY INFORMATION: This product is processed on equipment that also processes other tree nuts or peanuts. May contain tree nuts, peanuts, wheat, milk, soy, or sesame seeds."Happily, perhaps because I grew up in a less fearful age when kids were allowed to go out and play in the dirt and become exposed to all those nasty germs and allergens and thus acquire immune tolerance, I can now eat these SEA SALT & PEPPER CASHEWS by the handful and not worry that I'll go into anaphylactic shock by halftime.Another nice feature is the ergonomically friendly can, done up in a soothing green color, that allows for an easy hand grip. Also take note of, and visit, the Emerald Nuts website, which is clever and amusing.
I buy all of the Libby organic veggies from amazon on subscribe and save.  No bug juice for me in my food ever. I wish Libby would sell all of the veggies not just a few because they are great.
Excellent product. Easy to use and quick delivery.
Not as good as I hoped.  Even my husband thought it didn't have great taste.. Left a slight after taste.
oh so tastySO dont scream gluten freeTY dear Kinikinnick for creating products safe for those escaping gluten :)will and HAVE been buying more
summary: great animal crackers..tastey and Gluten FREE!

reviewText: mixed this with a bag of the dark.  the girls love them together.  I keep little jewelry zip lock bags so they can take some in their lunch bags.

Love these bars! They are always fresh and have an amazing flavor. I let the kids eat these like granola bars. 2 ingredients: coconut and rice syrup. Cleaner than any granola bar or quick snack out there.

Great Pasta. I was afraid that the idea of a healthier choice might mean a soggier meal but it is nothing of the kind. Coops up good, good flavor, keeps well. We'll be switching to these from now on for better diet.
summary: Good Taste + Good For = Good Buy

reviewText: Very tasty, the hint of brown sugar is just right so that it is sweet but not overpowering and the pieces stay very crispy in milk. Great tasting and good for you, can't go wrong there.

Just sweet enough. No noticeable sugar. Moist. No excess packaging. Just want I needed, since there seems to be a dearth of dried cranberries in my town right now. Good enough that I think I will skip the bins in the future. These are great for snacking, trail mix, granola, and quick breads.

I am a huge fan of the subtle and wonderful flavor of Darjeeling tea by Twinings. i have been trying to figure out whether it has caffeine in it, but I love this product. Its very subtle flavor wise, so if you are looking for a  strong black tea this is definitely mild, but it is perfect for me!

I wasn't sure how another fruit drink would taste.  I was pleasantly surprised when I sipped the Watermelon Strawberry - light taste, not sickeningly sweet, refreshing and just the right amount for a serving.  I hope they come out with this in a lower calorie version and it would appeal to an even larger audience.
These are delicious! My son thinks they're dessert, and I'm okay with that. And there's that feeling of, "Well, it's better than potato chips, ice cream, or cake."And it is.

these taste exactly like Girl Scouts "thin mints" cookies... which are my absolute favorite. love that I no longer have to stalk girl scouts to buy their cookies :)these are different from regular oreos, and even differ from the mint filled oreosOreo Mint Crème Oreo Cookie, 15.25-Ounce Packages (Pack of 4)(which are also yummy).the Mint Oreo Fudge Cremes have a thin chocolate cookie bottom, a layer of mint cream, and then are covered in chocolate.they are especially yummy if you put them in the freezer for a bit!

From the moment this herbaceous tea touches your tongue, the delightful floral, peppermint, and eucalyptus essence will sooth you.Blooming with relaxing flavors, this tea is the perfect end to a busy day or a great way to start the day!Drink Tea for Your HealthSupplements: Vitamin C, Zinc, Echinacea, Eucalyptus, and Stevia.Other ingredients: Peppermint, licorice, roasted chicory, natural menthol extract (contains soy lecithin) lavender, and Chinese star anise.Vitamin CAs one of the many antioxidants your body needs, Vitamin C helps to block some of the damage caused by free radicals. Vitamin C also helps boost your immune system.ZincBeing an essential mineral, Zinc is a helpful element to your immune system.EchinaceaHaving immune-boosting properties, Echinacea is a good choice to drink when sick or when well, to potentially prevent becoming sick.EucalyptusAntimicrobial properties are found in Eucalyptus, which helps the immunity system fight colds and other illnesses, respiratory infections.Serving suggestions: This wellness tea is wonderful when consumed warm, or when poured over ice. Drink by itself, or sweeten with sugar or honey, or splash with milk, creamer, almond milk, rice drink, or coconut milk, to add an additional depth to this already distinctive tea.Celestial Seasoning Brews Up Teapots of  Environment ResponsibilityCelestial Seasonings teas are packaged in completely compostable and biodegradable pillow-design tea bags without the need for a tag, string, staple, or individual wrapper. These unique tea bags are packed in boxes manufactured from 100% recyclable materials. Resulting in Celestial Seasonings' love for the earth and their innovative tea bags, they save three-and-a-half pounds of waste each year.Brew yourself a cup of Celestial Seasonings Wellness Tea Echinacea Complete Care and experience the pure delicious refreshment!Disclosure of Material Connection: I received this product free from Linhart P.R. I was not required to write a positive review. The opinions I have expressed are my own. I am disclosing this in accordance with the Federal Trade Commission's 16 CFR, Part 255vf: "Guides Concerning the Use of Endorsements and Testimonials in Advertising."
summary: Celestial Seasonings Wellness Tea Echinacea Complete Care

reviewText: I love to keep a some Wild Planet Tuna on hand. Great flavor, lowest mercury. We should have a serving of Tuna or Salmon twice a week.
summary: Wild Planet Tuna is the Healthy choice.

reviewText: This is great for an adventurous cook!  Seems a little saltier than ordinary table salt, somehow rounds out flavors better.  If you have school-age children, this would be a terrific item to spark a discussion about the Himalayas, salt production, etc.  Saw a documentary about traders making the long, arduous trek, had to try it. For an all pink snack, sprinkle the pink salt over pink Madagascar rice! It's fun to sample the different international products.
This honey is delicious.  It tastes great in plain Greek yogurt with fruit and in tea.  I highly recommend it.

If you like weak or watered down coffee, then this is the product for you.One of the flavors I tried was not too bad but the second one of the same flavor was completely different.  There seems to be no uniform, some being very weak and others week.  The coffee is just bland.  Nothing you can do with it.Just don't waste your money on this product.  The cheapest regular low price coffee would be better than this.
This is my favorite brand of tea!  The flavor, the smell and the taste is always good.  Bags all come individually wrapped which is plus for me when purchasing tea.
summary: My go to for a variety of black teas

reviewText: Switch is a sweet, natural fruit juice beverage to enjoy as an alternative to traditional sodas, providing the same carbonated drink experience only with no sugar, corn syrup, preservatives, glutens or artificial colors.This just might mix up pretty well in a cocktail, too!Switch tastes nice but not overwhelmingly sweet. It leaves a light, temporary, watermelon-flavored carbonated drink aftertaste.If you guzzle down sodas left and right, I recommend you at least give Switch a try - it's "healthier" (or so it appears) and it's cool, bubbly-crisp and refreshing.
summary: A Nice Alternative to Traditional Sodas

reviewText: Ok, these things are pretty tasty.  The blueberry flavor is rich, but subtle.  The ingredients are all organic.  But let's face it, when you're energy bar shopping, you want to know how they compare to Clif bars, right?  The Pure bar is 1.7oz, contains 8 grams of fat, 3 grams of fiber, and 6 grams of protein.  The Clif bar is 2.4oz (50% larger than the Pure bar), contains 5 grams of fat, 7 grams of fiber, and 10 grams of protein.  Most, but not all, of the ingredients of the Clif bar are organic and they've added vitamins to fortify their bar.  The Pure bars are about $1.57 each, while the Clif bars are about a buck.  All in all, the Clif bars seem to be a better bargain, unless you feel strongly about having every ingredient be organic.

My favorite coffee is Starbuck's Holiday blend. This year I could only get pre-ground Holiday blend and that's what turned me back on to ground coffee. I've only used beans for years.Now this isn't close to Starbuck's holiday blend, it's much darker but it is good. It's rich and has a bold flavor. I tried it in my coffee maker, in a French press,and in my little stove top. It's good however you make it.I subscribed and I have prime also, so it's easy and a good buy. It's not my new favorite but it's a decent everyday coffee. I froze the extra bricks, I freeze everything from coffee to chocolate to flours, herbs and spices even dried beans. I'm at that age where if I can make it to the bathroom and have a decent great cup of coffee without spilling it, the mornings going OK.

We've been gluten free since March '07, and we've tried plenty of bread mixes and recipes, and this is the one the kids like the best.  They take sandwiches to school, use if for grilled cheese and toast, and we throw the heels in the food processor to use in meatballs and meatloaves. Not a crumb gets wasted! :-)

Our kids are the "test" when it comes to finding good gluten free, organic food. I purchased these for our kids lunch, and they seem to enjoy them. Our oldest has said they don't have a lot of flavor, but our youngest (preschooler) really likes them. I'll take that as a victory, as it can be difficult to find gluten free, organic anything that they actually like!

Delicious sardines and 12 or more! I eat sardines on Ritz Cracker's, with soup sometimes, as a quick, nutritious snack and this is the only brand I will buy. It is a very good price. Highly recommend, will buy again, and I hope this helps someone.

A nice alternative to rice noodles.  Sam Mills Pasta has great flavor and texture.  The noodles arrive in good shape without much breakage.  The fusilli is a fun alternative and it holds its shape well without being mushy after cooking. I set my timer for the minimum time on the cooking time range listed on the package.  Then I check the noodles.  They are usually al dente at that point, but it only takes another minute if they are a bit under cooked.  Do not over cook GF pasta!

I'm not a coffee snob - I'll drink pretty much anything and I drink it black. This coffee tasted fine to me but it didn't taste strong or dark. If you're looking  for an extra dark roast coffee, this is probably not the coffee you should choose.I did like that you could smell the package when you open the outer cup and remove the filter cup. However, there were some grounds in my coffee and also around the edge of my Kerig where the K-cup is inserted. I did not like the fact that I'll have to clean that out now.I'll drink the rest of the cups that I already have of this coffee but I won't be buying more.
This kind of date, ie., Deglet Noor is full of flavor in comparison to say, Medjool dates. This brand is fresh and moist. Excellent product.

This is the second k-cup variety I've tried that turned out to be more burnt than just dark roasted.  And again, I'd like to think it's just the batch.  But I've found so many really good k-cup varieties, I'm not likely to try a second box.There are other ways to get a stronger flavor than to literally burn the beans.
summary: Not just bold or dark roast -- a little burnt

reviewText: This Go Picnic Mighty Munch mealmade a perfect packed lunch while on a drive. The meal is packed well and comes in a total package which includes a turkey stick which paired nicely with the cheese slice; baked snap pea crisps (good by themselves, excellent on a salad); strawberry applesauce; sunflower seed crunch; a packet of natural gummy bears, and a towelette for clean-up. It was all peanut free and gluten free and compared to most prepackaged foods was incredibly low in fat and sugar.The box has some games and a word search.  The package is sturdy and portable.  It did seem like a lot of packaging, but the food had good taste and was appropriate.
This is the perfect second cup of coffee. I like a strong coffee to wake me up and then a less powerful coffee to enjoy. This is it.

You'd probably expect something like the traditional fruity fig bars that you would associate with Newtons. This is rather different, though. It's light, crispy (of course!), and not nearly as filling. They're very flavorful and make for a simple, light snack. One package holds two crisp bars and someone with an appetite can polish off two or more packages, no problem. These might actually be better for kids. One package for a child would do nicely. The box could read, "Great for kids!"The apple cinnamon crisps somewhat resemble the apple pies from McDonald's, but the crisps are presumably healthier. There is actually a hint of apple pie in the flavor, too. They're made with real fruit with just 100 calories per package. Plus, they're a good source of Calcium with no Cholesterol.
summary: The box could read, "Great for kids!"

reviewText: I'm on a health kick and knew about the fact that regular iodized salt is just plain not good for you. Celtic sea salt is moist and grey. Not every salt mill will grind it, but if you look you can find what you need or just sprinkle the course grains in your food or soups. Either way, I'm glad to know I'm getting trace minerals with my salt instead of eating bleached and deodorized and ultra=processed stuff with fillers in it.I will continue to use a natural salt for my needs and celtic sea salt does not disappoint. I would buy it again, although I'm interested to try other kinds of salt out there like Himalayan pink salt. I heard Redmond 'Real Salt' does not have as many minerals as these other two brands do.
summary: Love this salt, you can taste the difference

reviewText: I am rating this strictly as a canned tuna, hence the 5 stars.  It certainly can't be compared to fresh tuna but as far as canned tuna goes, it's one of the best I've had.  Beware if you are counting calories as tuna packed in oil has about twice as many calories as tuna in water but for me, the taste is worth the extra calories and the fact that it is packed in healthful olive oil, makes it even better.  I've always like tuna packed in oil as opposed to tun packed in water.  Tuna in water has a fishy, water logged taste.  The oil keeps the tuna more firm.  The addition of the jalapenos gave it some snap.  This tuna is great in a salad.  It is pricey; about twice the price of albacore packed in water but it is very good.  I've noticed that solid albacore is no longer solid but rather broken pieces and crumbs.  This tuna actually has some solid pieces in it.If yo ucan get past the high price, go for it.
summary: One of the best canned tunas out there.

reviewText: This orange tea is so delicious that I will discontinue my old orange tea and switch to this one.  It has just the right amount of orange flavor!  Delicious!

package arrived quickly and was appreciated.unfortunately upon opening the package found wrapped only in thin plastic bag, nothing to cushion 4 packages of cookies.opening the individual packages i find about half the cookies broken into 3-4 pcs....sad
Great taste and lasts a long time without getting hard. I don't know if it really is helping my teeth. Time will tell.

You know that feeling when your afternoon craving hits, but you want something more nutritious than what is in the vending machine and more exciting than what you packed? Fiber One is here to help. Fiber One Protein Bars can help keep you on track with 20 percent daily value of fiber with at least six grams of protein in a delicious 130-140 calorie bar:At 130 calories, Caramel Nut contains seven grams of proteinAt 140 calories, Coconut Almond contains six grams of proteinI first off have to say I LOVE the Fiber One brand! I have tried them some time ago and fell in love. For this particular product I have to say YUMM! You see I'm trying to eat healthier and have a better diet and watch what I eat. The problem is cutting out junk food completely just won't happen, but if I can find something that makes me feel like I'm eating junk without so much "bad stuff" then you have won me over!Not only are Fiber One Protein Bars healthier for you than most "junk food" but they taste just as good as your typical sweets. How? They have chocolate over them! A little bit of chocolate always makes things better. Will I give up my sweets for Fiber One? Probably not. Not because it's not a good problem, I'm just an addict when it comes to junk food. I can tell you, however, that I will be cutting back on my regular sweets to replace them with the Fiber One Protein Bars! Also, I do intend to continue purchasing Fiber One brand products in an effort to better my health and encourage you to give them a try as well!READ FULL REVIEW: http://www.closetsamples.com/review-fiber-one-protein-bars/

reviewerName: Nathan Andersen "Gadget lover and author of S...
reviewText: A while back I thought that if I was going to eat pasta I'd make it whole grain pasta. The only problem was I tried it a couple times and I didn't like it very much; my kids wouldn't touch it.I had a chance to try out Barilla's whole grain spaghetti, though, and decided to give it another shot. I've always liked Barilla pasta, which never disappoints me, and is easily my favorite non-gourmet, "dry pasta" brand.It's great. It cooks fast and has a nice texture. I've tried both the regular and the thin spaghetti, and liked them both. Best of all, it tastes great. I actually prefer it to the regular kind - it's a bit more "nutty" and hearty tasting. I added a touch of salt and some olive oil while boiling and it came out great. For topping, I just fried up some veggies, added some bottled pasta sauce, and voila! My kids even liked it. Good stuff.
summary: A very tasty whole grain pasta - cooks easily, tastes delicious

reviewText: Granted, there's not much natural about something so intensely flavorful that doesn't have any calories to speak of, but natural isn't where the makers of these drinks were going. They're going for taste bud titillation and a drink that won't contribute to the world-wide overconsumption epidemic. Crystal Light meets those goals expertly. In stylish packaging, the container of 5 mix packets will keep you hydrated and loving it for weeks.

This was a really nice, refreshing drink. The strawberry-watermelon blend was sweet but not too much so, and it has just a little carbonation that makes it a little edgier than plain juice. The best part of it is that it didn't have the overwhelming grape or pear  taste that natural juice products usually have. A lot of the others use grape or pear syrup to get the sweetness and it overwhelms the flavor you actually paid for. This one tasted exactly like strawberries and watermelon. I'll definitely be buying these in the future, and I hope they make them available in a large size, too.
summary: Light, refreshing, nothing to feel guilty about.

reviewerName: Bartok Kinski "A casual stroll through the lu...
reviewText: When I travel to Siberia, I take about 20 lbs of Bob's Red Mill Organic White Wheat Farina.  With the cold, it doesn't spoil and all I need is ice to melt on a stove to cook it.  Very simple and provides energy for the day's hike, along with a bottle of non-alcoholic vodka.

They come well packaged for shipping, and because they are individually wrapped they don't break and stay fresh for a long time.  The Cioccolati are my favorite for their delicate almondy taste and the rich dark chocolate coating.I've tried a LOT of biscotti from different places like Whole Foods, coffee houses, bakeries, and more.  This is by far the best, especially for dunking in coffee.  Unlike all other biscotti, I never have a problem with these rather large biscotti falling apart.  I can dunk and wait for the last drops to fall before taking a bite and I don't get the end of it falling off and plunking into my coffee to become a sodden mess.  And the coating becomes a delicious liquid chocolate.Compare these to the vanilla and almond biscotti at Starbucks, which always taste like they're weeks old despite being individually wrapped.  Nonni's does it right!
way more chocolate than expected which didn't ship well and we were only in the sevenies, I like the idea of a sugar free snack just wish it had been a cinnamon bun

This is probably the easiest, least-messy way I've found to really clean my glass cooktop. I don't know if the handle is really necessary -- the pad would work just as well without it -- but it doesn't really hinder the cleaning either, except in the very corners.However, it's not a miracle worker. There are old stains on my cooktop that will probably be there forever, and this hasn't changed that. It's very handy for routine cleaning, however, especially the kind that needs more than a quick swipe with a rag.
A great way to thicken gravy. Wish the package was bigger.

There isn't a whole lot to say in a review of Mr. Z Sweet & Hot Beef Jerky. It's a good quality jerky. It's chewy, but not dry and tough (there's no achy jaws from chewing it); it's salted without being too salty (I didn't need a drink just to chase it down); and it has a good mix of the promised sweet and hot flavors, not too sweet and not too hot (though I would have preferred a little more of each).This is not the first Mr. Z product I have tried, and I have to say that I've generally enjoyed them all. While Mr. Z isn't the most budget-friendly product, jerky is one of those products where you DO get what you pay for. If I want a hard, salty jerky, I'll buy budget; when I want an enjoyable snack, I just might reach for Mr. Z.

Yes, The doctor told me to EAT BREAKFAST, So When I'm in a rush or not wanting anything too heavy or time consuming to prepare I just pour me a glass of Cow Juice (milk) and mix it in and down it with my morning medications and head out the door simple and sweet, but not too sweet LoL
summary: Doctor's orders EAT BREAKFAST! This makes it easy and good. Plus has all the essential vitamins and minerals 4 my body.

reviewText: Aroma was awesome. As far as the taste goes, I definitely got the berry note. I was not as taken by the strength of the blend.  Mild to bland would be my comment there. All in all, it was good, but I wouldn't go out of my way to find it. From two to three stars based on the aromatherapy of the experience. Mild to non-existent aftertaste.That said, if you LIKE milder, blander coffees, this might fill the bill. I just expected a heartier coffee.All the best,Jay

These Oat Chocolate Chip Coconut Whenever Bars are very good to me. They are the size of a thick medium cookie, are slightly chewy, and are very tasty despite the fact that they do not taste sweet at all.Although coconut is lower in the ingredient list, the cookie tastes mostly like coconut and I didn't taste the chocolate at all.  However, since I like coconut very much, I enjoyed these bars.The first three ingredients in order are gluten-free oats, organic agave, and a rice blend. As for the rest of the cookie's name, chocolate chunks is the fourth ingredient and coconut is the tenth ingedient. The cookie contains eggs and almonds as well. The package claims that you get 180 mg of Omega 3 Fatty Acids and 9 grams of whole grain per bar.Each bar is 180 calories with 80 calories from fat. Nevertheless, these are certainly a better choice than a candy bar and are gluten free. I really like the taste and chewy texture of these bars even though there was absolutely no chocolate taste to me.
summary: Delicious coconut taste, gluten-free oats is the first ingredient

reviewText: No problem, there is a solution and you can still enjoy this great coffee.This is a foundation in south Florida, almost all the Cuban restaurants serveCafe Bustelo, and real Cuban coffee is a treat.
