I dont have the patience forit but you can find instructional videos on YouTube. Anyway, I dont like Espressoeither so what I do, and I'll get slayed for this, is mix this entire packagewith a pack of Chock Full O Nuts regular. Now I have a hearty robust and veryrich tasting coffee that to me tastes the way coffee used to taste 20 years ago.Pilon is another good product, but Bustelo is less expensive and honestly I dontknow how to tell the difference. Don't be afraid to try this with your everydaycoffee, it blends very well.

I LOVE coffee ... everyday!  I have a roaster and a grinder, and the coffee is delicious!  It is worth the few extra steps to get green beans and be in charge of the whole process of getting a great cup of coffee.  Not for the faint-of-heart!!!
summary: Great coffee is important to me and this coffee is that!

reviewText: Great for Snacking and such. Buying in the Small Stores bags like this go for like $6.00 each. I highly enjoyed this product and the quality was right there. Not some Old Shelf filler all 4 bags were Brand new and wayy up to date. Going out for the day into the woods Hiking? then carry a bag or 2 of this with you just in case. 2 bags of this is a fine addition to Any Preppers Bug Out Bag. Or just something to Snack on while watching reruns of SEINFELD.

I am pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoy this flavored coffee. I like it both as a dessert type after dinner coffee as well as an anytime coffee. I only drink coffee sweetened (preferably with honey) and with half and half, and that is how I sampled Melitta's Hazelnut Creme Brulee. My coffee of choice, which I've been drinking for about 2 decades, is Peet's brand coffee (which I get shipped to me and of which I enjoy and drink several varieties, with my top favorites being French and Italian). I always buy whole beans and grind beans one cup at a time. I then make it in a filter cone, and every once in a while in a French press or an espresso machine. If I'm making coffee for 2 or 3 people, I either use the French Press or I make each cup separately, using a separate filter cone for each cup. And I'm always careful when measuring beans and ground coffee so that I can keep the flavor and body of the coffee I drink day after day consistent. (The Melitta Hazelnut Creme Brulee is ground to an "Extra Fine Grind," which means it's unsuitable for use in a French Press.)On a caffeine buzz scale, I find that Melitta Hazelnut Creme Brulee weaker than any variety of Peet's (or Starbucks), but that's fine with me because I don't always want or need a caffeine buzz as strong as the kind I get from a tall cup of Peet's (or Starbucks). Sometimes I regret getting a strong caffeine buzz because it leaves me feeling a tad headachey. So it's nice to know that there's a tasty, good quality alternative that is less intense on a caffeine buzz scale.I would, and probably will, buy Melitta Cafe Collection ground coffee on occasion (e.g., if I'm running low on Peet's or money to buy Peet's, or if I'm asked to bring ground coffee to a holiday gathering where it will be prepared in a coffee maker of some sort). I would like to try the Melitta Cafe Collection Parisian Vanilla variety, as well as their Vienna Roast (Peet's Vienna Roast was one of my favorites but they discontinued it) and Blanc et Noir (which, according to Melitta's site, is "Deep with a Rich Finish"). I have tried their Classique Supreme variety (and will review it separately), and like it as much as I like the Hazelnut. I received free samples of the Hazelnut Creme Brulee and the Classique Supreme for review purposes, but based on the prices listed at Melitta's site and here at Amazon I'd say that the price is right and is lower than I would've expected for coffee of this quality.Update: I spoke on the phone with a Melitta customer service representative about the difficulty I had opening both 11 oz. sample bags of their Cafe Collection coffee I received, and she said that Melitta recommends using scissors along the top. I found it impossible to open either bag without tearing holes in the upper half of each bag.
summary: Makes a most enjoyable cup of coffee.

reviewText: I don't eat hot foods and it was a surprise that this Side-Mates was hot. There was nothing on the front of the box or in the product description that warned it would be hot. I'm sure that people used to hot food would not consider this hot, but for someone who avoids hot food completely, this is definitely hot. Other than that, I thought the quinoa was okay. It was very easy and quick to prepare.

I absolutely love a good dark chocolate covered caramel and these just don't fit the bill.  I had read in some of the reviews that there was too much sea salt and should have paid attention.  I have tried to scrape some of the salt off of the caramels but it tastes like they have put salt in the chocolate covering as well.  I certainly will not be ordering these again.
summary: Certainly not the best I have ever had

reviewText: This is a good deal on canned corn. Great for stockpiling food supplies and the expiration dates are in 2015. I am very satisfied.

This brownie mix is super easy to make.  You only add 2 ingredients to it, and it only takes a couple minutes from mix to oven.  It has real chocolate chuncks in the mix, which melts to make it a very yummy tasting brownie.  Even our friends who don't eat gluten free prefer these to regular mixes.  I always keep a case of this in the closet.

Our friends just came back from New Orleans and brought us a can. I've been getting very particular about my coffee. This Cafe Du Monde is simply amazing! It has a bold rich taste without ANY hint of bitterness! This is such a wonderful flavor, it will replace my regular brand. I'm hooked. It won't replace my espresso, but it will cut it down quite a bit.....And, if you like your coffee iced, look no further. It is just as amazing! I have tried it so many different ways, but my favorite is with a little hazelnut creamer.....AWESOME! You have to try this!!!

These fudgy bites are quite good and they contain some fiber and protein to offset the sugar and fat.  This is a healthier alternative to cookies and real brownies!  What confounded me was that in the box I was sent; one bag had 8 bites and another had 15!  Feeling the remaining 3 bags, I noticed that some were small and another was packed full.  I'm hoping that since this is a new product, they still have some manufacturing kinks to work out.
I love this brands apple cider and looked forward to my first cup of lemonade. I was very disappointed. Very bitter and leaves a horrible aftertaste
The best part about Nespresso is their coffee is excellent.  This is a perfect variety pack, but I have to say my favorite is the green pack.

This does taste like lemonade...in particular the type of lemonade you get when mixing up something like "no sugar added" Crystal Light. It wasn't cloying sweet or tart which is exactly how I like my lemon beverages -- total middle ground.I drink coffee and tea and get a good mix of nutrients from my food. I can't say that this did anything different for me than those beverages and a diet. I felt the same as I do everyday, but I would imagine that a person who was under the weather or not eating well would feel a boost.

So, this is just a 15 day supply. The box says people who drank it for 60 days lost an average of 11 pounds. Well, I'm on day 10 and I've already lost 8 pounds (I am also eating right and doing VERY LIGHT exercise, walking my dog). No joke. I don't know how much I can attribute to the coffee, but hey, I'm drinking it and I'm losing weight!As far as taste goes, it's no Intelligensia fancy schmancy stuff. It's about as good as starbucks since they've revamped their roasts. It's palatable but nothing special. It's perfect for people who use K-cups: that is, people who need their coffee fast and don't care as much about how it's prepared.

I prefer black and green teas for everyday drinking, but when I need a nice smooth calming herbal tea, I go right for chamomile.  Not only does it soothe digestive issues, but it helps relax you--which is why chamomile is in some teas sold to make you have a good nighty-night.  Some brands mix their chamomile with other flavorings, but I prefer just the chamomile.  It has a nice floral quality to it and you don't need add anything to make it sweet unless you want to.  I tend to add a touch of honey, since honey is also so good for you.Please do follow the directions, though, and let this one steep for a good while so you will get the most quality and benefit out of the flowers.This is one of the better brands out there for chamomile tea, even besides the fact that its organic.  Well worth a little extra money to get.

I enjoyed the fresh taste of the sardines.  On top of them were about 3 jalapeno slices, as rings. The main taste was of the olive oil and the fish. Then, as you ate the sardines a jalapeno taste came through.I generally like bland foods, and sometimes find jalapenos too hot. However, these were just right - not too hot, with enough flavor to give a jalapeno taste.I put the sardines on top of half a baked potato and used the excess oil to mash into the potato.  A salad accompanied the dish, making an excellent dinner for two from one tin.If you are looking for food that tastes like a hot chili, forget it. If you are looking for some pep in sardines that are in oil, this is a tasty, convenient snack.The pull-ring on the tin makes it convenient to open - you don't need a tin-opener. The wrap covering the tin could be easier to pull off - it needs a clear indication of where to tear or a red plastic ribbon to pull it open. I opened it with scissors.The picture on the packaging is amusing - it looks like the fish come from Norway. In fact, my sardines came from Poland and were distributed from San Diego, California.PS After looking at Wikipedia and noting one reviewer said the fish were brisling. I found brisling are small sprats from Northern Europe.  Sardines and pilchards from places like Portugal and Monterey, CA are different fish. According to Wikipedia, sardines and pilchards belong to several fish families:  Dussumieria, Escualosa, Sardina (the European pilchard (true sardine) is Sardina pilchardus), Sardinella and Sardinops.  Brislings, sometimes called Brisling Sardines, are young sprats, Sprattus sprattus, a herring-like fish. So that explains why they don't taste like sardines.
summary: Fresh, jalapeno aftertaste, oily, quality sardines

reviewText: This was not your usual granola bar looking snack.  It was somewhat misshapen making it look more home made.  It was soft which was a plus.  I liked the coconut.  My son, two of my grandchildren and my wife did not like the coconut.  On first glance it seemed yummy, what is not to like about oat, chocolate and coconut?  Obviously in my family the coconut was a negative.  Son liked the taste but not the coconut. Wife didn't like the taste and neither did the 5 & 7 year old grandchildren.  If you are looking for a gluten free non-dairy snack and have no issues with coconut or calories this is a good choice.  The 180 calories put it about 40 calories higher than our favorite granola bar and 80 calories higher than my favorite snack bar.  Uber-sensitive son was dismayed with the lack of protein and he was concerned about the 9grams of fat.Wrapping it up, for a gluten free snack it is pretty good but if you are not concerned about gluten you probably will want a different snack.Addendum:the counter woman at my favorite pizza place is on a gluten free diet and loved them.  So that confirms it, as a gluten free snack it got the prize!
I like to have dried vegetables on hand for chili, soups and stews these jalapeno peppers add a zesty flavor to my cooking. I have not tried using them in other recipes yet.
Daughter loves these.  We prefer to give these to her than goldfish crackers.  They taste very good and are a good size snack.

What a great way to try a few different  flavors of these outstanding chocolates.We love Ghiradelli dark chocolate with fillers, especially mint.They are individually wrapped and the taste is the best.This bag makes a wonderful gift.

Really surprised me how much better and fluffier Snappy is from Orville Redenbacher. I could eat air popped popcorn every day - but the hulls bother my teeth, normally have to floss 2 times after eating Orville. Snappy has hardly any hulls at all - tastes great - I will never go back.

It's okay - a perfectly fine cup of coffee, but nothing exciting. I found that if I used about 30-40% more coffee than I would otherwise, it made a much better cup.You won't make yourself or your guests angry or disappointed by serving this, but you won't win any kudos, either, and I doubt any of them will ask for the brand name so they can go buy some.
summary: Okay, workable, fine coffee, but nothing special

reviewText: This tastes like I remember coffee tasting and has a wonderful aroma.  It comes in a box of 25 single serve pods that you just drop in your cup (the pods are marked with "this side down") and add hot water.  Let it steep for a few minutes then remove the pod and enjoy.  One Love is smooth and mild with a nutty coffee flavor.  I keep a box of it at work since each pod is individually sealed in a foil pouch.  That way, when I just can't stand another cup of "work" coffee, I brew up a cup of One Love and become the envy of all my friends.

This is awesome for when you really need your vitamins but don't have the time to do so. I love making this and taking it with me when I hang out with friends. Its got everything practically in it but the kitchen sink LOL.
summary: When you can't eat your veggies

reviewText: I loved these fruit snacks so much, despite a few negatives. Let's start with the negatives: There is no uniformity between packages. While some may have 3 banana pieces, others may have only 1. They all have roughly 8 fruit snacks in them. Surprisingly, some packages were sealed very tightly and others had big pockets of air. I'm not sure why this is but I imagine that the shelf life with the puffy packets would be lower than the tightly-sealed ones. The winning combination of the preservative-free snacks and their awesome flavors makes these fruit snacks an excellent product. This is real fruit with no extra sugar.They are a healthy snack and they taste like real fruit! These have a different consistency and are not the gummy-like unnatural consistency of regular fruit snacks. I'm not sure if you're willing to pay a bit more for these snacks, but they are healthier and much tastier than regular fruit snacks.

I've tried both the original unflavored powder and this chocolate one. And also other products.One other reviewer said that this is just the unflavored powder plus a hint of chocolate and doesn't taste that much better. I disagree. These things are never meant to satisfy tastebuds, but the chocolate one is still much easier to drink down than the original. It has just enough chocolateness to distract you from the otherwise very healthy and grass-y flavor (though freshly juiced wheatgrass is still much stronger).  I can just mix this with water and it goes down easy enough, unlike the original flavor, where I really have to force myself swallow or mix it with juice/protein shake to ease up the taste.As for the effectiveness, I really don't feel any energy-boost from it. However after two month and 3 cans of this stuff (2 chocolate ones and 1 unflavored), I can tell that my skin has a healthier look, and I in general feel cleansed internally and mentally. One of the most noticeable effect is that I poop a lot better with this. I'm not like constipated or anything, but this stuff takes it to another level. When my first can ran out I didn't restock for a month because I was sprouting alfalfas and thought that that plus some occasional wheatgrass shots would be good enough. However, during that month I could tell what my body missed without this stuff, so I immediate subscribed on amazon again.In general if you don't eat a lot of vegetables and fruits, you will find having this powder in your diet does help a lot. Even if you already do, this is still a nice add-on. The hint of chocolate is very helpful in making this healthy drink more drinkable. I recommend this.
summary: Much better tasting than the unflavored one.

reviewText: This marzipan is extremely sweet (too sweet) and doesn't have any fruit flavor. The coloring is all artificial. It's too processed and not fresh...try buying locally instead.
I really can't write a good note on this coffee because I only drink d-caf coffee "black."  This was purchased for my husband and he said it is the best Hazelnut Coffee he has ever tasted.

My husband thinks Tone's bases are the best thing invented.  He uses stock in almost everything and likes this product much better than the liquid stocks on the shelf and thinks these are so good that he hasn't make any stock from scratch since he discovered them.

I'm another one who fell for the beautiful picture of blueberry and acai berries and chocolate on the bag and the wholesome sounding "Dark Chocolate Acai with blueberry" in the title.  I know, I should have read the ingredients.  But seriously, how can companies get away with labeling their bag with a title that claims it contains actual fruit?These are nothing more than fruit gummy type substances covered in chocolate.  The ingredients list lists a bunch of concentrated fruit juices and pectin (to gel it), corn syrup and canola oil, covered in chocolate.They are tasty, as most candy is, but don't be fooled into thinking you're eating something healthy.  Each 1/4 cup (about 10 balls) contains 180 calories, 29g carbs, 25g sugars, and 7g fat (4g saturated fat).  The addition of citric acid ups the vitamin C in each serving to 20% daily value, which is about the only redeeming value in this package.

Awesome flavor, great nutritional content, organic and gluten-free. Can't ask for more!! I add this to my protein shake each morning and get an added burst of energy from the greens. Also amazing how it eases out the bowel movements.
They are convenient and I have used Lipton for a  very long time. Sometimes I mix a little bit of Lipton Green Tea with it.
I like the flavor but I prefer a chewier texture; these nearly melt in my mouth (so they're gone too fast).

This seaweed snack is slightly salty and slightly sweet. A very balanced combination of the two. They, being seaweed, are a little bit fishy-tasting, but not any worse than a piece of nori paper on your sushi. The only issue I have with the snack is that the pieces are truly crumbles. They come in a small dish, which keeps them contained, so they aren't too messy. I just grab little pinches of them and put them into my mouth.... sort of like eating popcorn (but smaller). They also look oily, but really aren't. The flavor is good and clean tasting. I will definitely continue purchasing this item.
These are really good chips!  they are thin and crisp and taste so good.  Take advantage of this because there are not a lot of really good ones.

Rooibos tea is great for healing skin conditions but it's also great for your mental health.  I'm always so nervous and anxious and chamomille tea is not as great tasting and calming to me as rooibos tea.  The great thing about this tea is that you can benefit from this wonderful medicinal herb without it tasting like the usual flowery herbs (like licorice, flowery herbs/roots/leaves, mint, hibiscus, rosehips, etc.) which is what i hate about Celestial Seasonings Tea and why i moved away from Twinings blackcurrant tea when they changed the formula.  I used to drink Twinings blackcurrant tea regularly until they changed the formula to something bitter & stronger with the strange yucky tasting floral herbal components.  Then I switched to rooibos tea because of the health/taste benefits and found Twinings to be the cheapest locally.  I buy mine at my local Walgreen's for the cheapest local price, but it looks like you get a more bargain deal here on Amazon.  It tastes like mellow nutty hay and you don't really need much sweetener to sweeten it up.  Double your health benefits by adding raw organic honey.  The longer you steep it, the more the herb tea will seep out its benefits.  I've heard bathing in it regularly will heal skin conditions.  The best rooibos teas (in teabag form) in the US i've tasted with attractive packaging I'd give as a gift to a friend are the artistic "NUMI" and hearty "Republic of Tea" rooibos teas but they're much more expensive.

I have been reading a lot about turmeric and the positive effects its has on the body, we used it on a pork roast yesterday and it tasted wonderful.  It taste like a murky ginger, not hot or peppery but I would recommend to people who just don't like spicy flavors.  Would buy this again and again -

I normally opt for microwave popcorn, but when I got the opportunity to try the Kernel Season popping corn I decided to give it a try.  Here's my pros and cons:Pros:1. It's easier to adjust seasonings/butter than microwave popcorn.  If you're dieting (who isn't?) you can carefully control how much butter or margarine to put in it.2.  It's a heck of a lot of fun to make.  My 15 year old son hung around to watch the popping process.  The instructions tell you to use a "large pan."  Trust them on that:  the recommended serving of 1/2 cup corn fully occupied my dutch oven.3.  The popcorn tastes good.4. Can be used while backpacking/camping, or any place where it's hard to lug a microwave.Cons:1.  Messier than microwave popcorn; you're going to have an oily large pan to clean up.2. Slightly more time-consuming.Overall, I'm pretty lazy when it comes to popcorn, so I suspect that most of the time I'd grab the microwave bags.  But if I'm out camping or I want to give small kids a thrill, this popcorn serves the need nicely.

Bear Creek has some great soups!  I tried potato before and love it. The wild rice is the best!! I make my own soups and I'm so happy with these. Very creamy and tasty! I broiled some chicken pieces and put in my last batch with veggies for a casserole .. Can't wait to try more.

BTW, I'm eating the Chili flavored Ramen as I'm typing this, lol :)Creamy Chicken used to be my favorite until I came across this Chili flavored.I am not a big lover on spicy foods but boy, these are amazing :DJust enough hotness to make my face a little hot but that doesn't stop me from digging into a bowl of these yummy ramen noodles!Flavor is perfect!But they are spicy enough that you do need a drink next to your bowl, lolTry these! Soooo good!

reviewerName: J. W. Kennedy "in statu uiae et meriti"
reviewText: In the jar this stuff is a white, oleaginous solid.  It looks like Crisco but it's a bit harder & "flakier" when you scoop it out.  It melts around 75 degrees Fahrenheit, so it can be used wherever you would use shortening or lard - but this is presumably far healthier than either.  It has no discernible odor or flavor.  It just makes things oily.  Everybody knows it's fats that make food delicious!  I will definitely use this.  I made a batch of my special tofu curry, for which I usually use canola oil - I used this coconut oil instead and the results tasted exactly the same.  The label claims that coconut oil has a very long shelf life, which is good because usually I'm cooking for just one person, and I've had containers of oil & shortening go rancid before I was able to use it all.  Too bad Vine reviews have to be posted in a timely manner, or I'd wait a year to let you know how my jar of coconut oil has held up.  Maybe if I remember, I'll post an edit.  Until then I consider this product to be "perfect" and extremely useful as advertised.

As others have said, these r great energy bars! Great "keepers" too - we keep a box at r cabin, and another stashed in r emergency supplies under the bed. Each bar has 240 calories, (120 calories r fat) 2 gr sat fat, zero trans ft, 90 mg sodium, 190 mg potassium, 21carbs, & 8 gr protein. Contents listed as: peanuts, sugar, corn syrup, salt, peanut oil, and preservatives - TBHQ & citric acid.

I have been purchasing Zevia products for a couple of years.  Ever since they were recommended for being caffeine free, sugar free (sweetened with all natural stevia).  I have kicked the soda pop habit, but every once in a while...  It's nice to have a Zevia Cola over ice.  Very satisfying.
I love these large size cola gummies even more than the regular size ones!  If you love the chewy gummy texture, you probably can't stop eating them!  Not too sweet, just PERFECT!
summary: If you LOVE gummies, this is IT!

reviewText: I picked these up on the Amazon Warehouse for a pittance, and was not expecting a whole lot. Very surprised to find that they are really quite good! The texture is soft and chewy, and the flavor is very good -- just the right amount of cinnamon, and the raisins are actually there rather than (as is sometimes the case) just raisin bits.Each cookie is individually wrapped making them easy to take along for an on-the-go snack.While it won't stand up to a home-baked oatmeal cookie, for a store-bought cookie it's quite good. Definitely worth getting, especially if there is a price dip.
